Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisaa222
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic weekend in the Westin Grand! The interior is quite spectacular and the rooms are spacious with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on! Location is perfect for visiting Berlin, easy walking distance to all the main attractions!

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3.5”
Reviews.Author: gilbertandjames
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this a 3.5 rating. It is above average, but I wouldn't say that it was "very good". This is a nice property, located conveniently at the junction of Friedrichstrasse and Unter den Linden and within walking distance of most East Berlin attractions. It is pretty outside and inside, especially the cute indicator above the lift that showed which floor the lift was at. I didn't like that the bathroom was way too small - virtually no counter space at all. I also didn't like that the hotel has no parking. There used to be a parking structure across the road but it is now being demolished. We had to park in a basement carpark about 3 blocks away, which is quite far by Berlin standards. This was inconvenient especially as we visited during a cold spell. They should provide free valet parking given the circumstances, OR a shuttle (or horse-drawn carriage) to take you up and down the street. If you are staying here and would like to go for a workout they provide gym attire so you don't have to bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: moncic
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at this hotel and was very surprised that they somehow deleted all my info from my previous stay so I had to fill out the stupid form again. The bed was too soft so you almost sink in the bed which is not very comfortable. Don't know what happened to the "heavenly bed" they had last time around. To charge almost 20eur for the use of sauna is redicilous, this must be included in the price. Same thing with the internet. So count on an extra 40 euro per night if you want the sauna and internet. Otherwise location is good, room is good etc. Will probably try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, first rate champagne breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jacbalt
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed four glorious days at this hotel. In the Mitte, The Westin Grand is perfectly located at Friedrichsrasse and Unter den Linden. The buses between Alexanderplatz and the Zoo Station (100 and 200 buses) board at this intersection. Public transportation is easy to do. You buy your tickets on the bus (2.30 is a normal fare within in the city center) So do the tourist buses with commentary, the double decker hop on/hop off buses. We had a junior suite and had two bathrooms - a half bath and a wonderful full bath with two sinks and with fabulous shower. Hotel is just two blocks from the beautiful Gendarmarkt Square with Cathedrals and Concert hall (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gendarmenmarkt) and bistros and brasseries along its streets. The Brandenburg Gate, German History Museum, Opera, Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe, The Kenndey Museum, Humboldt University, Museum Island, Galeries Lafayette, Checkpoint Charlie and the Duetsch Guggenheim Gallery (http://www.deutsche-guggenheim.de/index_en.php) are all within an easy walking distance (under 6 blocks). We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet and service each day. We'd choose among sparkling wines, extensive variety of foods/baked goods and fruit, eggs to order. What a lovely way to start each day and preparing for the 'hard work' of being a good tourist! We were very pleased with the service and helpfulness of the concierge team. Always friendly and helpful, they were ready with answers for every little question.

Reviews.Title: “Expected 5 stars, received 4”
Reviews.Author: Mifiki
Reviews.Content: Well, I wanted the experience of a Junior Suite in a 5 stars hotel. Didn't get it. Not the furniture, not the decoration, not the service, not the bathroom ( again, for that price, shouldn't we get a bathtub?) When I asked, on the night of our arrive, ( it was late, after 22.00 ) THEY DIDN'T HAVE ANY, but at 7 o'clock in the morning, next day, they had. We didn't want all the fuss of changing so we stayed with the original one. They kept forgetting to replace towels, my mascara was no where to be find, the magnifying mirror was not magnifying enough. On the night of our arrival we found a plate of fruits and another with water and lemon. Several days after, the lemon became all green and nasty and we had to throw it out by ourselves. Small details, but when you are paying for 5 stars, that details should be taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service - but lacks character”
Reviews.Author: Fulhamish
Reviews.Content: The reviews rightly praise the hotel's location bang at the centre of town. It's a superb jumping off point with 5 minutes to the S-Bahn at Friedrichstrasse (25 mins to Schonefeld Airport) and one minute to buses up and down Unter den Linden (number 100 and 200). Built in the soulless days of the German Democratic Republic, some of that era's DNA remains within the great slab of the establishment's featureless exterior. There's no Berlin feel to it but the friendly and helpful reception and concierge staff will advise on everything from your budget's restaurant choice through to the best routes around town. Rooms are comfy. TV in at least six languages including Sky News, CNN, ESPN. Breakfast is a buffet banquet. A cup of tea (with fancy biscuits) in the downstairs lobby is 8 euros. A beer is 6. But, in this day and age, dear Starwood/Westin hotels, why charge 19 euros per day for wifi? How anachronistic is that?

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in berlin”
Reviews.Author: RoseG64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin a few years ago and wanted to return as we enjoyed it so much. The rooms are good and the beds very comfortable. The central location of the hotel makes it very convenient for getting around and the U-Bahn is only 2 minutes away. The food at the Westin is excellent, but the only complaint I have is that there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. This is a real nuisance as it’s quite costly to pay the hotel prices if you fancy a drink in your room. We didn’t use the pool or spa facilities this trip but colleagues did and said they were very good. We also ate out for breakfast which is easy to do and much cheaper than the 30euros per person charge. However if you do have breakfast it is wonderful as a special treat. Overall a lovely hotel in a central location with very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, nice rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: kpb1nv
Reviews.Content: Great location. This was our 2nd trip to Berlin and we used our SPG points for the room. Looking at the normal rates we would have paid full rate considering location. We were given a garden facing room which was nice as it was quiet. The staff was very friendly and always available. Our only complaint is that the room was very, very warm, even with the heat off. We had to leave the window open on and off throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: STEPDI
Reviews.Content: This has been my 3rd trip this year to Berlin and as always, the Westin Grand did not fail to deliver. Outstanding service, great rooms with one of the best Breakfast Buffets on offer. The Theme Suites are spacious and very comfortable. The possibility to borrow the gym gear is a fantastic idea and the quality of the shoes and clothing is top rate. Very informal atmosphere, the lobby bar invites for a relaxed drink in the evening and can at times get rather busy, especially when the theatre next door finishes. Many good restaurants and easy access to all the main sites in the City. Great Value for Money.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have chosen a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Edelvisr
Reviews.Content: Without knowing the city, my husband spent hours on the Internet trying to decide where to go...and we did absolutely great! Location could not have been better, nice room, great breakfast, great bed!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: gandg100
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Westin for 5 nights to celebrate her birthday. The hotel is centrally placed and very convenient for many sights. The breakfast buffet is amazing, and the staff very helpful and friendly. If you usually stay in lesser places, once you get used to having a 'turn down service' which often included replacing face flannels, you can sit back and bask in luxury (or lie back on the exremely comfortable, very large beds.) This is the first hotel we have stayed in where we haven't been able to hear other people's plumbing. I don't know how they do it but it was a real treat not to be disturbed by the usual showering/bathing noises.The concierge was extremely helpful in arranging our visit to the Reichstag. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best of berlin within your reach”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizenParis
Reviews.Content: LOCATION This hotel is situated in the best location for sightseing as one can walk to the Bundestag (book in advance), Brandeburg tor, Tiergarden, museum minsel (book on the internet to avoid hours of queue), AlexanderPlatz, checkpoint Charlie, Postdammerplatz and Gendarmenmarkt. To acess it from Tegel Airport , the best option is the TXL bus (30 mn). Follow the bus sign in the airport , the TXL is located under sign post 2 . Don’ bother queuing at the single vending machine as tickets(2,3 euros) can be bought from the driver . This bus get crowded fast with the numerous luggages of travellers . If you’re not alone , one should buy the tickets while the other enters the bus by the middle or back door to secure seats and luggage emplacement. Exit the bus at “unter den Linder/ friedrichstrasse” stop which is right after the “brandeburg” stop. Then cross Friedrichstrasse , the building in front of you is the Westin but the entrance is located on another corner that can be accessed by going down Friedrichstrasse for a few meters. When travelling by subway , the closest station is Fransosichestrasse and NOT Friedrischstrasse (as can be expected). HOTEL The lobby is quite spectacular as others have mentioned. The check in was smooth but devoid of warmth. The room was ready and we were upgraded to a garden room despite having booked with hotels.com for 100 euros a night. The room is as comfortable as can be expected from a 5 stars but with no ‘wow” factor . The hotel is a little old even though furniture and appliance are recent, and wear and tear is showing on the doors mainly (crooked security chain fixation, chipped bottom..) but nothing really significant . I had trouble sleeping but cannot really tell if the bed is to blame for that. There is no tea and coffee facility in the room and no ice in the corridor, unlike the Hilton a few blocks away. The garden view is wonderful as one wakes up in the morning to the sound of birds and the street noises are totally blocked out. The garden itself is huge with plenty of chairs and tables to enjoy a drink, weather permitting. The spa area is quite nice with a powerful jaccuzi , a round swimming pool and a well equipped if small gym (power plate, two treadmill, other cardio training apparatus, free weights , water is available) . The area is noisy especially when shared with children The hotel rents bicycles. Although internet is expensive, there is a single computer dedicated to airline check in (cannot access any other website than you airline company which you select from a menu). We did not have food at the hotel. There is a supermarket INSIDE the Friedrischstrasse subway station which can be found further up on Friedrichstasse (cross Unter den Linden and continue for 3 blocks) If interested in typical German food in a typical German restaurant close to the hotel , try Alt-Berliner Kneipe, 55 Mittlestrasse (off Friedrichstrasse on the left ,next treet after crossing unter den Linden) This hotel is highly recommended , 5 star luxury for a small price

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CAHoya
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Berlin with my husband and 6 other friends to run the Berlin Half Marathon. While we originally wanted to rent an apartment, it became clear that with our group, a hotel was going to work best. My husband chose The Westin largely because he's a major SPG fan. However, I think his choice couldn't have been more perfect. The location is excellent - literally blocks from the Brandenburg Gate, the metro, and an easy walk to so many other places. We took a cab from TXL; other friends found the train an easy ride from the other airport. The Westin is also a short cab ride from the main train station. Our room was on the courtyard side of the building, so it was very quiet. As always, the bed was heavenly, and the toiletries were the same as you'd find at any other Westin. The room itself was on the smaller side, but I think that might be normal for Europe. Within blocks of the hotel, you'll also find a drugstore, a coffee shop (with free wifi), and a Bugatti dealer (for the travel essentials...). Only complaint was that we couldn't find a grocery store or something of the like to procure some bananas or other pre-race food/snacks. If we ever come back to Berlin, I'd definitely consider the Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: travelmadmum
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel so near the metro station and also main line station Friedrichstrasse was convenient for our arrival - a direct train from Schonefeld airport and a 4 minute walk. It was also great as a base for sightseeing. We sat down to eat in the restaurant at 11pm and were certainly not the only ones there. Our room was average sized but luxurious with a great bathroom and very quiet. We used the spa and pool both of which were excellent. My only quibble is the ridiculously high rate for wifi. We didn't bother with it as virtually all cafes have free wifi and sell delicious cakes and coffee to consume while you're using it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DMLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Westin Grand in March and enjoyed the stay very much. It provided a very well-located base to explore much of Berlin's diverse cultural offerings. Within easy walking distance are some of the world's great museums, as well as numerous WWII memorials. The rear of the hotel is on Unter den Linden, Berlin's most famous street. U-Bahn and S-Bahn public transport is steps away and therefore ultra convenient. There are also excellent restaurants and shopping within walking distance. More specifically, our hotel room and bathroom were top notch - clean, spacious and comfortable. The breakfast buffet, although very expensive, was outstanding - one of the best I've ever seen. The concierge staff was extremely helpful and went out of their way to make excellent recommendations. The one negative was having dinner at the hotel. The food was mediocre and expensive, but that was easily solved by not eating dinner there again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience grandeur and history with a contemporary setting”
Reviews.Author: Shuksey
Reviews.Content: Located in the affluent part of Berlin's Freidrichstrasse, this SPG hotel formerly known as The Grand Hotel Berlin has been given a fresh new touch of contemporary by Westin. A grand staircase is the centerpiece of the lobby, one could feel almost as if the man himself was gonna trot down at any second along with his entourage. But in the evening, it morphs into another feature attraction where subtle colours are projected onto the staircase to transform the lobby into a ambient lounge with music such as Garden by the Totally Enormous Extinct Dinosaurs playing in the background. Ist gail! The rooms are standard European size featuring the Westin Heavenly Beds and the usuals. There are standard and feature suites such as Spa suites, for those who are into wellness and fitness. This is a completely non-smoking hotel so smoking is only permitted outside the lobby where tables and ashtrays are provided. However, some rooms and suites have balconies so either request for one, or opt to smoke in the room and pay EUR100 so they can rid the tobacco smell after.

Reviews.Title: “When will they finish the street construction outside the hotel?”
Reviews.Author: shoepeddler
Reviews.Content: I mention the street construction outside the hotel because inside the hotel there is nothing but hospitality and superior service. Clearly, the management has set a standard very very high and the staff has responded with great accomplishment. Bravo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueski09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Mitte district very close to train and bus transport and within walking distance of the Brandenberg Gate. The interior is beautifully designed with a lavish staircase and comfortable rooms and it was very clean. The beds are 'Heavenly', although we found it became hot during the night, possibly due to the cover on the mattress. The staff were attentive, but the service not quite up to that of a five star hotel. Reception would not handle our departure flight check-in. Instead we were directed to the computer to do it ourselves and pay 7 Euros to do so. At 19 Euros a day the internet was the most expensive we have ever encountered, and we are regular travellers. Surely wifi should be freely available now? Breakfast was also very expensive, but there are cafes locally, notably Cafe Einstein on Unter Den Linden and a lovely bakery down Friedrichstrasse which is also open on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Just the finest hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Dennis C
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Berlin was made special by selecting the right accommodation. The Hotel upgraded our room from having booked on the internet and could not have done enough to make our stay enjoyable. The location was central to our travel plans making our Berlin experience most enjoyable indeed. dennis C.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bjcox
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at a very good rate at the Westin Grand. The hotel is magnificent - and is definitely in a great position (right next to Unter den Linden and very close to Gendarmenmarkt). The beds were, as other reviews have mentioned, literally heavenly and most staff were very attentive. However, one night in the Lobby Bar I had a bit of a problem with one of the bar staff there who got my order wrong, but then blamed me for it. When she went to replace my drink, she came back with the drink which she said they had none of in the first place. Bizarre. But I was not happy in the rude manner in which I was spoken to! Despite this, The Westin Grand is a wonderful hotel and I would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A grade A hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: wpj26
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Westin Grand Hotel in Berlin for 4 nights and were pleased overall with the service and room. We had a King room in the new wing of the hotel, room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Location is tops, close to many things like museums, monuments and shopping. I highly recommend this hotel for your next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Oh heavenly beds”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Grand for three nights while on business. As many others have noted, its a great location. Close to more than a few major sites- walking distance to checkpoint charlie, museum island, and others. Well situated near shopping. The hotel is quite nice- overall rooms were very quiet and well appointed. As always, the Westin heavenly beds are super comfortable. The breakfast at the hotel is comprehensive to say the least. Lots of choices, all really well done. The hotel has an interesting lobby/bar/restaurant area and at night the lighting turns purple and the music gets a little louder. Wasn't entirely my style, but not a big deal. Staff were great. I would certainly consider a return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EJTH
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of old East Berlin this hotel is centrally located and within easy walking distance, or subway ride, to most of the key spots you'd want to visit. Our 4th floor room was well appointed and faced a large internal garden. It was very quiet, so much so that we spent several nights with the French doors open to get some fresh air and couldn't hear the traffic. We did not eat in the hotel, preferring to explore local cafes and restaurants. There are only 2 minor areas of concern both of which are not going to stop me staying here again but worth noting all the same. First, we were very disappointed with the service in the ground floor bar. The young waiting staff were more interested in talking to each other at the bar than serving guests and we were not the only people having trouble ordering a second drink or asking for the bill. A little more attention to the customer would have gone down well and we may have spent more! And secondly, the pillows would have to be the worst ones I have ever had in a Westin hotel (and I spent 150+ nights in hotels last year, many of them Westins), even though their Heavenly bed was indeed heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: capecoraljay
Reviews.Content: This is a top of the line hotel in the heart of Berlin. Perfectly located, with the subway right around the corner and just a few steps away from the Brandenburg Gate. The rooms are beautifully decorated, well equipped and the heavenly Westin Bed is legendary already. The breakfast buffet is almost overwhelming. Chefs on duty to create your individual choice of eggs. The only thing I do criticize is the steep price of the internet which I think should be complimentary these days. Other than that: this is a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well located in shopping district, nice place”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located close to shopping district, sightseeing areas and has subway connection a few steps away. Friendly staff, nice rooms and the fantastic Westin bed. Nothing to say against this place, I enjoyed the place and especially the charme and the atmosphere they maintained from the past.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: went to this hotel with my parents as a birthday treat, was beyond lovely, worth the 5 stars, not over priced for what you get. the beds, oh the beds, they are definitely 'heavenly' i was attempting to figure out a way to take the mattress home with me!! worth it just for those beds! very close to everything, twenty minute walk to the flea markets on a sunday, 5-10 minutes for most other attractions. the zoo was a bit further out and we were feeling lazy and got a taxi, that was only 10 euros. and to the airport was about 20 euros each way! all the staff are very friendly, and the breakfasts were amazing! i literally have nothing bad to say about the hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in center of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ieasabel
Reviews.Content: Located just next to Franzosiche Strabe subway station. As it is in the center it is in middle way and the same distance from Tegel and BER ( Berlin Brandenburg opening JUN 2012) I was for BBB and it is few subway station from Tempelhof airport ( main event place in Berlin). Around there is a lot of stores ( fashion especially). I take it as a free night reward from SPG loyality program. There is pool and gym but I do not use it:( The hotel is huge, the staff was good and pleasant. Maybe not so eloquent and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Recommanded for pleasure and business”
Reviews.Author: SP MD 2
Reviews.Content: We had a two day conference at the hotel. We have these kind of meetings about 3 times per year at different locations in Europe. We choose the Westin Grand Berlin because of its location in Berlin, the good reviews and because the offer/meeting room met our budget and needs. Once the decision on venue was made, the biggest challenge in the organisational phase was getting information/answers from the sales manager who seemed to be overworked. This is the first meeting where I did not get to meet the sales manager and where there was no follow-up of the sales manager during and after the meeting on how everything was going. Nevertheless, we were in very good hands as all our wishes during the meeting were fulfilled thanks to the wonderful catering staff and especially thanks to Frau Kiki who was very accommodating to all our needs. Thank you very much, Frau Kiki! You made this meeting a success! I would absolutely recommand the Westin Grand Berlin for business meetings and for pleasure. Location is great, within walking distance of the Brandenburger Tor, Checkpoint Charlie, many shops, malls, restaurants and bars. Breakfast can be taken in the hotel or there are plenty of breakfast places in Friedrichstrasse. The hotel lobby is beautiful and impressive. There are plenty of tables and comfy seating to have something to eat or do some work on your computer. The guest room is spacious and clean; the bed is truly heavenly, the bathroom has nice toiletries and the shower is great. No need to bring your own hair dryer as the Westin's one works just great! Minor complaints: rather expensive internet fee and the room was a bit too hot during the night. will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the heart of the museum district. The staff are very friendly and courteous - also knowledgable and helpful. The breakfast buffet is superb with a vast amount of choices. Dinner menu also good. I will recommend the Westin to anyone I know who is going to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting friends in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AnhandEm
Reviews.Content: The Westin was in a great location. We were only minutes walking distance away from the Brandenburg Gate and many other attractions. There were plenty of restaurants around the corner as well as cafes and trinket shops. The staff was very helpful and friendly and actually helped us out when we forgot some clothes when we checked out. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Such an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: MJCMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed back in December and still cannot sing the praises of this hotel enough. They really have something special.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with service flaws”
Reviews.Author: gadflyparexcellence
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying in this hotel. Overall, the service, food and attention to detail I found to be on par with best in class hotels. Also, the hotel is very close to many of the main attractions of the city (within walking distance). One important incidence however left a bitter taste in my mouth. Before going to bed one night I requested an early morning wake up call with the appropriate hotel staff. I emphasized that I had to attend a very important business breakfast meeting in the morning, and that they should not forget to wake me up. I was given emphatic assurances that there should not be any problem. Lo and behold, I never received a wake up call from the hotel staff, woke up late and missed my meeting! When I called the hotel staff to ask why I was not awakened, I was told by the person answer. When I pressed to state that the phone could not have rung as it was right to my bed and that I was a light sleeper, she then changed the story to mention that she did try to call me, but that ended up receiving a message that I had already checked out. I found this to be inexcusable. I did have the nagging feeling that something was not right and that something was missing. This person could have easily verified with the front desk if I had indeed checked out! It was really embarrassing to later apologize to my business contacts for not being able to live up to my commitment. I never received any apology or even a call from any of the hotel staff to offer any regrets on this oversight! This was the only time this happened to me during all of my business travels across various countries

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scooterkid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Westin Grand for one night this January, for business during Trade Fairs time - so capacity and Berlin itself was to the full limit.This said the Westin and its staff ensured that the hotel was an oasis of efficient and friendly calm. The hotel is located not far from the action of hip and happening Mitte and is well located for a variety of shops and cafes. Check-in was fast efficient and friendly, the room I had was large spacious and clean, the only small draw back was that during the night the room temperature was a little too warm and it was impossible to turn down the heat, it also seemed that my colleagues had the same experience during their stay too. Still this is a minor point. The bathroom was also large, clean and the shower had good water pressure. The style of the rooms is not really hip and happening and is the standard/typical 'Corporate' style room, this said it was no big deal for me as everything was clean and worked!! I did not have breakfast in the room so can't comment on that, but did have drinks in the lobby bar which was fine for a quick catch up with colleagues before setting off for dinner. The service was good and the drinks and small bar snacks were tasty. The check out experience was also good, fast, efficient and smooth. I would definitely stay here again for business, though if I was visiting the city for personal reasons, I would probably go for a hotel that was slightly smaller and with a more contemporary style.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: chrrul
Reviews.Content: Pretty much as you would expect a Westin to be, only the cleanliness in the bathroom let the hotel down a bit. Pool is on the small side and round in shape, so not very suitable for an extensive morning swim.

Reviews.Title: “Titanic Like”
Reviews.Author: GSP67
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin Berlin during the New Years holiday for 4 nights. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Some of the highlights include, great location, tremendous service, breakfast buffet. Can't point to anything negative. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LKG_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is indeed grand - I loved the lobby design - a mix of old world and contemporary styles. The hotel is in a fabulous location, 5-10 minutes walking from the Brandenburg Gates, super close to the metro system making it easy to get around the city, and right near a stop for the double decker sight seeing buses. The staff was friendly and helpful, though I didn't have much interaction aside from check-in/check-out. The room service was decent, nothing special (I've had some fantastic food in Westins before). The bed was super comfy, everything was clean & nice, and I enjoyed the comfy lobby area. The pool, however, was a disappointment. It's more like a relaxation pool, not suitable for swimming which was totally disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: sbhs
Reviews.Content: nice hotel but impatient staff with little motivation to please customers. we checked in and they did not have our booked room available, basically made us pay extra to upgrade. neither the westin or spg seemed to mind this was out of the ordinary when we tried to argue this. the concierge was impatient with our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in center of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ksiazemati
Reviews.Content: The hotel has perfect location - just on exit of metro station Franzosiche Strabe. Form here to Tempelhof is straight way by metro using only 1 line. It is not near the Tegel airport but maybe from new BBI ( Berlin Brandenburg it will be closer). The customer service was very quick and it was not crowdy thanks to their quick work. Hotel has plenty of rooms. The pool and gym are ok. Even deluxe rooms are spacious. You do not here noise by the door but maybe if You have city view You may here sth. - because of not full soundproof windows. During the BBB or some events the hotel is making too high rates for room - everpriced. There is good restaurant and bar at the lobby. There is no free wifi or park lots. I really recomend and for sure I will stay here more often.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBurl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very large and somewhat lacking in atmosphere. However, there are some good points. The location close to Unter den Linden, Gendarmenmarkt and the shops on Friedrichstrasse is fantastic. It's also easy to get a taxi and the u-bahn is just a few steps from the hotel entrance. Service was helpful and friendly. There is also a decent sized swimming pool. The rooms, however, are a little small and characterless, although there appears to have been an attempt to smarten them up. The public areas are dark and, we found, a little depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: DominicBathEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best part of town and has so much going for it. There is a tube station a minute away and a taxi rank outside. It backs onto a huge garden so a room at the back is tranquil although i heard no external noise once during my 3 night stay.The young man who checked me in on january 4th told me that he had seved his apprenticeship at the hotel. He was so kind and helpful . Like everyone else i met in Berlin he spoke flawless English.My room was large with a fine bathroom and crisp bed.Just a few steps down the road facing the Galerie Lafayette department store is the Einstein cafe which did good coffee and breakfast pastries. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Houston3214
Reviews.Content: All that you would expect from Westin but more. Great location, close to most areas you need to be. View was a bit challenged due to the other similarly sized buildings. Breakfast was extensive and delicious. Gracious hotel without being too stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Very central - kind of greedy”
Reviews.Author: OsloMarianne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Berlin together with another couple to visit our 20 year old student daughter, and we wanted to pay a little extra to live central and comfortable, And the hotel was both; central and with a nice room / bathroom and very good beds. The Reseption and the bar was also very beautiful - but not to many visiting the bar, mostly elderly people. And we must admit we had the feeling of "greediness".from the beginning to the end. The first thing happening when arriwing was the receptionist trying to persuade us to book another and more luxurious room than the one we had already paid for. The breakfast was absolutely fantastic - but worth that wild price? I dont think so. The swimming area was just loverly - but paying 8 Euro extra to make the staff unlock the sauna? Thats ridiculous! And then extra charge for internett and extra for this and extra for that - whats the point? I guess it is to earn a little extra, but I also think it is the wrong way - we will not go back, and not recommand it to others either and neihter will our friends. We are travelling a lot and we live in Oslo wich is absolutely an expencive place, but this hotel? Central and nice beds but not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabioldn
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for this top quality hotel. Only negative side are the extras which are super expensive (e.g. wireless 20euro a day) I guess that is to compensate the good price they are offering the rooms at. Staff super helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: AngelaSch
Reviews.Content: This was a great value hotel - perfect location with good sized rooms and bathroom. Would definitely stay here again. It is walking distance to many of the key sights of Berlin including the Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island and Checkpoint Charlie. Staff were pleasant and helpful - what you would expect from a Westin Grand.

Reviews.Title: “4 star lux at 2.5 star price!”
Reviews.Author: msviv
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Central location and wonderful rooms at unbelievable price. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: tamsin8782
Reviews.Content: This is a great, luxury hotel in the heart of Berlin. The location is fantastic and all the main sites are within walking distance. The rooms are large and very comfortable, the beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept in! The bathroom is a good size and was very clean as was the rest of the room. The pool is great and they have a bar by the pool in case you want to relax with a drink as well. There is also a nice jacuzzi. We had back massages which were also very good and the spa facilities are excellent although as would be expected in a hotel like this they are not cheap. The staff were all great and very friendly and made this a very enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: K_townYorkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand for three days after Xmas. We have stayed there before, in 1998, and it still has the splendor its name suggests. As you walk into the reception you see the grandest of staircases coming down from the 1st floor. We had a room on the 4th floor, it was fine, a little warm, but hey that is better than being too cold! It is, literally, 20 meters from the U-Bahn station, a five minute walk from the G'markt and closer to Unter den Linden, 5 mins from the Brandenburger Gate. It is a short bus ride, three stops to Alexanderplatz, which is the heart of Old Berlin and a 10 minute bus ride round the sites, (Bus No 100 from Unter den Linden) from the Berlin Zoo and the West End shops on the Ku'damm. Would I go again-Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: meikdahogo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely 3 nights' stay at this great hotel. At the reception a friendly lady looked at our reservation and told us that she could give us a slightly bigger room if we were happy with two separate beds instead of a Queen-sized one; furthermore we would then be on the top floor (6th), and facing Friedrichstrasse with a side-view of Unter den Linden as well. This turned out to be a good choice and we applaud the service! The room was big enough for the limited purpose a hotel room has when you are visiting a city, and the room was in perfect order as well as spotless clean. Apparently we were not in one of the recently renovated rooms (as far as I understand from other reviews, we had room 641) but at no time did we have a feeling that renewal was necessary: on the contrary, really: The Westin Grand gave us our first hotel room with a totally quiet Minibar fridge! Breakfast was just fantastic, we couldn't wish for more choice, and during our last breakfast we even took a glass of champagne just "to have done it"! :-) Location is excellent, check it out on Google Maps. Downsides ... yes there is one downside, I saw it on Tripadvisor when I checked other reviews and couldn't believe this would actually be an issue: the pillows are really, really, ... not to our liking; too soft, too little "hold" for our heads, just - not right? Would we go there again: in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: el_jocho
Reviews.Content: I was guest in the Westin Grand Berlin together with my wife and my 4 month old son. We had mentioned that we are going to arrive with a toddler when making the reservation and had requested a baby bed. After checkin we found our room - very small for the price we paid and without a bed. We called reception and were told they would bring it immediately. After having to call back twice, the baby bed was finally brought but it was too big to fit into the little room! After talking to the staff at reception we were promised a free upgrade to a bigger room, however, when gathering our belongings in the small room, service staff arrived with a smaller baby bed telling us that we could not get the upgrade now. I had to go down to the front desk again, explaining that with the smaller baby bed the room was still too small to fit all of our belongings. I just could not fit our luggage and the stroller. I was offered an upgrade at a reduced cost of 30 Euros a night which I had to accept. The bigger room we received was very good, it was spacious, had noise blocking windows and the trademark heavenly beds of the Westin. Except for the very rude staff at the spa, the rest of our stay was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: STEPDI
Reviews.Content: We are coming to this property since 10 years for Christmas. We had another great stay. Service is outstanding and the Theme-Suites are lovely, providing great space and good amenities. The buffet breakfast is very nice, with good fresh products. Many of the staff are here since many years, as such it feels like coming home. With its location in Berlin-Mitte, its in walking distance to many key sights as well as Top End shopping. Close to public transport to get around. We will definitely be back in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Grand is grand!”
Reviews.Author: YankeeTraveler01985
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Berlin, staying at the Westin Grand. Its location can't be beat -- with the subway, the G'markt, the Brandenberg Gate and the Gallerie des Lafayette retail complex all within easy walking distance. In fact, use the Gallerie wine bar instead of the hotel's bar -- it serves taller drinks at shorter prices! Rooms were fine -- smallish, but clean and quiet. Buffet breakfast was the best and the waitstaff couldn't do enough for you, whether that meant clearing the table or effortlessly switching languages. Best of all were the spectacular Christmas decorations!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hixy
Reviews.Content: Efficient check in, room clean and spacious. No bath but good sized bathroom. Great view of reichstag to the left. Hotel very warm but welcomed this time of year. Don't think you could find a better location for all the main attractions. Lobby/ bar spectacular. Drinks priced as with any quality hotel. Would highly recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Weekend escape”
Reviews.Author: cookbristol
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here from the 2nd of december to the 4th december for a weekend break. The hotel is Fantastic the most beautiful lobby with friendly hotel staff. The room was a fantastic size and overlooked the main street and we could see brandenberg gate from our room fantastic at night. Its in a perfect location all shops,restaurants,bars, sights all in perfect reach. Would definately recommend this hotel and Berlin such a fabulous city !!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendymckie9
Reviews.Content: My firend and I have just returned from a four night stay at the Westin it is a great hotel and in a very central location close to shops, trains and buses. The reception and entrance area is beautiful especially at this time of year with the Christmas trees. We chose this hotel as we stayed at the Westin in Dubai earlier on this year and this hotel came up to our expectations. The rooms were spotless, clean sheets and beds (heavenly !! is the right name) clean towels every day. The breakfast also has a great choice in the mornings. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. When arriving at Tegel Airport the bus station is right outside, you need to catch the TXL bus which takes you right outside the hotel at a cost of 2.60 euros which is great. I would definately recommend this and hotel and if going to Berlin again would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel for a top weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: piggy583
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel after reading many good reviews on here! The value of the room was excellent, the room was immaculate, the staff were friendly, my only let down was not having any tea/coffee facilities in the room as need a brew to get me going in the morning! The room service is expensive also! The gym/spa was excellent we were provided with robes, slippers etc, it was so clean and the staff give you a little tour of the facilities first so you know where you are going and what you might like to do. The pool is not designed for laps though for all you keen swimmers!! The Westin Grand is in a excellent location for seeing Berlin, and although there is a highly effective tube network we decided to go it on foot! The hotel is just off the Unter den Linden so a short walk to the left down the Unter den Linden is the Brandenburg gate and then up to the right is Museum Island, Berliner Dom and up to Alexanderplatz. There is lots of info and leaflets in the beautiful lobby at the hotel and the reception staff are helpful to recommend things and places to do and see. Very easy to get too also from Schoenfeld Airport, by just getting on the red double decker train straight into central Berlin to the stop after Alexanderplatz and you can walk up and across unter den linden and see the Weston Grand or if your luggage is particulary heavy tube stop is literally outside the hotel if you swap at the main station. All in all an excellent hotel (minus the tea and coffee facilities!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location but no free wireless in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: The Westin is beautiful hotel in a great location. A bus from the airport lets you off across the street. Attractions, shops and good restaurants are walkable in every direction, The lobby is quite beautiful upon entry. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our first room was spacious, clean and well appointed. Unfortunately, there was a pervasive odor (sewage?) that we just could not stand. Our complaint to the front desk had us immediately transferred and upgraded to a truly outstanding room. I guess it's not the mistakes you make in life, it's how you recover from them that matter and we felt duly compensated for our inconvenience. We loved our "heavenly bed" and rainshower. Everything was top notch. Breakfast was quite expensive and it was disappointing that they did not offer a "cold buffet" (cereal, fruit, toast, etc.) option for a lesser fee. Our only complaint was that they do not offer free internet, even in the lobby as so many hotels do in this day and age. We could pay a few euros for a coffee in a cafe down the street and get internet for free but we cannot get it in the hotel that we are paying a considerable rate for. Guests are relegated to walking the city in search of a Starbucks instead of taking care of staying connected in the comfort of their hotel. That is quite objectionable in our view and sours the impression a bit of what is a lovely hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M
Reviews.Content: We recently completed another trip to our favorite European destination, Berlin. We have stayed at the Westin Grand Berlin in the past and the property is now better than ever. It is an extensively renovated building in the former Eastern section that is now one of the most desirable locations in the city. The hotel has an amazing atrium and foyer area that few newer buildings can match. There was a trapeze artist performing in the atrium for an event while we were there. Actually, there always seems to be an event going on because of the hotel's design and location. The staff is extremely professional and friendly. Americans will find that they receive the kind of service typically found only in the most expensive US based hotels. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The beds are very comfortable. The hotel is quiet although there is often the sound of a piano playing coming from the lobby bar until late at night. The location is the best in the city, located on Friedrichstrasse and Under De Linden. You are steps away from the best shopping, restaurants, bars and nightclubs. I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else when in Berlin. It is certainly the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Pupazzzina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely perfect for business & tourists thanks to its central location. Despite its location the rooms are quiet. The only disadvantage, however typical for big hotels, is very anonymous way of service. You feel to be one of thousands other people staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 5 star value”
Reviews.Author: HDYankee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin Grand in Berlin twice now, both times were great. The beds are fabulous, real Westin standard. Late checkout was not a problem, ice was promptly delivered to the room. The hotel is right on Friedrichstrasse, Berlin's fashionista avenue and within walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate, the Holocaust Memorial, Potsdamer Platz and the Reichstag. As almost everywhere: The Breakfast is wonderful but expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: pollypee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends during a girlie weekend. It is a lovely hotel ideally situated in the posh end of town. You can walk to Brandenburg Tor and the Holocaust memorial in less than 15 minutes and even Alexanderplatz is only a half an hour walk away. The rooms weren’t massive but they were very nicely done up and very quiet. They were very hot, but one could open the window to let air in so that wasn’t an issue. The beds were comfortable and the shower powerful.The public lounge area and staircase were beautiful and made you feel like you really were staying in a luxury hotel. The spa with its pool and jacuzzi was a great relief after a hard day's walking. We loved it.One warning though: we drank the bottles of water left on the table, which we presumed were complimentary as they usually are in hotels of this level, only to be told at check-out that they were 8 euro each. There had been little slips around the bottle necks which we had presumed were with compliments notes, but they had actually given you the price per bottle. Not a huge amount, agreed, but we did feel a bit cheated. I would still highly recommend this hotel and would gladly stay here again if I were to visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PNicolai
Reviews.Content: Fall in Berlin with low temperatures in a very warm hotel. One of the best hotels I have been.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Grand Berlin for 4 nights and my stay was excellent. The location of the hotel, service of the staff, and quality of the room were very good! I will stay there again when I go to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent location worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Epfeagles
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a great city, and the Westin Grand in Berlin is go to hotel. I was blown away when I stayed there. It is not over the top luxurious but a fantastic hotel to stay at in Berlin. Breakfasts are good. The Staff is extremely polite and helpful. I only wish that I spoke more German. I would suggest this hotel to any of my friends looking for a hotel to stay at in Berlin. I write this review as I plan to return to Berlin and am being ripped apart over choosing my hotel. I love this hotel fantastic I know I will return here. My last stay here was in August of 2010 and I remember it like it was yesterday left a lasting impression. In checking the availability it is a better value then another other chains in berlin price wise which is what I remember about the hotel. The lounge is a fantastic area to sit relaxes and has a coffee and apple strudel. If you choose to stay here you have to try the breakfast buffet at least once.. it is unforgettable. I will definitely be returning to this Starwood property Have a Great Stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location.”
Reviews.Author: Vinny102
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to some very good sights plus if you need to venture further out there us a metro station less than a block away. It was a nice hotel not necessarily "Grand" but you can't go wrong with where it is located.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Speedster2000
Reviews.Content: Excellent, central location close to the Brandenberg Gate. Friendly, helpful reception staff - after arrival the hotel allowed us to leave our bags whilst our room was being prepared and then brought them to our room once it was ready. Our room was overlooking Unter den Linden but despite this was very quiet with no traffic noise discernable. Room was very modern and clean (looked like it may have been very recently refreshed). Impressive shower that could be switched between a smaller and larger shower head. Complimetary Tea / coffee facilities in the room and an (expensive) minibar. Flat screen TV showing a selection of channels including BBC News, Sky News. Internet was available for about 7 Euros an hour or 20 euros per 24 hours but if you have a Skype Wifi account then you can use it for 6 pence per minute since it is part of the iBahn network that has partnered with Skype. This works out a lot cheaper since you can just use it for a few minutes and log off - handy to quickly check for local restaurants on tripadvisor! We didn't use the hotel breakfast since it was very expensive but there are a few local cafes near the hotel. Also there is a supermarket in Friedrichstraße Station a few minutes walk away. Französische Straße U-Bahn Station is immediately outside the hotel. If arriving from Berlin Schönefeld Airport then buy an ABC zone single ticket journey ticket for 3 Euros and get the airport express train (double decker Deutsche Bahn (DB) red train) to Friedrichstraße (approx 25 mins journey). On the ticket machine in the airport station there is a large queue and some confusion as to what to buy. Next to the ticket machine there is a small sign that explains what you need to press to buy the ABC zone ticket! On arrival at Friedrichstraße the hotel is approx 5 min walk away south (or can get the U6 U-Bahn line with same ticket to Französische Straße).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karlsruhe_79
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of Berlin. Room was very nice and clean. Updated bathroom with granite. Only draw back was the fact that the room was facing Friedrichstrasse which is very noisy. Next time, I'd ask for an interior yard facing room. The breakfast buffet was amazing, the staff very attentive and friendly. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location, great room”
Reviews.Author: SeattlePaul
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is so centrally located in Berlin that when you just search for Berlin on a mapping website, the pushpin nearly lands on it. It is right on Unter den Linden, in the heart of the Mitte district, and a stone's throw from many of the top attractions including the Brandenburg Gate and Tiergarten (we could see from our window), the Holocaust Memorial, Checkpoint Charlie, etc. You are right close to U-bahn (subway) stops for many of the main lines, and don't even need to consider getting a car. Many things are walkable. Lots of good restaurants and shopping all along Friedrichstrasse. Our room was very nice, although I'm still scratching my head about the pricing (one of my coworkers paid a hundred Euro less per night for a similar reservation). The one thing to consider carefully is breakfast service. While the hotel has "deals" to get breakfast buffet for only 20 Euros a day if you sign up for every day, that's still pretty steep. Their one day price is even worse at 30 Euro. The food wasn't really worth that much, it's sort of typical high end western hotel buffet, but I've actually seen better at other hotels, and for cheaper. I recommend skipping hotel breakfast and visiting one of the many cafes and restaurants within a block or two. The lobby bar is comfortable, if not somewhat pricey, although we did find the service there a little matter-of-fact, impatient, and uninviting. This was an exception though, as the service in other aspects was fantastic (for example, front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful).

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good value”
Reviews.Author: trvljunkie79
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel mainly because of the location. The hotel is centrally located and perfect for sightseeing and travel to the airport and train station. When we arrived, the lobby was grand and beautiful and check-in was smooth. Our room was on the top floor and had a small balcony overlooking Friedrichstrasse which was a nice surprise. The room itself was smallish but adequate for two people and our luggage. For the price, this hotel was great value. The one big disappointment was that WiFi was not included. One would think that at a major, brand name, luxury hotel this would be included. We ended up spending a lot of time in Starbucks checking our emails on our smartphones.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location and Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: kirklandkat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for touring in Berlin. This was my second stay and I didn't even bother looking for somewhere new on this visit due to the location and comfortable room. Our room literally looked over the corner of Friedrichstrasse & Unter den Linden, so you can easily walk to many of the tourist highlights and are also just down from some convenient shopping. Our room was updated and clean and the service was helpful. The rate is amazing given the sleep and bath quality and location for other comparable rooms in a European city center. I will continue to ding Starwood for the ridiculous practice of charging for WiFI, however. This needs to change worldwide!

Reviews.Title: “Five star but...”
Reviews.Author: Roger M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online after consulting tripadvisor. It's a Westin, so you'd expect something upmarket. And so it is. We were upsold a 'better' room that overlooked the garden. Probably unnecessary - we only used it to crash each day after twelve hours of sightseeing. Pluses - couldn't be better positioned (Freidrichstrasse/Unter den Linden) for shops and touristy things, great staff and a luxurious gym/spa/indoor pool (really warm water). Minuses - breakfast too expensive for us and wifi charged. No matter, just round the corner is a friendly muesli, scone and coffee place with free wifi internet access. Must be good because at breakfast time it's always full with tourists and their netbooks. Always room for you, though. Recommended if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided - Average based on five star expectations”
Reviews.Author: Violet468
Reviews.Content: Didn't think it was five star luxury. Heating wasn't working in room, asked to be moved, heating wasn't working in that one either so was given oil filled radiator. Drapes weren't fitting well and not even blackouts. Decor in room was tired not like some of the renovated rooms even though I thought they had finished it. Had to ask for extra pillows as only two on the bed, not what I expect in five star. Had to ask for extra towels. Twin beds were more like single ones than double size as in other five star hotels, or even four star. Health club lovely water abit cold though. Everything very expensive. Have to pay for everything extra. Had to ask for kettle in room does not come as standard and given little cups rather than mugs. No iron in room have to ask. Internet isn't free and expensive. In good location for travelling and safe part of town, equiv to say Cheadle, Wilmslow area in UK for shops. Other shops two underground stops away for general shopping like H&M. Rooms overlooking garden is quietest. When we stayed roadworks were in the side street, and rooms at front of hotel some don't have a bath as well as a shower and are noisy if you want the window open. Reception is very grand with the staircase, but unless you get one of the renovated rooms with the updated decor you might not be as impressed for a five star. Stayed in upper floor as it helps with the noise of traffic. Didn't notice any children activities but then didn't look either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but a few minors!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaH101
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a great long weekend in Berlin, stayed at the Westin Grand Berlin, great location down the road from the wall and checkpoint charlie and on top of the shops! But I was disappointed that you had to pay for WIFI on top of your stay which was already expensive. We also were upset that when we went down for a drink on a Saturday evening it took 30 minutes for a waiter to acknowledge that we were there to actually come over and gives us a menu which we thought wasnt nice considering we were guests of the hotel and not stopping in for a drink. Apart from that we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: MortenOlesen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been in Berlin several times and since we wanted a short stay close to shopping and the museum island we chose Westin. The hotel is good, clean and we enjoyed the stay. Will though recommend that Westin offer Wifi without a cost - currently we have to pay 20 euro per day for a service that is as common as electricity.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: ValentineVa
Reviews.Content: Great location near the u-Bahn! very friendly stuff, very clean and beautiful rooms. Everything you can expect from Westin!! Next time will stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin delivers”
Reviews.Author: Mihail M
Reviews.Content: What can I say - after some extenssive research on hotels in Berlin we chose the Westin Grand. Everything that we expected from this hotel was actually there when we needed it. Great location, friendly personnel and fresh rooms. We got exactly what we expected. We stayed there during 14-15 of October. Next time we're in Berlin we'll deffinitely get a room there again. Pros: Location, service, rooms Cons: very expensive internet - it is ridiculous to get this kind of prices in 2011...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingbugs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to restaurants, shopping, sights, and the metro. We stayed on a package call the Berlin Wall package, which included daily breakfast, a currywurst and chips in the restaurant (which was fantastic!), and you got to chisel your own piece of the Berlin Wall. The package added to the experience and was GREAT value. The concierge staff was helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast was great. Rooms were spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sopz L
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was lovely, rooms were big n the hotel is located right in the centre of the major attractions Downsides were 1. Internet was chargeable at approx €25 for 24 hours ( I stayed at Radisson Blue hotel as well which is 15 mins walk away, equally lovely hotel with free wi fi) 2. Bottled waters in the room are chargeable at approx €7 per bottle

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon Potter
Reviews.Content: We spent an enjoyable 3 nights in room 678 in this hotel. Our room was on the 6th floor in the smaller new wing and our room looked on to Unter den Linden. It was a long walk back down the hall to the central lifts but it meant that our room was quiet because there was no-one walking past our door. Sticking our heads out of the windows there was a very nice view of at least 5 major monuments, looking both ways along Unter den Linden. The windows must have been double glazed because we couldn't hear any street noise with them closed. The room was nicely furnished, with ample storage space and a nice lounge chair and small table as well as a desk & desk chair. We found the king bed very comfortable. The bathroom was small but not cramped. There was plenty of water pressure & hot water in the roomy shower which a choice of 2 shower heads. There was no bath. The towels and products (usual westin range) were good. The inroom coffee & tea making facilities were nice to have. The staff in the hotel were also were pleasant and accommodating. We had drinks in the bar on a few occasions and also enjoyed the buffet breakfast on one morning which had an unusually large selection of food. The hotel is centrally located, with multiple U & S bahn stations within a short walk (between 1 and 7 minutes walk). Brandenburg Gate is a leaisurely 10 minute stroll and we walked to the Museum Insel & Alexander Platz too. There are a few cafes in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. We did use the hotel wifi which worked well and was EUR20 for a 24 hour period and allowed 2 simultaneous connections and an additional 'roaming' connection around the hotel (e.g. breakfast room, bar) during the period. There was no free wifi. We would definitely stay here again if we're lucky enough to visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful-great location, staff,rooms and leisure facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Lightyearz_B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend before Xmas last year. Berlin wasknee deep in snow and this hotel was a little gem. Set in a convenient location on friedrichstrasse the underground is within 20 steps of the lobby. We used the subway everywhere it was so convenient and bought a Berlin visitor pass which included public transport travel as well as discounts on major attractions which I'd recommend. the rooms were clean luxurious and spacious and the beds and bed linen was to die for! They had a lovely spa with pool and jacuzzi which we used most days to warm us up after spending the day sightseeing. We didn't have breakfast at hotel but there are plenty of local options. The Brandenburg Gate is just around the corner and there were some fab Xmas markets within walking distance too. Overall fab stay-good value if you can get discounted rates but worth it for a treat if u can't!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and convenient”
Reviews.Author: oakleyrd
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of Berlin this hotel is very convenient. I was here for business but managed to see some of Berlin's main sights during my stay on foot from the hotel. Conference facilities were good, rooms very comfortable. Glad I wasn't paying the bill, as it isn't cheap, but reasonably priced for a 5* in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Typical of what you expect for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: clmtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Tauck tour. Location can't be beat for walking around Berlin. Nice modern looking hotel. Rooms a decent size and bathrooms very nice. Small sitting area. The restaurant on property was excellent. Rather large hotel so if you have issues with walking ask to be close to elevator. Breakfast buffet was fabulous and lots of choices. Charge for Internet- about 7 euros for an hour. Starbucks closeby and free. Visit the Berlin Dom- beautiful. Tried to see Pergammon Museum but couldn't because the line too long. Go early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very central - great area”
Reviews.Author: Aries62
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location especially if travelling solo. So close to the underground even though you can walk to many places. Totally great stay. Hotel has very reasonable restaurant if you're too tired in the evening to go out. Great Christmas atmosphere inside the Hotel. Beautiful Gen

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDoo777
Reviews.Content: Short walk to nearly all popular museums and sites, walk a block to take subway to the rest. Beds - twins made into a king - were very comfortable, and room was very spacious and quiet. We sampled the popular sidewalk cafes just around the corner each night we were there, and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Restaurant in hotel was empty the weekend we were there, but it looked very attractive. Staff conversed easily in English. We would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl717
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days at the Westin Grand Hotel in Berlin.Since we live in Florida we found the temperature in the room a little bit too cold for us and the hotel did not heat yet.When I called the frontdesk I was immediately offered a portable heater which was delivered within minutes.We were also given a bottle of water each day for free.We did not eat breakfast at the hotel instead walked about 5 minutes to a bakery close to the S Bahn station on Friedrichstrasse and had capuccinos with butterbetzels and plumcake for a very reasonable price.The location of this hotel is great.You can walk to most of the interesting sights of Berlin in 15 to 20 minutes.We enjoyed the Pergamon museeum very much. It was on my bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.Great for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: tonyloco
Reviews.Content: Nice place,only bad thing is that when we told them we were Platinum SPG Members they did'nt care..Other than that we had a good time here.Use TXL Airport bus drop you a block away.Make sure you tell bus driver where to stop.Cost was only 2.30 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great consistent good quality”
Reviews.Author: rvrman21
Reviews.Content: Have been going back to this hotel for years. It gets better every year, the rooms have been upgraded, the service is good. Breakfast is typically Starwood good, but pricey, so is the bar. The service is attentive and a cut above.......thanks Oh and another thing the position is 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great location...not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Irish_1972
Reviews.Content: OK so one year anniversary and a trip to Berlin was decided. The hotel itself is in a great location within easy walk of the mian shopping and sight seeing areas. The problems started when we arrived. When i booked on their website I stated that we would be arriving at 9:30am......we arrived closer to 10:30am... They did not have the room ready....we were told it would be available around 3 in the afternoon. I found this unacceptable as we both wanted to freshen up beofer heading into the city. The next option was another room(20 euro more expensive) that would be ready at 12...so we bought coffee and sat in the lobby for 90 mins. The room itself was fine...although it was supposed to be overlooking the couryard!!!!! more like overlooking the back of the hotel....but it was one of the more modern rooms in the hotel. Next problem...only one bathrobe and slippers....and the shampoo etc was for one....not a huge problem but I would expect a little more from a 5 star hotel. Also they had a load of free things you could ask for...sewing kit....toothbrush, razor, comb etc....but I would have expected some of that(sewing kit for example) to be in the room...also the list is on the back page of the 'guide' in the room. I left 3 shirts in to be ironed......about 10am...they arrived the next day...which was annoying as I wanted a fresh shirt for dinner that night. In short the room was great and location was fab...just a few little things that make me question the 5 star level....I stayed in le Meridien in Vienna a few years ago(also 5 star) and the level was better.... finally...they had NO free wi-fi....In this day and age I would expect it...and not a bill of 7 euro per hour!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Christmas Markts”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior50
Reviews.Content: This was a great location and has all the amenities you would expect from a Westin. During the weeks leading to Christmas, there were concerts by children choirs in the very spacious lobby. The bar was a wonderful place to meet and great business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated in the Center of It All”
Reviews.Author: drmark77
Reviews.Content: You could not find a hotel better situated for touring Berlin than the Westin Grand. Every major attraction revolves around this location. At the crossroads of East and West Berlin it was a breeze to travel anywhere. Great shopping and dining all around. The hotel itself is beautiful. The grand staircase and interior balconies give the interior an old world feel and charm. The hotel staff could not be more helpful. The rooms are beautifully appointed and clean with extremely comfortable beds and upscale amenities for bath and shower. I could not recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. We will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: JohanSF
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotell. Very good value for money. Nice rooms with fabulous beds. And a breakfast from heaven - yes, champagne is included!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dado_63xx
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have some nice time and we succeeded! The hotel is in a great position, few staps away from the Brandenburg gate and Unter den Linden. We visited the pool and the gym, and used the bar. Not bad. The breakfast was great with impressive selections of foods. The hotel is not cheap but the price is levelled with the structure and service you get.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in the former Soviet sector”
Reviews.Author: robert_dfw
Reviews.Content: Good location just off Unter den Linden. The Franzoesische Str U-bahn station is just outside the hotel entrance. There is some road construction ongoing outside the hotel so opt for a garden view room to minimize street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff ... some improvements necessary”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: My favorite location in Berlin. Very friendly staff, the room ok ... the bathroom needs an update. Value for the mony spend was good. Breakfast good, but very busy, even at 9 am.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel just next to Galeries Lafayette”
Reviews.Author: hennessyparadis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin Grand in April. The hotel is located in the corner of Behrenstrasse and Friedrichstrasse, and is thus very close to tourist attractions such as Unter den Linden, Gendarmenmarkt and its Domes and of course the shopping possibilities of Galeries Lafayette and the likes. The hotel is big and the lobby area is impressive with chandeliers massive steps up to the mezzanine. We initially stayed in a Double which was decently sized and modern facing the hotel garden, however the wing it was located in began to exhibit a very nasty smell during the first evening. Reception staff could not have taken the issue more seriously, and we were promptly moved to a new room and, as a very appreciated gesture, bumped up to a huge junior suite with a perfect view over Friedrichstrasse. Breakfast was nothing special. The breakfast room felt, as some other reviewers have mentioned, a bit crowdy. The inside pool area was very stylish, with natural light coming in on one of the poolside walls and a few sunbeds set well apart from each other. Granted, the pool isn't that big, and it's a spa-like pool not meant for doing laps. The pool area also featured a jacuzzi and a paid sauna. All in all a rather pleasant experience once the room issues were sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with heavenly beds and all in a great location”
Reviews.Author: melanie_court
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is centrally located in easy walking distance of the brandenburg gate, checkpoint Charlie and the wall. The hotel foyer is impressive with a grand staircase which at night ia beautifully lit with candles. The rooms are all modern and beautifully furnished with of course the Westin heavenly bed which if you haven't tried yet, is an experience all on it's own!! Some of the rooms are quite a long walk and it would be better to get a room on any floor on the pool lift corridor or around the central atrium. The hotel does have street and garden view rooms. The garden view isn't as pretty as it sounds and the garden is a little overgrown and in need of some attention. They do have smoking rooms but not in the standard category so you would need to upgrade. The spa includes a lovely circular pool, gym and jacuzzi and you can borrow fitness clothes from the hotel. The sauna is an extra charge because it is very small. The bar is nice and is more of a lounge area than a traditional bar. It is all located around the central atrium which has a stunning art deco glass design at the top. There are also tables outside. The breakfast was very yummy!! Service generally in the hotel was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for sure but not 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAY119
Reviews.Content: Pro : LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION The hotel was close to everything in East Berlin. We arrived in the afternoon and could visit most of touristic sights in East on that day. Yes, Berlin has quite good transportation system but in fact, we did not need any of it much except the day we decided to go to West part. Room size is quite good, not too big but not small at all. Room deco is ok, nothing special but the bed was sooooo comfortable. We were very happy to sleep on the bed after long walk. I must say the Location and the bed were the best thing of Westin Grand Berlin. I have mixed feeling about the breakfast. The room was very crowded every morning and definitely they need bigger room and more table as we sometimes even had to wait to get a seat. They serve eggs made to order but it's next to impossible to get an omelet in half an hour as there are so many people waiting for their eggs and there was only one person with one pan making it. Other than that, the variety is not big but I thought there was enough food for a breakfast. However, I would not pay 30EUR/p (the price they normally charge) for this breakfast. We had a deal to pay 15EUR/p/n for our 3nights stay and I thought 15EUR was the right price for it. Staff were nice and friendly. Con : The pictures of the hotel website doesn't show what it is exactly. The hotel is much smaller than it looks on the pictures, which I don't mind at all as I am more on boutique hotel lover than a huge chain hotels, and the swimming pool was way smaller than I saw on the website. Hotel deco also was a bit too classic and too Brown for my taste. Drinks are very expensive at the bar. My husband had a couple of glasses of white wine, just basic ones, and they charged 10EUR for a glass and 11.50EUR for another. They serve the drinks with a bit of snack and nuts but if you are allergic to nuts and another one doesn't eat salty snacks, they are nothing but a waste. I thought it would have been nicer if they charge less on drinks and serve these on request at an extra cost. Overall, I enjoyed staying in Westin Grand Berlin but if I go back to Berlin next time, I would stay in modern style hotel with a bit better gym and swimming pool. I would recommend this hotel to first time visitors as the location and the bed will be the most important thing then. Tip : The bottle of water in room is not free of charge. However, you will get it for free if you are SPG member. You can enroll via website or at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for all sort of trips”
Reviews.Author: Hedin
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fitting with high demands and brand reputation. Kind personell, above average. Good check in and out procedures.
