Fresh, renovated furnituring and overall sense of light, lean luxury. Nice SPA area, despite the pool doesn't allow real swimming. Car park&pick up by the personell is a useful service (the public car park building is in front of the hotel, but you're releived of the parck&pick operations for a modest surcharge).

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town”
Reviews.Author: Tony K
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Besides the very nice mix of classical decor with a modern touch, the best of this hotel is its unbeatable location, at the corner of the two best streets in Berlin. As a starwood plat, got upgraded to a junior suite. Even though the actual bedroom did not have any window (only in the living room), it was very comfortable. will stay there whenever im back to berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: privatewire
Reviews.Content: Although we have visited Berlin several times, this is the first time we have stayed at the Westin Grand, and we are glad we did. We got a great rate first of all for a Deluxe Double from Expedia, which we upgraded to a Deluxe Garden View room for an extra 20Euros a night. I would advise guests at the moment to try and get a garden facing room as there are roadworks going on outside the street where the main entrance is located, although, of course these may be finished now. This room was lovely, bright,airy, well furnished and with the most comfortable bed I think I have ever slept in! A lot has been made about the cost of the breakfast in the hotel, some people quoting 42 Euro each. Its possible to spend this, but its also possible to get breakfast from the a la carte menu for around 15 Euros, for a hot breakfast in a good hotel, thats not the end of the world. In any case, we preferred to dine out, and there are plenty of places to choose from, the hotel is really well situated, and is well served by numerous eating establishments! Try walking down towards the railway station to try the Bagel place, and inside the station itself for small restaurant which does a continental breakfast for 2.95Euros, delicious! As ever in Berlin, it feels safe to walk around at night, we wandered all round the area, over to the other side of the river and deep into Mitte, although as ever, sensible precautions should be taken. I would like to mention the staff in the Westin Grand, I could some them up in 3 words, Charming,Friendly, and Efficient!, Especially the young lady at reception on the days we arrived and left, you really got the impression that she cared about what she was doing. In short, I know we will be back to Berlin, and we wouldnt hesitate to go back to the Westin Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - No Car or Transit Required”
Reviews.Author: NLrock
Reviews.Content: Pros - perfect location for exploring Berlin by foot, no car required! Friendly and helpful staff. Easy check-in/out. Spotless rooms (and quiet) and public areas. Air conditioning was great. Beds were very comfortable. Concierge always willing to help with any detail. Cons - very expensive breakfast buffet (did not get it because of cost). No free internet and very costly to purchase it (i think 19 euros a day!).

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: europtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand for a week or so in late July 2011. This is a top class five star hotel with all the trimmings and extras one would expect at this level. It is wonderfully located, just off Unter den Linden about 5-10 minutes’ walk from the Brandenburg Gate, and very close to a U-Bahn station. We did not use the restaurant, but the breakfast buffet is exceptionally good (and although priced expensively and additionally to the room rate we were offered it at half price as we were staying for more than 3 days). We were offered an upgrade for an additional charge for a quieter inward facing room, but did not take up the offer and had no noise problems at all (we were on the sixth floor though). The hotel rates are fairly high, but not by comparison with some other 5 star hotels in central Berlin, and it is very large and we managed to get a very good deal using expedia. Rooms are comfortable and well maintained and serviced. The standard rooms are not large, but this is a city centre hotel, and storage for clothes is aimed more at the short stay business guest than longer stay holiday makers. Unusually for a centrally located hotel there is a heated indoor pool (circular and about 12 meters diameter) and a small gym. We found staff helpful and courteous. We would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Berlin and wanting a pool, a high quality hotel, and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: StephaneBxl
Reviews.Content: Introduction : Once again, using my SPG membership, I choose the best available place in Berlin from Starwood, The Westin Grand Berlin. Dates of stay: 9th june till 12th june 2011 The Exterior: Looks pretty nice for a modern building, nothing trully beautifull, but ok though and it integrates perfectly in the Friedrichstrasse The Area: Fantastic area with tons of shops and interresting tourist must see stuff. At walking distance from the Brandburg, Paris square, Reichstag, Jewish memorial, … Lots of good restaurants and bars too. In my opinion, the best location possible. The Interior: Very impressive and nicely decorated. A touch of old fashion feature makes it look like an historic hotel palace. The check in: No complains, it was fast and friendly. The room: I could have been upgraded in a much nicer room but as I requested a balcony, to smoke. Our room was very very far away from the main elevators. Room number 177. You have to go to the second floor, then walk till the end of 2 long corridors, take stairs to go back to the first floor and here you are. If they propose a room numbered 16X or 17X, decline, unless you smoke, as these are the only ones with a balcony. The space in the room itself is average, not really small but far from other Starwood hotels space I’ve seen so far. The smallest is this one. The AirConditioning/Heating: Works great, silently, doing what we expected. The Bathroom: A small bathroom but with a nice walk in shower. Amenities are ok but not enough for two people. The space in the bathroom doesn’t allow two peole to be in there at the same moment. The Bed: Great bed though very close to the walls due to the small room. The Breakfast: From 6 am till 10.30 Probably the best buffet I had the chance to check in a Starwood Hotel. Very very nice. The Room Service: Didn’t really used it except for a bottle of wine and it was quick and friendly. The Restaurant(s)/bars: We tested the lobby bar upon arrival where we were offered a glass of champagne and a cury wurst. Top notch. Great food, massive even, and delicious. We also had aperitive on the terrace and the service was absolutely great and professional. Check out: That was a pain as I noticed they charged 4 times the internet for a 3 day stay. I had no time to argue and for the rest the lady was efficient. Guess what : they charged back the fourth day of internet on my credit card ! Congrats guys. Service/Housekeeping: Didn’t notice anything wrong with this. Good overall. I really like: - The location - The friendness of the staff I really dislike: - The very long walk to the room - The internet rate is ok but the system, which is not a Westin one but a third party is very confusing. Be cautious if you use it. We had two computers and were suppose to be able to use both with a single code but could not find a way to do that. My conclusion: It’s a very nice hotel, in a perfect location and I would probably come again…if I stop smoking :-) I’m sure there are much better rooms in this hotel and, if I stop smoking :-) I’ll check their Spa Suite which looks beautifull. All the best, Stephane

Reviews.Title: “Ummm.. chose this hotel cos i loved the Bourne movies”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereTick
Reviews.Content: Yes, shallow philistine here - aww that should have been my TripAdvsior 'handle'. Sorry saw the movie- the second one - and wanted to stay here. The hotel is lovely, great location and staff wonderful. We ate here and the food was faultless - although not very local. We also managed a cocktail one evening which was good. The spa was great - pool, jacuzzi - other things if you wanted - but although we stayed four nights only managed to force ourselves there on the final day. Cos Berlin is a fantastic city - loads to see, to do. Oh some things I felt, were overly pricey, even for a 4/5 star - the room bar for instance - 6 euros for water! I think not. Hotel is very central, handy for loads of restaurants and public transport - and a five minute stroll up to Brandenburg Gate... couldn't ask for more. I loved it, Though Berlin is sooooo noisy during the night with traffic you may want to ask for a courtside room rather that street side (which we had).

Reviews.Title: “" Very good and efficient service"”
Reviews.Author: maire_10
Reviews.Content: Very good location and near shopping and tourist attractions.The beds were very comfortable and the rooms overlooking the gardens were very quiet.The buffet breakfast was excellent with a huge variety of food.No internet connection in bedrooms-20euro per day.The staff were very helpful and courteous particularly the concierge and the bar staff.If you dont wish to have breakfast in the hotel the cafe Einstein around the corner does excellent coffee and pastries etc. The pool in the hotel is clean and bright but quite small-its more for" a dip " than for serious swimming.

Reviews.Title: “best choice in Berlin, basic luxury”
Reviews.Author: heiron
Reviews.Content: The Westin Berlin offers unpretentios luxury. The hotel is clearly a business hotel and I really learnt to appreciate what it offers. I am in Berlin seven to ten times a year and the Westin is always my first choice. Many travelers who underline the great location are absolutely right. The is only one hotel that has a better location in Berlin and that is the Adlon. Another category for sure. The Westin Berlin has different room types. Standard rooms face the street but if you close the windows it is calm. These rooms feature some dark wood elements in some parts of the room still. Its a question of taste. The so called Linden rooms all face "Unter den Linden" which allows you to see the Brandenburg gate from your room as well as the TV tower. These are my favorite room types there as they fully follow the Westin style when it comes to colors and fabrics. All the so called theme suites are more or less interesting, Totally not Westin as the are old fashioned in grand hotel style with woods and every suite has its own theme named after composers or lyrics. If you look for something special and classy the Sancoussi Suite is for sure worth the money. I always feel like a prince in there ;-) The SPA suites are not oversized but offer a very modern wellness equipment. Jaccuzzi, movable walls, movable massage rest that also works as a table... quite cool and if you like to spend some time indulging and relaxing without the company of foreigners its a nice option. All these suites face the Bavarian Mission, which I think is a funny detail discovering the bavarian flag when waking up in the morning. The Wellness area is quite nice but noting too special. Average size pool, jacuzzi an a spa salon. If you want to use the Sauna they charge extra unless you are a top tier client. Since they introduced this policy I think it became quieter in the Sauna what is a good thing to me. Two highlights: The lobby is really worth to sit for a pre dinner cocktail, especially when there is a piano player. Some of the waitresses work there for decades and if you ask nicely they can also share stories of the times when this hotel still was a meeting point for GDR representatives. There are two concierges. Both guys can come over as very Berlin-like (in a positive way), while being extremely polite and helpful. Mr. Lindner must be a walking legend in Berlin, as every cab driver, club owner or Chef au Rant I talk to in Belrin seems to know him. The second concierge is Mr Schneider. My absolute favorite concierge in Germany. If you ask for something you can be sure he will find a way. He arranged cupcakes from the other side of the city and developed a way to save the taxi fee for it..Thats just one example. So to sum it up: the Westin is a good choice. You know what you get. It is not a snobby place nor does it pretend to be hip. Its a place where you can relax and get all the support you can expect from this house. Great for families, great for business. Simply a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for first timers in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: qb76
Reviews.Content: Overall, we did enjoy our stay in the hotel. Location is definitely their biggest plus. The subway station is literally across the road. Galeries Lafayette & Jewish Memorial is just a stroll away so as the main train station, which can take you to the central station in no time. Attractions like Checkpoint Charlie & Berlin Wall are just 15 minutes away on foot. King-size twin beds in the room were actually queen size only. Amenities in the room were up to standard but I was shocked that they charged us when we asked for couple of additional tea bags one day. Room was clean & tidy and so as the bathroom. Air-conditioning needs a good service though. Breakfast on the first floor had a good spread. Lobby bar had one patio as well which was faces the main street and it is really nice & peaceful area to enjoy a chilled beer. I’d definitely recommend this hotel to people who are in Berlin for the first time & have young kids in their group.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointed with Internet service- would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: diana096
Reviews.Content: Completing the end of a two week European vacation. Stayed with Starwood Hotels the entire way and have been extremely happy with all but this one. I'm a gold member and every other Starwood hotel we stayed at in Europe offered a business center for it's members. Made it feel really cheap. Also a bottle of water was a little under 10 USD. I done understand why they don't provide free internet ser ice in the business center. Left a bad taste and would not recommend this hotel. Felt nickeled and dimed ( like someone else said). It's funny how something like that can make such a difference. I live star woods yet I could not recommend this one. They are too cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: alphabetsoup2010
Reviews.Content: Am a Starwood Platinum member, and this hotel really makes it worthwhile: - Was upgraded to a fantastic suite - elegantly furnished and almost obscenely spacious - Efficient, courteous staff (though this is a more generally German phenomenon) - Great breakfast - why can't American hotels learn from this? - Really convenient neighborhood with some great restaurants nearby Not much to improve on here - I'm hard to please, so well done!

Reviews.Title: “Best business hotel in town!”
Reviews.Author: Kirkit
Reviews.Content: Very good location, very good service.. Highly recommended.. Best in town

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: maimonChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot going for it. Great location within an easy walk of Checkpoint Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate, the Holocaust Memorial, the Opera House, Museum Island, fine restaurants, high end shopping, etc. Excellent concierge desk. Lavish breakfasts. Clean, decent rooms. But be careful about being nickled and dimed to death. WiFi is not free. Open the bottle of mineral water waiting on the table in your room and you'll have an unpleasant surprise at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine business hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler1199
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great central location, comfortable rooms, good internet access and a helpful concierge (e.g. restaurant recommendations). As is often the case in hotels, breakfast was pricey and just ok. We also used some of their facilities for meetings and the rooms were spacious and well set up. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but improvement potential”
Reviews.Author: Fonzarelly
Reviews.Content: Overall, it is a good hotel! Very central location (even if in Berlin, it is not a key point when choosing an hotel, since the public transportation system is amazing and you will never be more than 100m away from a bus, U-Bahn, S-Bahn, etc. station). Room was clean and equipped with all the expected stuff (LCD-TV, mini-bar, etc.). The hotel was however a bit impersonal and "faded". I don't mean that in a bad way but if you want to stay in a fancy place like there are in Berlin (boutique hotel among others), then you should probably book another one! If you like to stay in a Westin Grand, you won't be disappointed. It is like it is in almost all the others (you'll find the same shampoo, the same bed sheet, etc.). Room was quite as well (good isolation). The Spa was nice, the gym a bit tiny for such a big hotel. Besides that, there are in my opinion a couple of bad points: The wi-fi: 19,50€ for 24 hours, this is just a joke! The breakfast: 30€ for an orange juice, a croissant, some toast and a coffee: this is a robbery! The sauna: you get to pay extra-money to have access to the sauna. Common guys, if you book a room in a 5* hotel, you don't expect to have such surprise. I don't know, make the room 5€ more expensive but don't do that. It looks really niggardly! So overall: + Location + Value for money (above all because we had a good deal during the low season) + Westin Grand standards - Not very fancy, a bit impersonal - Hidden costs - Construction site just in front of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Spooky.nurse
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is located right in the centre of all the key sights in Berlin, 5-10 minutes walk to the Bradenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie etc. The hotel itself is lovely; staff really helpful and polite, rooms well equipped and kept very clean. Breakfast buffet lovely - a fantastic range of very freshly prepared food and a fresh coffee pot for each table so you are not always trying to catch someone's eye for more. The only downside is the very expensive internet, so one star knocked off for that as it is something that cheaper hotels seem to manage to do quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Westin's usual excellence (almost)”
Reviews.Author: TexansinEurope
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a short (solo) weekend getaway while my family was gone for a month. I wanted to visit the city that so many of our friends had raved about while we are still living in Europe. First - location, location, location! Right on the corner of Unter den Linden and Friedrichstrasse, the Westin is within 5 minutes walk of all the major museums, the Berliner Dom and Brandenburg Gate. Also, there are tons of great restaurants within 10 minutes. One of my favorite things about Europe is that many of the cities are so "walkable". In this respect, I don't think there is a better spot. The lobby bar, common areas and pool/spa are all top-notch, very much in line with the Westin image in Europe (I wish I could say the same for the US Westins)! The place is a great mix of turn of the century grand and modern/sleek Germany. Whatever it is, they do it well. The only low mark on my visit was the food. Not terrible but only a bit above average. I had coffee and dessert two nights in my room. I don't expect much in the way of portion size, but the desserts where almost bite size (but good quality). The decaf coffee on my second night came in the form of two pouches of instant and a pot of hot water - very poor! I travel a lot for business and pleasure, so don't generally have high expectations for room service, but this was disappointing. Concierge - seemed to be stuck on one restaurant (Dresschler's), which is immediately behind the hotel. They gave me the same recommendation for both nights even though what I asked for was quite different. You can read the review of this place on Trip Advisor. I never tried it due to the reviews, but instead had great meals at Luttner and Wegner and Weingalerie No! Overall, very good place and even with it's small flaws, I would choose this place over any other for a weekend getaway simply because of the location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Felt "nickled and dimed"”
Reviews.Author: 154995Traveller
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to pay through the nose for a few things .... I stayed there for a conference and was surprised to discover a charge for internet - 19.50 euro for 24 hours!!! When I mentioned this to the desk clerk she was completely indifferent and handed me a feedback form to fill out. The hotel is nice and comfortable - the Westin bed is very comfortable and the location was good but should I ever get to Berlin again I will pick another hotel - I was there for 11 nights and would have liked internet but the cost was exhorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Berlin.....wunderbar”
Reviews.Author: travelling_teena
Reviews.Content: The Westin is ideally located: Brandenburg Gate 10 min walk west, Checkpoint Charlie 10 min walk south, and shops and cafes in between. and when I say "shops" I'm speaking of high-end fashion and brands (don't miss the Checkpoint Mini and the Cooper hanging on the wall). It's also 5 min to walk to the nearest subway portal and you'd be off to any part of the city. The hotel was used in the movie Bourne Identity and there are still staff who can speak to seeing/meeting Matt Damon - if you ask...! As for a our business, we had excellent seminar rooms with great audio and visual projections, excellent wi-fi connection. The meals were delicious and service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - rooms are clean on the surface, outrageous extra charges!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyPx
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent hotel. Lobby is really amazing, but don’t try to have a drink or anything, prices are double compared to the street. Rooms are ok (usual "Berlin-scam", see below). Rooms are not as clean as they may seem. I had a look under the top mattress and found a LOT of hair and food (I do this check in all hotels, and have never seen this before). What you need to know before booking a hotel room in Berlin is that there seems to be a common scam in this city. Room prices are cheap, but they seem to take their profits from Internet and breakfast. At this hotel wi-fi was 20e/day or 7e/hour. Breakfast was 30e/person. And oh yeah, one litre of water was 8 euro!!! You can get a bottle of water for 20 cents in the store! And don't even get me started on the minibar prices :) If you’re smart, walk 50m from the hotel to the nearest cafeteria ("Einstein") and have breakfast for two+water+wi-fi for 10 euro instead of the 90e it would cost you in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Marketmiami1
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the building and are greeted by the Grand staircase you know you are in the right place. The hotel is situated in an almost perfect spot on Unter den linden street, with an easy walk to some of the best sights. The rooms are very good by Westin Standards, and designed to be soothing. The bed of course was heavenly, and so was the shower. I especially liked the music in the bathroom. All of the staff were very professional, and took time to help in any way you needed. My favorite part of this hotel had to be the breakfast. It was phenomenal, with soo many things to choose from. I probably gained 5 pounds in Berlin because of the breakfast. I would really like to thank some of the staff for being extra kind, the porters for being quick and friendly, Franzisca at the front desks for being extra welcoming, and their concierge for providing us with great tips and reservations at Fischers Fritz the only 2 Michelin star restaurant in Berlin. If you are headed to Berlin, you would be wise to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: jsthouston
Reviews.Content: While the room we had, sixth floor facing the courtyard, was a bit smaller than I expected everything worked including the AC on what was a warm day for Berlin. We did not eat in the hotel but did take advantage of the gym as well as the surrounding shopping. I liked the location of this hotel better than the Hyatt that I stayed in earlier in the trip though the rooms lack the style and polish of that hotel. Service was excellent and the weekend rate we got seemed a bargain after some of the other hotels I have stayed at in Berlin. Not a five star property in my view but a very good hotel in a great location and with five star service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Groovy and well located”
Reviews.Author: Boppojr
Reviews.Content: Obviously once a grand luxury hotel this place is starting to show it's age but that by no means effects your stay. Ask for a courtyard view, we originally had a road view which was ok but after they started roadworks the next morning I asked to be moved and they happily put us in a nice spacious room overlooking a large central garden that was very peaceful and you could open a large set of double doors to let the fresh air in. Bring your tog's as the pool & spa area is well worth a visit. Best thing is it's located in one of Berlin's premier area's. There was some very nice restaurants close by that had fantastic food and a stunning wine list with both French, Italian and Australian high end vintages. 10 min walk to check point Charlie in one direction and 10min walk to the brandenburg gates & the reichstardt in the other.. Book ahead and get a good rate and spoil yourself..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was in the perfect location for sightseeing relatively inexpensive rooms and wonderfully decorated.”
Reviews.Author: MartinLauraS
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent would recommend to any visitors who like to spend most of their time walking to sights. Just about every activity we did in our busy 3 day schedule was in walking distance. Would stay here again if returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Hits every mark, Luxury Collection standards at a Westin !”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience from start to finish. The property entrance is two blocks away from the TXL airport bus stop, I hope this doesn't change when the new airport opens. It's right at the gateway to all Berlin has to offer the first time tourist. Upon arrival at 9 AM the morning after the hotel was sold out, I wasn't expecting a room to be available. Incredibly I was offered a choice of two rooms that were ready and one that I could wait for. The person even helped me with my choice, as one queen bed was most important to me, rather than two singles as a king. After helping me with my choice, she apologized for keeping me at the desk for more than a few minutes. Incredible. Every employee I encountered had this same professional can-do attitude. The rooms are moderately sized but very fresh and well laid out. The housekeeping was impeccable every day. By the fourth day I was looking for something out of place and couldn't find it.The bed was comfortable as were the sheets and towels. The building has lots of character. For those who need it to pass the time, the only English TV are the international news stations. There are movies in English on pay TV though. One tip, they have iPad rental for 19.50 Euros per 24 hours. I tried it and it was great. There were maps, and the easy email in your room and unlimited web over the cell phone network was great. If you don't need what's on your laptop, this is probably a better deal then paying for daily internet service unless you need to download anything really big as I did hit a network limit for a single download. Upon checkout at 5:30 AM, they had a table next to the desk with coffee, juice and cookies for those leaving before the restaurant opened. Another total surprise. I'd recommend this property, even at a premium if you appreciate a well run hotel such as this. In a foreign country where you don't speak the language, this could be a premium you could find worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SAT33
Reviews.Content: During our Europe trip my wife and I stayed at the Westin Grand for one night. The hotel was once the most luxurious hotel in the GDR and you still can feel a Grand Hotel athmosphere. The lobby is impressive and the staff is very professional and helpful. As my wife is spg gold member we got an upgrade upon check in and the room was fully equipped. The bed was superb and ensured a good nigth sleep. The breakfast buffet had many choices and the food was delicious. (very good!). The hotel is perfectly located near the subway statiion "Friedrichstrasse" what makes it very easy to discover the german capital. In general a solid 5 star hotel with very good breakfast and perfect location. I would go back at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: StevoA
Reviews.Content: Perfect experience at this location, 20 - 30 min from Tegel airport, located right in the center of everything, Checkpoint Charlie was about 10 blocks down the street, the Brandenburg Gate was easily accessible walking distance, the city tour bus leaves from the opposite side of the gate and costs were 20 euro for a day tour. Wireless and wired internet connection throughout the hotel, free if you're a platinum member, also, another benefit of the platinum level is breakfast is 50%. Huge comfortable lobby, with bar area, ultra friendly staff, and great room make this a superb stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice Facilities!”
Reviews.Author: face4
Reviews.Content: We attended a friend's wedding outside of the city, then stayed at the Westin for a few days while exploring Berlin for the first time. Pleased to find their restaurant was serving the seasonal asparagus! Great location in walking distance to some tourist sites, across the street from Galeries Lafayette (highly recommend their first floor market, stop by the seafood section for a bowl of their fischsuppe and a glass of wine!). And a lovely children's department. At the hotel there was a little confusion with our room at check in as our suite was not ready due to a strange smell, we were given a standard room where we found a strange smell, then later changed to a suite without any smells. The rest of our stay was enjoyable and relaxing. Nice sized indoor pool for a city hotel, we would've liked it even more if the pool had been heated. The evening concierge was very helpful and happy to answer questions, while it was a bit like pulling teeth with the day time concierge. We would stay at the Westin Berlin again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, fantastic hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: George081
Reviews.Content: It was really nice four days in the mid-June what we had in Berlin and not least because of this amazing hotel. Goes up there with the very best Starwood-hotels what we've seen so far. The service at the front desk, housekeeping and restaurant is second to none. Only minor minus goes to the Spa and Gym and this is why I drop one point from 5 out of 5 in my rating..first of all the location inside the hotel: takes a bit effort to find/get there and most importantly I faced quite sloppy service there and the guys were not very welcoming - felt like you dont want to "bother" them in the middle of working day, come on this shouldnt happen in Starwood hotel. But ok, I can forgive that. Othewise as usual its very clean and nice rooms - the best beds to sleep and awesome bathroom etc. Roomservice works like a Swiss-clock, it was really a pleasure to use them. Also breakfast-buffet was really worth it. Not to forget the bellcaptains and everyone spoke good English with very positive attitude - which to be honest wasnt always the case in Berlin otherwise, where you get better service and attitude if you can do your business in German.

Reviews.Title: “Well located business hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanemat84
Reviews.Content: Spent far too short a time in the hotel which is both well located and equipped. The Westin bed remain one of the most comfortable in the market so was suitable rested for my meeting the following day. The buffet breakfast had an excellent choice of hot and cold options. Would definitely look to stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, otherwise just anotyher business hotel”
Reviews.Author: leidenaar
Reviews.Content: Chosen because of location and special rate (through Starwood). Rooms are comfortable, Bathrooms Ok, but niggardly on Soap, and they must have too many shower caps since we got loads every day !Beware ! Outrageously expensive for phone and internet ! This was our second stay really because of location and price. Next time though we will treat ourselves to an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: oriyo
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was great. Had everything I needed, but at a steep cost. I found the internet and breakfast extremely expensive and nothing was significantly different from cheaper hotels. The area itself was great and there were really good restaurants around. Service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: WorldHotelGuru
Reviews.Content: I have to say - along with being very central to Berlin this hotel had excellent service from waiting staff to room service to housekeeping. The only negatives for me was the price of food from the room service menu - but I'm not very well financially off so this may not bother many people who might stay in this hotel. The other thing was the food portions were very small. Other than that it was excellent. The pool area was average - again the only drawback was that use of the sauna was an additional €8 for us so we opted not to use it. The open area then around the pool was quite cold once you got out of the pool but these are minor grips for what is obviously a hotel that takes it's service seriously, and it shows - you just have to pay a little extra which I'm not always the biggest fan of. All in all a lovely hotel around the corner form the Opera house, french & german cathedrals, checkpoint charlie, brandenburg gate, the reichstag & some nice resuatraunts. Also on the corner of a U-bhan underground station which makes travelling around Berlin quite easy.

Reviews.Title: “great location + facilities”
Reviews.Author: MOR12350
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, nice and efficiant staff, deillicious breakfast, vry good location in the middle of everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel----Great Service....I will be back for sure!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: savvastzeve
Reviews.Content: Very warm welcome despite the fact that rooms were not ready on arrival time (10:00 am as requested on booking). They upgraded me as platinum member to a junior suite and then i payed an extra amount to have a spa suite that i really enjoyed, very spacious, clean and modern furnished.You should try the spa suite is unique! Breakfast was amazing, lots of different food, big variety of fruits, salumi and cheese. All personell were very polite and willing to assist in best possible way. The surrounding area was perfect for eating, shopping and walking. only negative aspect is that business center is on charge!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - world-class service”
Reviews.Author: TXinParis
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights for business and had no issues at all. The location is perfect at the intersection of Unter der Linden and Freidrichtrasse. The bed was the best part of the room - plush yet firm. The staff - always willing to help, courteous and friendly. The only downside is the 20 euro fee per 24 hours for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: holtspa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights here over a weekend, and could not find fault with anything. The location is superb, right in the centre of town, but our room (at the back) was so quiet and peaceful that we slept like logs, even with jet-lag. The bed and bedding was perhaps the best we have ever had in a hotel. The room was a little small, but fantastically clean and comfortable. The lobby bar provided a great place to relax after 24 hours of travel and breakfast, though not cheap, set us up for the day in great style. Thoroughly recommended if you want to spoil yourselves on a visit to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the East & West”
Reviews.Author: dominatorev
Reviews.Content: This was 4,5 -star hotel. Good location in shopping street Friedrischtrasse, near the attractions to the Checkpoint Charlie and East-side. And also quite near to the u-bahn keypoint Stadmitte to go east or west side. Hotel features was good, gym, swimming pool and jacuzzi. The lobby was awesome and the lift system, with 4 lifts was effective and nice. The view of the hotel was to the friedrischstrasse and hotel room was very high. There are all about 7 floors. Bad things was that air condition was little bit noisy, but it used to sleep. The pillows wasn't so great, they were unshapen, maybe it was the heavenly bed style, but i didn*t like it. I didn't complained these, because it was not a big problem. In the rooms there was keylocks, bath, security box and big lcd-tv with 40 channel options. There was three breakfast options: Cheapest was 21€/per day/per person. I would suggest this hotel to everyone. If it would be possible, it would be very great if you could get sunny from the pool. So take off the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible location for general sights”
Reviews.Author: DSandA
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely decor and interior design, certainly feels grand. The food in the restaurant was divine and the indoor pool is super. The room rates were very decent but you do pay for the extras as is the case with most higher class hotels of this calibre. That said, service was brilliant and would recommend if you have a few pennies spare.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious 5star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DrL10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in mid march for a leisure break. In one word -outstanding. Breath taking lobby..with the amasing grand stairs leading to it...very spacious with a really nice bar also! We had a garden view room which was really nice and quiet and the beds were heavenly!!!! Breakfast is a MUST do! Although expensive it is well well worth it. Yummy german meats makeup a grand spread with fantastic service. Pool area is stylish too though a shame you have to pay extra to use the sauna! To sum it up..I couldn't wait to check in at this hotel and once there I did not want to leave! It's awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFig514
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Had a ?renovated room in what seemed to be a newer part of the hotel. This was supposed to be an upgrade, but the location on the first floor over Unter de Linden ave made for a noisy morning, despite the excellent windows. The biggest downside was the trek from the (only!) front door to our room, had to use two difft elevators, and cross lengthy corridor in between, really a pain. This is Berlin, not Vegas!!!! Pool area was beautiful, but very slippery floors and NO English newspapers or magazines (plenty in German). Bar was nice, drinks pricey but expected in big hotel. Good service. Breakfast is way too much, unless on someone else's dime, and even then, go to one of the many local cafes, for more authentic experience at a quarter the price. Still a great location, and overall nice atmosphere. Plus, gotta love those beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but had to pay for extras”
Reviews.Author: DaveKap
Reviews.Content: Booked this weekend break through Travelocity. When we arrived we were told that the standard room had twin beds and to get a superior room with king size bed we would need to upgrade for 20 Euros per night (which we did). No complaints about the room or service which you would expect from a 5* hotel. How I was bit miffed that they charged extra for internet access. I have stayed at many 4* business hotels where internet access is included in the price. I would have expected this to be the case at a 5* hotel of this quality. We had a room ovelooking the roof garden which was very pleasant and quiet. Not sure what the rooms overlooking Unter den Linden or Friedrichstasse would be like. May be noisy?

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a more fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl055
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early on a Saturday morning hoping just to drop our luggage off, before heading out to explore. The staff at reception couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Our room was ready and it proved to be spacious, well appointed, spotlessly clean and with a fabulous view over Unter den Linden. The hotel is about a 5 minute stroll to the Brandenburg Gate and then just a few minutes further to the Reichstag and Holocaust Denkmal. It is well placed for public transport with 2 stations within a couple of minutes walk plus the TXL from Tegel airport has a stop almost outside the hotel. The hotel gym, while small, was well equipped and if you have not got room to pack your kit, the hotel has a service that supplies you with all you need! The concierge was more than helpful when asked about recommended areas to go out in for the evening. The choice at breakfast was vast and all the food was fresh. All in all a fabulous hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace to the city of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: princeadnan
Reviews.Content: Dull and dark corridors, unwelcoming staff, small rooms, crude washroom, hit or miss service, limited breakfast options. You will end up not liking this beautiful and charming city if you stay here. Neither for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “My adult son and I had wonderful accomodations and were assisted by concerrned and courteous staff. .”
Reviews.Author: SamChoice
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Berlin and if either of us return, I am sure we will give first consideration to The Westin Grand. When was this hotel originally built? Any connection to the movie Grand Hotel? It is, indeed, a grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for the Tired and Weary Traveler”
Reviews.Author: JetBlue2
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Berlin with a bad virus and at midnight after a very long flight delay of 10 hours. I will always remember the Westin Grand as being a very welcomed site for a weary and ill traveler. The rooms are large, the beds superb (mattress was just right and pillows fluffy), and the breakfast (not included) outstanding. I had such a good night's sleep there that I felt fully refreshed when I awoke and my virus was abating. This hotel is conveniently located just blocks away from the Brandenburg Gate and Check-Point Charlie. This is a Five Star property with a well-deserved rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...one of thebest nights sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: LadyJo79
Reviews.Content: Such an amazing hotel...one of the best luxury hotels we have ever stayed in. Great pool, sauna and jacuzzi facilities and we had such a fantastic massage!! Staff were incredible and very friendly....we would definatley stay again x

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: On Friedrichstasse and Unter Den Linden one couldn’t possibly find a more central location. It’s a five minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate, 10 to Museum Island, a couple of minutes to Galleries Lafayette, in fact the hotel is slap band in the middle of everything. The Westin is large but surprisingly intimate; the staff are attentive and efficient. The bar on the ground floor is very comfortable with sofas and plump armchairs. Our room overlooked the garden with a small balcony (the only place to smoke in the hotel). The room was a good size but the very best thing about the hotel was the BED, fabulous. Breakfast was very good, eggs cooked to order, but very pricey. A very large pool with juice bar, sauna etc. I tried the pool my partner had a sauna for which he was charged 8 Euros, a ridiculous charge in my opinion, I have never paid to go into a sauna at a hotel before. We were only in Berlin for two nights and if you are planning a short trip I couldn’t recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “So Gemütlich and awsome!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaBarbosa
Reviews.Content: We loved to be there! The staff is so professional, kind and simpatic. The buffet was so fabulouse there are food for people fro Asia, Africa, all kind of tastes. The location is fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ebtur
Reviews.Content: great location, just next to Friedtichstrasse, and unter den linden. the very center of berlin. small but nice wellness area, the hotel interior is very classical and luxurious, breakfast is very fine. it is one of the best hotels to stay in Berlin. the rooms are very modern, big, the cafe in the lobby is very nice, in the summer there is also a terrace cafe next to friedrichstr

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect service and indeed; "Heavenly beds".”
Reviews.Author: HPBKraaijeveld
Reviews.Content: I can be brief here. Location is among the best in Berlin. Right on the fashionable Friedrichstrasse (best shops in town) and close to Brandenburger Tor, Gendarmenmarkt, Checkpoint Charly und the Unter den Linden. Rooms are of a good size. Beds indeed heavenly. Bathroom is bit small but in line with 5-star cityhotels. Sumptous breakfast, splendid concierge service and a nice package; my son was offered the opportunity to get his own piece of a piece of the former Berlin Wall, right in front of the hotel. This was combined with a Berlin Currywurst (good quality, but it just has to be your taste) and a glass of sekt. All in all a very good experience here and well recommanded. Next time in Berlin, we'll definately stay here again. One recommendation for first-timers to Berlin. Take your hotel in Berlin Mitte (former East Berlin). All major touristic sites are close-by and the former West-Berlin just has not that much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Slinky159
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, situated in Mitte. We arrived at 1pm and even though check in was not until 3pm we were allocated our room right away on the 5th floor. The hotel reception was very friendly, spoke perfect English, and was very helpful, assiting with any thing we needed. The rooms were spacious and clean, and breakfast was amazing, there was a huge choice! Meals in the hotel were expensive, but then if you stay in a 5 star you should expect to pay 5 star prices. I would definately recommend this hotel to any one going to Berlin. We had a lovely time :).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for mid-luxury”
Reviews.Author: bigdiddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year's with friends. It was good value compared to the other nicer hotels in the area. But, it definately has the ideal location. We only tried breakfast and it was great, but unbelievably expensive. Didnt use any of the services or amenities. Room was cleaned daily and extra towels provided promptly on request. Room itself a bit small for the price but then again you have uber prime real estate. Lobby was beautiful. Check in and check out easy and breezy. Would absolutely stay again. On a sidenote Berlin is amazing for new years eve.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mwooduk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in December; we found the location and staff to be excellent and had no trouble at all finding great restaurants for breakfast, lunch or dinner within easy walking distance despite tons of snow. The room we had was very modern and the only thing about it we didn't like was the bathroom which had no tub, only a shower and the glass enclosure on the shower only goes halfway across the shower so when you take a shower, the whole bathroom floor gets wet which we found strange but not the end of the world! Great view of the Brandenburg gate from our hotel window and a kettle in the room with coffee and tea as well as the usual nice Westin amenities. The spa at the hotel was very nice (huge pool and nice jacuzzi) and the $8 extra they charge for access to the sauna rooms is well worth it as there are three different saunas, and showers and a foot soaker and it was immaculate. After taking a six hour walking tour in heavy snow through Berlin (with Brewers tours, recommended) it was just what the doctor ordered for our tired feet! The hotel is within a ten minute walk of a main train station which made getting to Shoenfeld airport for our flight back to London super easy (45 minute train ride - about 4 Euros per person) and we arrived into Tegel airport which is only an $18 taxi ride away. There are lots of restaurants in the area, we particularly loved the food at the Augustiner Restaurant (try the Berlin speciality of the pork knuckle with cabbage - fabulous) and the Christmas market was right across the street and is absolutely beautiful. Our best evening out was dinner at the Augustiner, followed by 2-3 hours at the Xmas market across the street drinking mulled wine and listening to a local men's choir singing! We joined in all the songs with the locals which ranged from Christmas carols in German through to YMCA!!! Berlin is a great city to visit and this hotel is a super area for taking walking tours and access to the main sights. Can't wait to go back in summer and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location – And a rather nice (and pricey) hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dctrentster
Reviews.Content: My perception of Berlin was very flawed. I had expected the city to be completely modern as a result of the city being rebuilt after WWII. In fact, 33% of the city was destroyed. In fact, the part of the city that was known as West Berlin does seem to be much more modern though there are still many interesting sites to see in that section. I found much more interesting architecture and culture east of the Brandenburg Gate. And it’s just east of the Gate that you’ll find the Westin Grand hotel. Few hotels are situated as centrally as the Westin Grand is to the main sites. Within walking distance is nearly every major attraction Berlin has to offer. And its right in the middle of one of Europe’s most upscale shopping districts. The hotel is also situated across the street from a U (underground) line and two blocks down from a major S line. Directly behind the hotel on the main street that leads to the Gate is a good value-priced German restaurant called the Nanteck or something like that. If you’re interested in a truly historic restaurant a quick ten minutes walk to the east called the Bur Letzten Instanz (I may have misspelled) that has been in business since 1621. The hotel staff all spoke English. The business center was helpful when needed. And the bath was deep and the water hot – just the cure for an aching body that walked all over town in 10 degree weather. If you’re visiting Berlin in the winter, a few tips: bring warm clothes, bring study warm boots, and be prepared to walk on top of the snow because the Berliners don’t try to fight the snow by melting. Rather, they tend to put dirt and small stones on top of it to improve traction. Location aside, this is a very nice, upscale hotel. Lobby is expansive and well appointed. We did not visit the pool or the gym though I would expect both to be nice. Rooms were very clean and a bit on the smaller side. Beds were very comfortable. We chose this hotel primarily because of the location and because we were using points. I love the Starwood Preferred program. We’re clearly not the target audience for this hotel though because they seem to be interested in customers who have no cost concerns. I’m more on the frugal side and this is definitely an À la carte place. Even basics that I’ve come to expect with all hotels were not included such as instant coffee. The only option for coffee is room service at 10 Euros. The water was 8 Euros. Thank goodness I didn’t need to learn the price for an internet connection. My rating of 3 for Value was given from the perspective of someone who paid 149 Euros for the hotel a night. Those minor price gauging aspects aside, this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: The gods were looking out for me because we were upgraded to an enormous suite on the top floor. The room was beautiful and the staff were lovely. Great location on a good shopping street very close to the Reichstag and public transportation was excellent. Breakfast was very good, all in all I had and excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Neuenburg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Westin Hotel in Berlin in November of 2010 for a business trip. My conference hotel was overbooked, and so I looked downtown and picked by location. The Hotel is wonderful - very stately in design, with superb staff and very good service. It is located about three blocks from the Brandenburg Gate, and close to excellent shopping, museums and other attractions. The concierge staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions and booking. The breakfast buffet is expensive, but definitely worth it (29 Euros). Great place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Westin good as always”
Reviews.Author: AliceUK
Reviews.Content: We are never disappointed with Westin Hotels, the heavenly bed is just as described. Bathroom very well appointed always has face cloths, towels replaced, good toiletries etc., Lovely hotel in Berlin. Trip Advisor reviews were very helpful, yes the breakfast if not included is not great value as it is very expensive for what it is. I have just two comments to make, as it was snowing and freezing cold the Westin is not best placed for walking to local cafes particularly for breakfast and if you don't know the area it is difficult to find many restaurants in the immediate vicinity and the one's we did find because of the time of year, I would imagine, are in need of pre booking. The service in the hotel is excellent, there was an issue over the pillows and they dealt with it straight away. The Christmas markets are well worth going to and we were in the area for the best one at the Gendemenmarkt surrounded by four churches in a lovely square. The Christmas market there was quite amazing with purpose built cafes that were beautifully decorated even with chandeliers on the ceiling! if you want to buy a hat then this is the place, lots of artists selling their hats everywhere, interesting hats both attractive and eccentric. We also went to the latest shopping mall in Berlin, Alexa, which is very nice although it will cost you 30c to use the toilet. Spotless toilets though. There were some good sales on in the shopping mall. We hope to go back to see more of the city when it is not covered in thick snow and very cold.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Berlin spoiled by excessive pre auth, lazy administration and arrogance”
Reviews.Author: pnugent71
Reviews.Content: Returned home from a wonderful first trip to Berlin and the Christmas Markets to find charges on my credit card of over 900 euros even though the cost of my room only stay came to only 375 euros. My card had been pre authorised in excess of 500 euros and no one had cancelled this when I checked out or when the funds for my stay cleared. A week later and the pre auth has still not been cancelled which means I have not been able to use my credit card at all. I have also spent time and money on the phone to my credit card company, hotel customer services who were too busy to help and just gave me the direct number of the hotel which meant I also incurred international call costs. I sent an email which has seemingly been ignored and have finally spoken to someone who assured me it would be sorted out. At no stage have I received anything that resembles an apology in any way but then they have my money now so I doubt that will be happening any time soon. Frequently in hotels like these I am finding that weekenders are treated like second class citizens compared to business travellers but a five star hotel with a five star price tag should provide a five star service to all its csutomers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, pure luxury!”
Reviews.Author: znapie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great location. Big rooms and good beds, near everything; walking distance from big streets or 1 min to the u-bahn for the rest of Berlin. Great breakfast, good pool/spa/gym area. I totally recommend this hotel to everybody!! If i go back i will choose it again..

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a merely average hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexb2
Reviews.Content: Sadly this property is not of the standard you should expect from a Westin. The best point is the location, that's about it. The interiors look tired and jaded. The dominant tones of brown and beige add to the somewhat gloomy impression. Our room was tiny. The bed occupied 80 or 90% of the floor space, making it impossible to move about much. One side of the bed was blocked by a giant armchair, meaning you could only get in and out of the bed on the other side. Bathroom ok, but the sort of standard that would have passed for luxury 15 or 20 years ago. You need to keep up with developments in styling and interior architecture a bit. The competition doesnt stand still. Our rate of 190 EUR did not include breakfast. There are other 5* properties in central Berlin that are superior to the Westin that will include b/fast at the same sort of rate, not to mention a top of the line large room (Hyatt for example). Lobby drinks are just obscenely overpriced (8 Eur for a 0,5L beer). The same thing costs 2,50 Eur a few steps down the road on Unter den Linden. I realise you pay a markup in hotel lobbys but there is a difference between a markup and a mickey-take. We noticed the hotel seemed largely empty on the Wed/Thu we were there. This, in the pre-Christmas shopping weeks, ought to alarm management. The Westin chain needs to freshen this place up a bit in terms of decor and seriously rethink its pricing policy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in EAST Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BreakingNews58
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty basic hotel. Nothing fancy or really special about it but the location is just great so I do recommend it. It's clean and safe. The rooms are pretty nice, too. The price is also right! Take the BUS from the airport. You get off just one block from the hotel--it's so easy and so much less expensive. And then get your map and go. You can walk almost everywhere from Museum Island to Check Point Charlie and so on. We did cab over to the old WEST Berlin and then walked back. It was a long walk but beautiful. Berlin is amazing. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, location, comfort and facilities were all great”
Reviews.Author: jdh009
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid morning on Friday and were very pleasantly surprised that we could check into our room immediately. Made a huge difference being able to drop luggage and re-sort bags ready for discovering the city. Room was on the 6th floor, overlooking the main strasse but very quiet. Bed was very comfortable and the room whilst not huge was well equipped and nicely furnished. Spotless bathroom with very nice powerful shower. As with most hotels, mini bar prices and internet charges were high, so didn't bother. Great checkout time (noon) and no problem leaving bags to collect later, very helpful concierge service. Location was great, U bahn almost opposite and a short walk to some of the major sights. Would stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “high scale”
Reviews.Author: oltraz
Reviews.Content: Excelent breakfast. Big and clean rooms. Hotel- great location, just around anything you might wanna see in Berlin. The room I had was facing the rather noisy Friedriech Strasse, but the windows offered good sound proof, so you don't have to worry about getting awaken in the morning by traffic noise. The Internet connection in the room is extravagantly expensive, but if you have an I-pass account on your business laptop you can avoind that cost, as it works just fine. The SPA is decent and gives you the chance to refresh before going out for dinner (small round poool, gym and saunas). A separate elevator takes you from your floor to the spa section of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: moncic
Reviews.Content: Nice central location (Mitte), and nicely renovated as well. The sleep quality is one of the best as the beds are awesome. Rooms are a bit small but so are they in many other hotels as well. The only thing that I really found very strange is that you have to pay additional 8 Eur in order to use the Sauna....so the pool and jacuzzi is free but not the sauna....unbelievable. Otherwise I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelerCyprus
Reviews.Content: Guys it was one of the best stays in my life. Comfortable rooms, excellent service. Very nice location near restaurants and shops. A bit expensive but worths it. Fast internet and professional support. Definetly stay there if you have the budget. Perfect hotel for business!

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: Spongejim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a fantastic position as it is easy to get onto the subway and is a short walk to some of the tourist sites Berlin has to offer. However it was quite expensive and the hotel seems to lack some of the features I would have expected in terms of no heavenly shower and the beds were a bit too soft for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareCEO
Reviews.Content: The location of the Westin Grand, on Friederichstrasse and Unter der Linden, puts you right in Mitte district, the #1 place to be in Berlin. Just east of the Brandenburg Gate along the "Embassy Row" and at the top of the high-end shopping district, you're right where you want to be. The staff is lovely and helpful, the food is great (very nice breakfast buffet), and the rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, lives up to the Westin Standard”
Reviews.Author: DrZog1901
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Perfectly positioned to see the City, everything is in walking distance. Will definitely be staying here again, we had loads of fun. You could save a little cash and book a room only rate and then go and explore for breakfast. There are loads of places about 5 minutes walk. Great staff too

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Fasted09
Reviews.Content: I am happy to say that the Westin service and the quality of the hotel is consistent around the world. Just fantastic!! Stayed here over the weekend for 3 days and we were not one bit dissapointed. As usual the 'heavenly' bed is what it is ....just heavenly. The location of this hotel is just fantastic, it is within walking distance to a lot of attractions in Berlin and shopping centres. Only 1 slight setback was the service at the lobby bar, we were there for drinks the 3 days when we were there and it was hard gettig the attention of the staff there. This will not stop us from returning again to The Westin Grand. Love the hotel, the location, the bed, the staff ( even the service was not the best at the lobby but they were very polite) etc....give this hotel ago and you will not regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: AvniBaroda
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Hotel has a very grandeur look. Stepping into the lobby you feel the elegance instantly, with the centre staircase adding sophistication to the overall look. Always buzzing with guests coming in and out, you always find yourself amongst tourists and locals, simply seeking to have a great time in this amazing city. The Lindern view rooms are superb with a beautiful sight from the rooms, which are very airy and spacious. The modern touch in the rooms is calming and with curtains that create total darkness in the rooms, a morning sleep in is guaranteed. With many great restaurants within walking distance, as well as most of the city's famous sites, it makes this hotel a perfect choice. In our 4 days in Berlin, we saw so much, all on foot!! The breakfast was also very good with a wide variety to choose from. The concierge were very helpful, booking restaurants for us and recommending specific places. A great hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I was there during the anniversary of the...”
Reviews.Author: snotty
Reviews.Content: I was there during the anniversary of the falling of the Berlin wall and the location was the best with walking access to all the central attractions. The rooms were clean and of high quality. I had a lunch that was a bit on the expensive side, but the over value is good. Definitely a good hotel for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Best location- within a walking distance...”
Reviews.Author: Danapu
Reviews.Content: Best location- within a walking distance to almost everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for the Brandenburger gate and local area”
Reviews.Author: MikeWNewport_Uk
Reviews.Content: nice rooms, excellent service and a great location at a reasonable price for two people in mid week... Breakfast very pricey but plenty of optons nearby. Metro choice nearby and 200m from the emotional centre of Berlin ... Quirky bonus wa sa sale at the Props departmet of the Comic Opera around the corner... Pool opening good hours but the circular shape made real distance swimming more dizzy than ideal. Sauna cheap and not always fired up, but the club is run as an entity from the hotel. Near to Check Point Charlie too - take a garden view room BUT no real double beds it seems

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: miscaorg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area, but it is extremely overpriced for the average room and service provided. The bed was not comfortable due to the plastic mattress cover over the pillow top mattress, and the two feather pillows were inadequate. The duvet was very narrow and short and did not cover the bed. The shower head would not stay in place, and the toiletries and soap provided were not enough after daily maid service. After our second call to the desk our second night, extra towels and two extra pillows were brought to the room. The Relish Restaurant was very good, since the food and service were most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: 9TOM9
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 5 night stay, and echoing many of the other reviews, the location simply can't be beat. Situated along Friedrichstraße, you have a large selection of high-end shops, and those in-between. Plenty of cafes nearby where you can get free wifi (such as Einsteins, or Starbucks), in addition to grocery shops where you can pick up locally priced water, and other foodstuffs. Thank you Westin for NOT installing one of those awful vending machine-style mini-bars. There are also a number of food courts located below ground level in the blocks adjacent. The location was ideal, with a lot of major attractions within walking distance in each direction, whether it be Museum Island to the east, Brandenburg Gate to the west, or Checkpoint Charlie and the Jewish Museum to the south. Even the Gemaldegalerie and Neue Nationalgallerie are within walking distance, just past the Sony Center to the east. As to the facilities in the hotel itself that I used, I can say that the Gym is small, but adequate. It could use better lighting and its own music source. The pool itself is almost like a wading pool, and not setup for exercise or doing laps. There are 2 treadmills, along with several ellipticals and stationary bikes. They also have a full complement of dumbbells, along with one fixed multi-station workout machine which just barely fits. Again, adequate but could be improved. As to the room itself, its excellent for keeping out noise - both external and from other rooms. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and excellent for sleeping. The flatscreen TV was of average quality, and had about 6 english language channels - CNBC, BloomBerg, CNN, SkyNews, BBCNews, and ESPN America. The cleaning staff was also excellent, and everything was as it should be when I returned each day. As to the bathroom, it was a bit cramped and the ceiling felt a bit low. It could also use some better lighting. Unfortunately folks didn't have showers back in the Grand Hotel era, so the bath has been retrofitted with a shower contraption that is barely adequate. Water pressure was also passable. When compared to the large natural slate showers at the Lindemann's Berlin, it doesn't even come close. Still, I would recommend this hotel for its value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: gpbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand Berlin from Aug 29 until Sep 5. The staff were efficient and the hotel was indeed grand with its large atrium lobby. The hotel room was large and comfortable but the furnishing were dated. Though our room faced the Friedrichstrasse, the windows kept any noises out. At night the street was so quiet that we opened the large window for fresh air. The property's location is excellent. Most of Berlin's major attractions are within an easy walk. he city Tegel airport stops around the corner from the hotel. (2 euros each way). The S-Bahn (city train) station Friedrichstrasse is metres from the front door. The Brandenburg Gate is 5 min away. Museum Island (10 min), Potsdamer Platz (20 min). Upon arrival in Berlin, we bought a 5-day bus pass that we only used for the airport bus. Plenty of shopping and dining choices nearby. Though the Friedrichstrasse has many fine stores, we discovered the Alexanderplatz, which is home to the Galeria Kaufhof department store and the new Alex shopping mall. I'm so glad that we didn't stay in the former 'Western' side of town. We would gladly stay at this Westin again and again. BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable room, but too many problems with the bill”
Reviews.Author: Bavavia
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, short walk from Freidhofstrasse train station. near many major sites( walking distance). Lots of shopping, anything you need is within close range. Lobby bar of course very overpriced ( 6 euros for a beer that normally is 2.4 euro outside). Room was spacious, quiet, comfortable. No fancy furnishings except the bathroom which was nice with the heated tile floors and nice shower. Bed of course very comfy... Ability to view your bill on the TV was also nice. Breakfast buffet excellent.., i had mine included in my rate. It was very good and nicely done. The only issue with the room is that it was cold some nights and the hotel heater was not on yet, but they did bring up a portable heater which worked well when needed. My main issue was with the bill. They tried to charge me twice or extra on 4 separate occassions, so i spent more time at the reception desk than i would have wanted to. The first encounter was they had my rate in wrong. I brought proof of right rate but they still couldnt get it right until the end. Then i had drinks at the bar and transferred original check to another check, but they charged me for 2 checks and the lady in check in was very rude and pretty much called me a liar when i said i wanted credit for my 11.5 euros( she was on duty early saturday morning around 1:00 am at the desk, dont recall her name, but not very kind at all to guests). Then i bought something in mini bar,... i came down and paid it, then got charged for it. Then finally they messed up my rate, again, on the last day.. the day I had a long international flight back to New York.. so i was not really in the mood to argue, again, about my bill on the day i was leaving, but i had to in order for them to correct it. Finally it was correct and I was on my way. So if you stay here, i advise you to examine your bill every day and examine it closely. I would still recommend this hotel though because of the comfort and location and nice breakfast and because of the nice package i had which was the tear down the wall package. It was nicely done and the guy was really nice, the security guy, who helped me " tear down the wall". So if you stay , just watch your bill closely... Despite this, i would still recommend the hotel because of the other positive experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Beds made up for high priced extras”
Reviews.Author: Brockles
Reviews.Content: We chose the Westin Grand for its' excellent location. A short walk to the east will take you to the Brandenburg Gate, or head south to Check Point Charlie, or north to the riverside restaurants and river boats. Checking in and out was effortless, although it would have been nice to have been shown the bill to check before receiving it an envelope together with the creditcard receipt! Extras were rather pricey. A bottle of water was awaiting in the room - but open it and you will be billed €8. Items in the minibar were equally expensive, and in these days of 'Free Wi-Fi' becoming the norm, a charge of €19.50 per day is rare indeed. Breakfast for two, good though it was, increases the room rate by a further 25%. A coffee and a small draft beer will run you €6 each outside. The room was more than adequate, although the bathroom was rather basic - shower in the tub and rather small unheated towels were below par for a hotel of this calibre. But, and a very big but, the comfort of the bed was outstanding. Make sure your room offers the 'Westin Heavenly Bed'. Sinking into this exquisite luxury for a glorious night's sleep does wonders to calm any slight qualms you may have about all those expensive extras!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard”
Reviews.Author: mikezens
Reviews.Content: The location of the Westin is very good. 10min walk to Brandeburg gate, shops around the corner and quite a few coffee bars close by (Important if you do not want spend a fortune on breakfast in the hotel). Also very easy access by Subway (2min from station). The hotel itself wants to present itself as a Grand Hotel related to the old Grand Hotels from some 70 years back. In my opinion it fails here as the interior falls short of a Grand Hotel. It is somewaht a mix of modern style and old elements, which fo me does not go so well together. The rooms itself are very nice. We got a junior suite, which gives some extra room to strech out, only downside is that there iwasonly a small window in the room, so it is relatively dark. Else the rooms are nice and the bathrooms very nice. I was disappointed that there was no waterbolier / coffee maker in the room. Not quite 5 star standard. Check-in / out personell and Concierge are very nice and helpful. Overall a good hotel, if you can get a decent rate

Reviews.Title: “Central and replete”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Nice summertime location with a garden at its centre and an atrium inside. Excellent shopping on Friedrichstrasse and Unter Dem Linden, walk to Museums or U bahn or S bahn. Concierge was fantastic. The rooms are comfortable although they do not seem to have the Westin bed. There is an excellent gym and pool - inclusive of room rate. Sauna 8 Euro extra.

Reviews.Title: “there are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: Flor72Zurich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin in July 2010 and the hotel is an old hotel renovated. The service by some of the staff was not the greatest, some of them were very rude in the reception and also in the business center. The breakfast is super expensive and it was not of great quality. I try to stay at westin hotels since I like the quality but this one is not the best one. I would not even call it westin.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Location”
Reviews.Author: BindiB
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have said, this Hotel is in a wonderful location. A 10 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate, similar to the Reichstag. An interesting walk to the Museum Island in the other direction as well as "Checkpoint Charlie" not far away. We also got a wonderful rate by booking with British Airways. 2 rooms for 3 nights cost a little over £500. A Tour company quoted me £750 each (including breakfast for the same 3 nights). Unfortunately breakfast not included in our rate. As we understood it was mega expensive we ate at the Einstein Cafe virtually next door, but the main Einstein Cafe on Unter den Linden offered a wonderful choice for breakfast. The Hotel was clean, good quality bed linens, towels could have been more fluffy and only one bathrobe per room (!) Rooms were big enough and public areas expansive and comfortable. Felt overall decor was rather "beige" and needed a bit of colour to sharpen it up. Relaxing with a drink on the outside seating area was great but not cheap. Underground stop right nearby and TXL stop for airport just up the road on Unter den Linden. Only E8.40 for all 4 of us to get to the airport - a bargain! Everyone at the hotel was helpful and our room was ready 2 hours ahead of the published check-in time. As a frequent visitor to London, I am used to virtually free admission to museums and galleries. Not so in Berlin, except Reichstag. It cost us £40 for the 4 of us to get into the Checkpoint Charlie museum and, although others are cheaper, it makes a dent in spending money. Not a huge choice of restaurants close to the Hotel but mainly enjoyed the ones we visited. Notable exception was Dressler. Recommended by our guidebook but our waiter was far more interested in having a demonstration of an ipad being used by a fellow diner than serving us. Poor quality steaks and too many chips to "compensate". No aspect of the meal was good apart from the decor and crisp white tablecloths. Everyone smoking outside - not used to this anymore either! Overall though, would not stay anywhere else for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly bed? It certainly was!!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaM
Reviews.Content: Had to write the review about the bed alone. I read all the blurb about their bed selection with mild curiosity and then I woke up! The bed was fantastic, like I imagine sleeping on a cloud would be. No, not too soft that you awoke with backache just an extremely pleasant nights sleep. Whatever hassle they went through to select the bed was certainly worth it. The staff were very courteous, knowledgeable and professional, location excellent and spa facilities worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - in the heart of East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: martandrews
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand in Berlin (located at the Friedrichstrasse, the shopping area of the Eastern part of Berlin) is a tzpical hotel of the Starwood Hotel chain - not very stylish, but clean and spacious. Booked 6 weeks in advance we even got a decent rate. When enjoying the fabulous breakfast make sure it is included in your room rate - otherwise the 27 Euro that the Westin charges you for it is a bit much. In total, the hotel can be recommended - even thoug it is not charming like one of the small boutique ones.
