Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: clay304399
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westin as the last hotel on our trip around Germany. The room was very spacious and modern. The garden view however, well lets say it's not much of a garden. The hotel reception,bar and restaurant areas are excellent as are the elevators which rocket you up to your floor in no time. We did not dine at the hotel as there we were always out sight seeing and there are plenty of options to eat. Hotel is literally 2 mins around the corner to the Brandenburg gate where you can catch all the bus trips you want which will take you around the city. A great hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LaowaiInChina
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service, very nice breakfast. Rooms are relatively small, but convenient. Depending on the room you get, some "king beds" are just two single beds put together. Reasonably priced, unless trade fair in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: skoniem
Reviews.Content: Plenty of good resturants in the area. Walking distance to most sites in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Best City in the World”
Reviews.Author: VenetziaOleh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin Grand, Berlin 3 years in a row now. I am in love with it. The staff, the food, the service, the LOCATION is UNBEATABLE. The prices are SUPER HIGH....honestly every time I get the bill I shake my head as I'm doing now but for everything it has to offer it's worth it every single time... I will be back year after year and stay at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Leaking from the ceiling”
Reviews.Author: kash123
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and the heavenly beds is really heavenly unfortunately we didn't get much sleep due to the fact that the AC made it so that it started to leak water from the ceiling. The staff came and "fixed it" but same ting the next night. They said that we should turn the AC off but then the room got to warm. Couldn't have the window open cause the streets outside was to noisy. After the third night of interrupted sleep we got to change room and got a good nights sleep. We would have given this hotel a much higher rate if it wasn't for the leaking from the ceiling, not what you expect in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: hekili98
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is conveniently located within walking distance to the major sites in East Berlin and is a half-block from a U-Bahn subway station and two blocks from the Fredrichstrasse U-Bahn and S-Bahn station so you can easily access all of the city using its excellent (and safe) public transportation network (get a day or multi-day pass). It's in a major shopping area with lots of shops, restaurants and bars. The hotel itself has been recently renovated so it's modern and has all conveniences, at a price. Wi-fi and breakfast is costly, so go to Eintein Cafe a half block up on Fredrichstrasse for free wi-fi with your purchase. Our room was large, clean, quiet and had everything except coffee making facilities and iron. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but "odd..."”
Reviews.Author: Tewkesburycat
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for getting around - pleasant staff and a first class breakfast. Do also investigate the garden which is lovely. Some minor gripes stood out - the twin beds are rather small for anyone taller or wider than average - we arrived to only one bath towel and whilst hunting around the room made the mistake of assuming the bottle of water was complimentary - it isnt and its 8 euros! Clearly a theme here as the pleasant pool and spa area also charges 8 euros for guest to use the sauna - the powerplate machine is also roped off and you pay to use that too - but traumatised by the water experience we used neither

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bradthiele
Reviews.Content: 0Just got back from a three day break in Berlin. Got a good price by pre-paying through HotelClub. The hotel is excellently situated, right at Franzosischer Strasse U-Bahn station. If you're coming from Tegel airport, skip the taxi and take the express bus - just €2.40 per person! Friendly polite service on arrival and departure, and excellent bed - standard for Starwood hotels these days I think. The breakfast is completely price prohibitive, so shunned this in favour of the great coffee shop just down the street on Friedrichstrasse called "Einstein". a final warning - beware of the ridiculously expensive bottle of water that they put in the room €8.20! They even tried to charge us for it without having touched it! They didn't quibble however when I said we hadn't drunk it and politely removed romoved from the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Beautiful Hotel...Wonderful Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: trailsend007
Reviews.Content: We recently had the opportunity to spend a week at the West Grand in Berlin and had a wonderful experience. From the concierge's assistance in tickets, directions, general information...to the immaculate, comfortable rooms...we enjoyed our time and would definitely go back again. We were able to walk to the majority of the sites we wanted to visit, or catch one of the many modes of transportation to explore this wonderful city. Thanks to the staff for their help from our arrival to our departure!

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in European hotel in 35 years”
Reviews.Author: imssc1
Reviews.Content: On May 5 we stayed 7 nights in the Grand Westin Berlin. We booked a suite on points and the hotel and staff exceeded our expectations. The check in was personal and friendly. When we walked into the gigantic suite with a living room at least 400 square feet, we were delighted to see a bottle of wine, three arrangements of flowers, a three tiered silver tray of chocolates, cookies, and fruit. The suite had two bathrooms, one with double marble sinks, bathtub, and seperate shower. The bath products were Bulgari. The bed was Heavenly!!!!! The location was better than perfect. It is on the corner of Freidreichstrasse and Unter de Linden. Literally 100 feet from the metro and 3 blocks from the train station. The gallery Lafayette is across the street. Linden bakery next door, along with a half dozen great moderately price restaurants. Dietrich, the concierge is the consummate gentleman, and extremely knowledgeable about everything and more than willing to assist with any requests. House keeping is immaculate. The only negative is no coffee service in the room. But if you call room service, they will send you a coffee pot to boil water along with some instant coffee. After that we bought some instant coffee from Rossman's to last the next seven days. Breakfast was exemplary. They had rollmop herring, herring in wine sauce, herring in creme sauce,, lox salmon, prime rib, all kinds of meats,pates, cheeses, breads, great selection of very fresh fruits,yogurts, omelettes to order, strawberry and banana smoothies, grains, and a great selection of pastries. Coffee was delicious. I know people have complained about paying 29 Euros for this, but to be honest the food is top quality, and you do not have to eat the rest of the day. We usually took an apple and plum from the basket, and this was our lunch, thereby allowing more time for sight seeing. To our surprise, one afternoon, they had an hour concert on the grand middle stairway, featuring three opera singers, and a 7 year old violinist accompanied by someone on their grand piano! The swimming pool and hot tub are great along with the staff. The workout room is huge. It is a convention hotel, but the ambience is great. The hotel is very quiet, inside and out. They have a large section of the Berlin Wall outside the hotel, and by appointment , they will supply guests with a hammer and pick to chisel out your own piece of history. Please look at the glove store Roeckl. It is German made high quality gloves for men and women. High end shops all over. Wempe (Rolex, Patek Phillipe, Cartier) across the street. If you "need" a blue Buggatti or Mercedes, they are across the street also. We much preferred this part of town to the KaDeWa area. That are has turned into Time Square in New York. The Westin is a few blocks from the State Opera, right around the corner from the Komiche Opera, and within a 10 minute walk to Museum island and the Reichstag. Thank you for sharing your great hospitality and food for seven days. We have stayed in Baden-Baden at The Breners twice and the the breakfast food exceeds theirs by far. Also the suite at the Westin is newley updated. See you in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Berlin - Fantastic Location, Good Service, a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: pachelad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Grand Berlin from April 17-22. This was during the great volcano debachle. We checked-in and were given a great hotel on the fifth floor looking out at the Under Den Linden. The room was beautiful, and the windows were insulated. You couldn't really hear a thing at all. We slept soundly. It was a suite with a living area and separate bedroom. The bathroom only had a shower which was fine for us. Everything looked brand new. The only drawback was the lack of art or decoration in the room. That made it a bit odd and aseptic. However, I think this was because they had just been renovated. We did the breakfast buffet the first day because we were a little travel weary. It was 29euro for each breakfast which is pricey, even for Berlin. As a treat, it was really great. They had breakfast selections from around the world, and you could try anything you like. We got a kick out of sampling all the different kind of breakfast items - salmon, cheese, muesli, eggs to order, fresh baked bread, meats, fruit, etc. You should try it at least once. Berlin loves its breakfast, and you will too. The location of the hotel was wonderful. It was close to both the U6 (Franzosische) and U2 (Stadtmitte) subway stops. Very convenient for getting to our favorite neighborhood - Prenzlauer Berg. This neighborhood has great boutiques, great dining options and unique bars. There is so much more beyond the Mitte. Go out there and find it. For a cheap but delicious breakfast or lunch, try Schall & Rauch on Gleimstrasse. It's a great casual jumping-off point for a day in East Berlin. Take the U2 to Schonhauser Allee. The downstairs hotel staff was amazing. The barstaff was very pleasant and willing to help with anything you needed. Try the cake selection on the piano in the afternoons after a day of hitting the pavement. A very special thank you to two individuals at the Westin - Fabian, Victoria and Klaus. First, their English was nothing short of amazing. Second, they were very friendly and helpful. They directed us to a few cool places in the area that were a bit off the beaten track, and we loved them. Congratulations to the Westin staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the Heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is a very good hotel consistent with what you would expect from the Westin brand – extremely clean, practical, with understated quality. It is well located in the heart of a magnificent city at the intersection of Friedrichstrasse and Unter den Linden, only a few blocks from the Brandenburg Gate, Tiergarten, Reichstag, city library, Checkpoint Charlie, and many other historical sites. The lobby and common areas are very attractive, the grand staircase being the main feature Check-in was quick and friendly. My guest room was fine. It was clean and odor-free. There was a balcony, which was good because the room was broiling and there was no air-conditioning during that time of year, so I was able to open the balcony door and cool it off. The bed was very comfortable. The room had ample space with many of the amenities you would expect, but some were absent that would have been valued, such as coffee, ironing board, and iron. The bathroom was nothing special, but it was spotlessly clean. Hallway noise was good, but the room next door was extremely loud and my final night there was nearly sleepless. Wireless internet worked well but was absurdly priced – one of Westin’s least honorable hallmarks. Alas, breakfast was not included with my room and was a ludicrous cost – like 29€ or thereabouts -- so I am unable to vouch for the food. I did have a meal in the lobby restaurant, which was expensive but was respectable quality. They also serve some very nice dark beer. Again, this is a good hotel and I would certainly recommend it. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: GTK186605
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and has excellent U-bahn access from Schonfeld airport with a station very close by. Can't fault any aspect of trhe hotel - everything was as it should be.Breakfast was particularly good - enough to keep one going for most of the day. We asked the concierge on each of five evenings for a restaurant recommendation and we were more than deligheted every time. I'd have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “10/10”
Reviews.Author: Earby
Reviews.Content: I quickly arranged this as I was stuck in Warsaw and manged to get a train to Berlin, making my way back to Uk overland. I did not arrive till gone 10pm on Saturady and left at 8.00 am on Sunday, so did not get to see it all. However what I did see wa superlative, in fact I would rate this as one of the best hotels I have ever seen or stayed in. BRILLIANT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy77London
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel at a very good rate of 94 euros per night but were unable to travel due to all flights from the UK being cancelled as a result of the volcano in iceland. I emailed the hotel to inform them of the situation an to reschedule to new dates 3 weeks later. I was informed that the new rate would be 299 euros per night!!! Over 200 euros per night than what we had booked which would have been 600 euros extra for the 3 nights!! They refused to budge on this until finally saying they would throw in breakfast (extremely generous!!) and then eventually coming down to 199 (bargain!)! Even that was too much and I find it disgraceful they are trying to profit from this situation. There were rooms cheaper than what they were trying to offer me on booking websites but they said they didn't have access to those rates!! Although the 199 was still far too expensive the fact that they were able to offer it at 100 euros cheaper than what they first offered is a clear indication they were simply out to rip us off! All we wanted was the same rate we booked - no more, no less! The airlines were able to offer this but not this hotel. Their emails were also extremely rude!!

Reviews.Title: “A truely wonderful place to spend a few days”
Reviews.Author: Barbarous
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception were very friendly and efficient. The rooms was clean, warm and comfortable. It also had a view of the Brandenburg Gate. The restaurants were excellent and the buffet breakfast was one of the best I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to Unter den Linden”
Reviews.Author: berneguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days and enjoyed the place very much. After a renovation, rooms are in good shape, nice flat-screen, super friendly and helpful staff. Pool is pretty nice for a city hotel, but gym is a little poor. Else, great location, close to subway that leads to Alexander Platz or Kurfürstendamm, and there's a direct busline from Tegel Airport stopping around the corner. Got a special deal for about 100 euros per night and room. Compared to other European Capitals a real bargain... But rates for internet access are a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: gardkarlsen
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Berlin in the afternoon and the Tegel airport is only located about 15-20 minutes from the city center and the taxi ride was 20€. There is also a bus option that can take you to some of the larger train stations in Berlin. I booked the room at the Westin on the Starwood Preferred Guest site and the rooms started at 99€ which is not bad for a 5 star hotel in a large European city – only a few years ago I had to pay about 90€ for a 2 star hotel in Paris. As we were a bit late at booking the room went up to 111€ including taxes but without breakfast. Check in at the hotel was fast and we got room 454. The lobby of the hotel is dominated by a huge and lavish staircase leading to the first floor where the breakfast is served and where they have conference rooms and you also have an open atrium up to the various floors. Our room was a standard size room but it seemed to be newly refurbished. The floor was covered in a brownish carpet while the walls were painted in a light color. Instead of a king size bed we had gotten two single beds standing next to each other but we knew about this in advance. Westin (and Sheraton) keeps advertising about their heavenly bed and some of them are great. The beds at the Westin in Berlin were not that great in our opinion. First of all they were quite soft, the pillows were very thin and there seemed to be something in the mattress cover that made us sweat a lot at night. There were lots of lights in the room which I think is great and the windows faced Friedrichstrasse and the Bugatti showroom. We did hear a bit of the traffic noise but it was not a huge problem at night. Apart from that we had one big chair in the room with a small table, a desk with a chair and a 32” flat screen TV. The TV had lots and lots of channels in German (and note that even English speaking movies are dubbed into German) so the only thing that was in English was channels like BBC News, CNN etc. But then again – you are not in Berlin to watch TV. There was also a small fridge with items for sale – a Coke was 4.5 €, a Heineken 6 € and a small red wine was 10 € just to give you an idea of the prices. There were space for both our suitcases which was excellent as some hotel rooms seems to be designed for just one suitcase even if there is a king size bed meant for two people. The wardrobe contained quite a few hangers and there was a small safe – there was even a power outlet in the safe which means that you can charge your cell phone when it is locked up. The bathroom was tiled with white and black tiles and contained a shower in the bathtub. There was a glass wall that prevented water from splashing everywhere when taking a shower and this combined with a shower curtain worked pretty good. It was fun to see that the standard amenities (like shampoo, shower gel etc) is the same that you get at the Westin in e.g. Bangkok. The location of the hotel is great – located on the corner of Friedrichstrasse and Unter den Linden you are basically in the middle of town and you can easily walk over to museum island or Brandenburger Tor. Right outside the door you will find the U-bahn station Französische Straße and you can also walk to the larger Friedrichstraße station to catch both U-bahn and S-bahn. There are lots of high-end shops in the area (we are talking Bugatti, Ferrari, Hugo Boss, Wempe watch store) together with department stores (like Galeries Lafayette Berlin) and lots of restaurants. One tip if you don’t have breakfast included at the hotel is to grab a bit at Einstein Coffee near the hotel. Let’s talk about some of the issues that were not that great with the hotel. First of all – no free internet! I’m not sure how others plan their trip these days but we are very much online planners and we make a Google map before we travel and we normally need to get online to check details. The internet was 7.5 € for 1 hour at the hotel – I would rather recommend that you go to Einstein coffee nearby to get free Wi-Fi and enjoy some coffee for the 7.5 € instead. The breakfast at the hotel was 29 € per person for the buffet which is way too expensive. Yes, you can order a la carte at the hotel but still. I’m sure it is a wonderful breakfast but for a person that normally just eats a small sandwich or some muesli it is not necessary to go for breakfast at the hotel – but luckily there are many small coffee shops and bakeries nearby. I have already mentioned that we were not that impressed with the beds. I also found it a bit strange that we only got one bathrobe and one pair of slippers when they knew that we would be two people staying in the room. It was not a big issue and I assume that we could have asked for another. We also had to request an iron and ironing board – the iron was good but the board needs to be replaced soon. One afternoon when we came back to the hotel we found a used cleaning cloth left by housekeeping on the desk – I have stayed at quite a few hotels but I don’t think I have seen that before. But all in all – the Westin Grand Berlin this is a very nice hotel with a great location and compared to other major European capitals you seem to get the hotel at an affordable rate. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend friends or family to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: myself-7
Reviews.Content: I have visited Berlin several times, and also stayed at this hotel many others. The Westin Grand is in the famous Friedrichstrasse corner with the Unten den Linden. It is a short walk away from one of the most impressive squares in Europe. The Pariser Platz or where one can find the impressive Branderburger Tor. A short taxi ride away is one of the main shopping streets of this city,the Kurfurstendamm. Here one finds all kinds of shops to suit all pockets. The hotel boasts of fine cuisine in the Relish restaurant where one can also enjoy a small snack or relax during the unwind hour. Rooms are spacious and include all amenities. The newly refurbished suites, where I lodged, are very spacious, and have a larger than usual living area. Bathrooms here are big and include top range accessories. The gym is rather small but well equipped. The indoor pool right outside is large and has a round shape. Here one also finds a bar serving healthy drinks. Concierge is helpful and always pleased to make necessary reservations. Rest of staff is also friendly and helpful. On arrival we were greeted by a very charming and welcoming lady, who made us feel at home at a late hour after a long day of travelling. All in all I would definitely return to this hotel next time I am in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choise”
Reviews.Author: kbozis
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the perfect location for sightseeing. It is located in the most glamorous street of berlin. You will love this hotel, its architecture is breathtaking and the rooms are beatiful decorated. The bed is just 'heavenly'. Its an excellent choise

Reviews.Title: “The Westing Grand Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: growler69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Grand this month for the first time in six years and was happy to see it was every bit as great as I remember it. The location is absolutely wonderful for business or pleasure and the central foyer of the hotel is just wonderful. Had an excellent duck breast dinner in the lobby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Winter in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: arivest
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum Starwood SPG member in case one has concerns about my objectivity. This being said, this Westin Hotel is very confortable, with a beautiful lobby, beautiful pool and work out area and great location. It is in the former East Berlin, just by Friedrichstrasse and one block away from Unter den Linden. It is a beautiful area with lot of restaurants and boutiques. It is an easy walk to Potsdamer Platz with the museum and to Museum Insel. It is also within walking distance of nice and trendy areas of the former East Berlin. Rates are maybe high for Berlin but cheap for Europe. If you book a non refundable room, it is a risk you assume if you cannot make it there. Also, this is Europe so do not be surprised if your Queen bed is really two twins joined together. Alltogether a fine hotel; not of the Starwood Luxury Collection standart but a very nice and convenient place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: NJHomeRN
Reviews.Content: For a well respected hotel chain...beware! I had given my husband a trip to Berlin as a Christmas present. The trip was scheduled for Valentine's day weekend Feb 2010. We encountered a blizzard in the New York metro area. Continental airlines cancelled flight. I had "no way" to get to Berlin. I had booked "non-refundable" reservations at the Weston. They could have cared less...they charged the entire stay to my credit card. Numerous calls were made to the Weston hotel manager regarding the weather conditions we were facing...she could have cared less! I did not cancel, Mother Nature cancelled us! I well understood the conditions of the reservations, I did feel the Weston and it's parent company, Starwood could have done something more than nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best”
Reviews.Author: mlillywh
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. Really nice room (with a view of the Bugatti dealership in my case) in a very plush part of Berlin. Good service for evening meal and Breakfast. Its not cheap, but it is very good

Reviews.Title: “Competent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Playaneuron
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is a competent business hotel - bed, shower, flat screen TV, fitness room, pool all excellent. The breakfast was very good, but at 29.50 Euros was exorbitant. Wifi was also exorbitant, and despite a hefty room charge they also charged 8 Euros for a three cabin (women's, mixed dry, somewhat cooler saunarium with colored lights) sauna. The location is great, a few blocks from the Museum Insel and the Friedrichstrasse S Bahn, next door to the Komische Oper, and right across the street from the Franzosische Strasse U Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “three star hotel for a five star price”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInSF
Reviews.Content: Room was okay sized, but for the rate I was paying (259 € per night), I would've expected a lot more value for the Euro. On the flip side, we were staying for a few days over the New Years Holiday and most hotels in Berlin seem to explode their rates up to three times the normal rate. Judging from the people down in the hotel bar and restaurant area, my original guess was that the age range in this Westin skews to well over 50 years old. Once I made it down to the gym & pool floor, I saw people more my age (mid 30's and early 40's). Your first impression might involve a vague musty odor pervading the entire building. It's probably not noticeable to anyone working in the hotel on a daily basis, but a guest is likely to notice this upon walking in the door each time. Upon arrival in the room, I noticed our one bed was actually two twin mattresses joined together to make a queen sized bed. It wouldn't have been so bad except both mattresses had individual bed-sized sheets, which encouraged the two mattresses to easily separate, making it very difficult to get close or snuggle a significant other. Judging from the middle-aged to senior clientele I saw downstairs, I'm guessing a lot of guests here choose to sleep in separate beds. I wonder if this is a problem with most of the rooms or just certain rooms on certain floors? There's a room safe hidden in the closet. It was big enough to hold my 15" MacBookPro (but not very comfortably; requiring some acrobatic turns to place it into there). Internet was available via WiFi or in room Ethernet and costs 19.50 € for 24 hours (seven consecutive nights of Internet runs 100 €). The Internet was fast & thorough enough to allow me to quickly download a few movies from Apple's iTunes service to watch. Inexplicably for a hotel of this caliber, there was no alarm clock or coffee/tea maker in my room (again, I'm not sure if this is just a missing feature of our standard room or if there are simply no alarm clocks in all of the rooms). Standard rooms came with exactly two big towels, two little (hand) towels and two washcloths. The bathtub has a tiny (maybe 1/4 length) glass window (splatter guard?) for the shower. The black out drapes were very effective and as the humidity coming from the heater was pretty much zero, so I was very thankful I could open one of the windows in my room to let some fresh (and slightly more humid) air in. The Westin staff appears to be very accustomed to Americans who provide gratuities. We did room service the first evening (three items & two bottles of water came to 50 €), and the server made sure to point out that I could add an additional tip on top of the service charge at the bottom of my room service bill. And my traveling companion wasn't feeling very well another night and since there are no coffee or tea makers in the standard rooms, I went downstairs to the bar to get tea and hot chocolate (13.50 €). I gave the bartender twenty and he handed me back five (i.e. some unknown service charge, or some implied tip the bartender was helping himself to). This letdown in service was annoying. My SPG Gold card appeared to do absolutely nothing for me, which was a big bummer as I've stayed at Westin hotels that allowed me access to either a club lounge (which this Westin does not have) or a slight upgrade to a SPG floor (which this Westin also apparently does not have) with slightly upgraded amenities. According to the FlyerTalk forums, the best a SPG Gold member can hope for is an "upgrade" to a room that opens up into the atrium. The pictures of suites I've seen on the FlyerTalk thread look really awesome (the ones with balconies are up on the hotel's top floor, the 7th floor). For the young and adventurous, Berlin is a city full of nightlife and one of my local relatives suggested for me to go to a club named Cookies located almost directly next to the Westin. It's apparently only open on Tuesday and Thursday late nights and a doorman appears around midnight in front of a nondescript door on FredrichStrasse. Bottom line is this: There are plenty of competing hotels in Berlin with varying styles and amenities (my preference is for modern architecture and space, while other people may prefer "Old World" and simpler rooms). I left here feeling like I had gotten a very poor value for the money I had spent. If you are paying more than 200 € per night for a standard room, even with any extra add-ons (such as breakfast included, or free Internet), my educated and honest opinion is that you're paying far too much. And if you are dead set on staying at this Westin (for points or stay credit in the SPG Program, for example), book via the Starwood website and then check around all the discounter web sites (hoteldiscounts.com, expedia.com, etc.) to find a cheaper rate and then claim a Best Rate Guarantee. But you owe it to yourself to shop around before considering this Westin first. The Westin Grand in Berlin has some improving to do. One more helpful hint: Taxis between Tegel Airport and the Westin will cost no more than 20 €.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Grand is good, but used to be better”
Reviews.Author: krueger33
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Westin Grand Berlin several times in the last 10 years due to the location but also because they always had the most phenomenal New Years Eve gala party with fantastic entertainment (like a Las Vegas, aerialist and Broadway review). So after several years absence, we were excited to go there again because this time we had our extended family joining us for the festivities, which we had excitedly told them to anticipate a party above all others. Very disappointing. First of all, there had been a renovation of the lobby and rooms. While the rooms sorely needed this, the lobby did not. What used to have old-world charm (think Vienna/baroque decor), looked boringly like it was decorated by whoever decorates the Westins in places like No-wheresville, New Jersey. Color of the carpeting on the grand staircase and throughout was brown and beige. It used to be red oriental design...very regal. The old world charm of the lobby looked like it was now the business lounge at the airport. Very sad. The architecture SCREAMS for old world. How could this have been overlooked? In addition, without the gala events of years prior, this was a substandard New Years Eve bash. The band was mediocre at best. They were better when they stopped playing and put a CD on. Did not play what you might expect on New Years Eve for the more mature crowd. No Frank Sinatra. No big band. Played FAST Viennese waltzes that frustrated the couples with only modest dance ability, and then played disco. The crowd was mostly 50+. Also, the band was at the bottom of the staircase and the tables all upstairs. Had to struggle down that staircase in heels (and mine were very high) if you wanted to dance. My daughter fell trying to get down in her shoes. Not a great idea. In years past, the tables were at the foot of the staircase and once on both levels, but then they used the staircase as the "stage", performers moving up and down it so they could be seen by all. Food was good. Actually, the next morning, there was a buffet brunch with a different band (a quintet with sax, trombone, bass and piano and guitar) and they were excellent. They should have been the New Years Eve band. We sat there the entire 3 hours just for them. Also, as someone else wrote, there is no free water in the room! I don't call this a 5 star hotel any longer. It's a 4 star. Used to be 5, but falls short now. If you only care about the location, then it's great, but we will not stay again for Christmas and New Years. Also they really have no restaurant. There is a room for breakfast buffet, but there is no upscale restaurant. Definitely this place needs a bit of an upgrade to compare with the likes of the Ritz (with a wonderful New Years Eve party, by the way) located at Potsdamer Platz. Internet was not free either and rather expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: Atena
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatelly I only stayed one night at the Westin so I guess I will only repeat what most other reviewers had to say. This is a very good hotel in the heart of an amazing city. It is on Friedrichstrasse and Under der Linden and you can easilly walk to most major attractions (although Berlin having been separated for so long is twice as big as most major cities). There is also a U bahn stop right outside the door just in case you are too tired to walk... The room was adequet in size and clean but I would really appreciate a coffee maker. I ordered room service breakfast and it was very good. The hotel lobby is very impressive and grand as it shows in the pictures. The staff I spoke to were professional and friendly and I don't really think I need anything more from a hotel. I'll make sure I stay this place again next time I visit Berlin (hope it's soon...)

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS I EXPECTED.......”
Reviews.Author: 1MARYMARY1
Reviews.Content: Family of 6 from Ireland. 4 adults and 2 children, 5ys and 11ys. My son, his wife and me granny and my husband. My son and his family usually stay in 5 star hotels and have travelled worldwide My husband and I are lesser mortals and were relishing the prospect of staying in the Westin. A treat for Christmas---my son said he had "got a good deal"!. First the positive thoughts about our stay. Berlin is a great city. Lots to do. Tasty reasonable food and drink. Super transport system. Friendly people, and jolly Christmas markets around every corner. We even had a little snow!. The Westin is in a great location,. Comfortable bedroom. Delicious breakfast (with champagne). Mostly friendly staff, smiling chambermaids. Effecient lifts. But, little things did surprise me happening in a 5 star hotel. On arrival,Reception did not seem to have any knowledge of the childrens occupancy in their parents room. A "single" was hurriedly installed and they had to sleep top to toe, which led to sleepless nights for all concerned. Now maybe my son made a mistake by not booking the right room, but the children were on his booking fform but not on the hotels data. Is it possible that the Westin can only accommodate one child per regular bedroom and if you want to facilitate more than that you book a suite? Could turn out to be quite expensive and not very family friendly. After booking in there was no porter in sight. Reception pointed in direction of lifts and it was a case of find your room. At this stage I did not feel very welcome. Amazed at the price of a bottle of water,available in our bedroom E8.50. In Ireland complimentary bottles of water are readily available in hotels with lesser stars. (Maybe it has to do with our rainfall in Ireland). Liked to sit at night in downstairs lounge. Spectacular with roof rising to seven stories, for drinks before bed. On first night,, on the floor above , there was what appeared to be an office party. Speeches, entertainment etc., all of which encroached on the level of enjoyment of our space. Surprised also to see stains on some upholstry. Perhaps the Westin needs residents lounge with a more relaxed athmosphere. One night we were served,as part of our drinks order, with an item we did not request, When we brought this to the servers attention she reluctantly removed same. When the bill arrived this item ,which we had not ordered ,was included. Again, when this was brought to her attention, she was not well pleased. Lastly --I am one of that ,shall I say it "dying breed" -- a smoker!!. (Although judging from the numbers outside the front door there are still some of us around). Be warned it will cost you E150.00 if you smoke in your bedroom!! Would'nt it be nice if there was an area , within the confines of the hotel,, maybe in the garden ,to smoke ,where one would not feel so much of a outcast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: P9642Q
Reviews.Content: Excellent service in a great facility, ideally located. Will always return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good but no hot water!”
Reviews.Author: KirtiV
Reviews.Content: Mostly uneventful stay and room was comfortable but I had one morning where there was no hot water and so I took a cold shower.. complained but there wan no reaction other than a lame apology. I guess hot water 4 out of 5 days is pretty good? Spent a few hours in the lobby with friends and it was nice and good tea and snacks but kind of expensive Great location nr Unter De Linden Also don't know why they charge you to use the sauna - most of the other hotels in the area it would be free. I would have rated it higher had they responded better to my hot water situation

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Good Value and Dont Miss the Indoor Pool!”
Reviews.Author: cmarcin444
Reviews.Content: Located in the main street of Berlin, near the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie the museum zone, all in walking distance, this is a great hotel, not too expensive as the new ones, but surely worth every Euro. The big indoor poo, jacuzzi and spa, its a great finish for a walking day! And the first two are free! And by the way, we met with Bono from U2 just two blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in All Terms”
Reviews.Author: keen_traveller495
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel because it is close to all attaractions of Berlin we wanted to see durin gour trip there. It is located in the east part of Berlin. But the west part is not far away. Big comfortable rooms, nice breakfast. Realy easy access to all parts of the city. Our room was 100 euros per night with breakfast which is good for a 5 star hotel, isn't it. The reception staff is friendly. If you need to organize a conference there the hotel can do it. Our trip didn't have anything to do with conferences but we just came across a group of visitors at the lobby who wanted to have a tour of the hotel. We were just curious and joined. So, the hotel can accommodate a good size conference of seminar if you need it. Small but nice SPA area with a swimming pool. You have to pay extra for the sauna. Very nice courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, helpful, super location”
Reviews.Author: FlaHockeyFan
Reviews.Content: High end hotel with a location that can't be beat for a tourist to explore this large, fantistic city. Concierge went out of their way, helping with restaurants reservations, tours, and travel plans. Rooms were big and clean, with many English language channels!

Reviews.Title: “20 years after the wall came down...”
Reviews.Author: deluxe_afficionado
Reviews.Content: ...I visited this former East German Flagship hotel and was very impressed. The lobby beautiful renovated, which gives a fresh touch in the so classic atrium building. Most important the recent renovation on the rooms ( I believe it was called a Superior Deluxe King) with a truly and amazing experience in terms of bed and bathroom. The bed, fantastic as always in a Westin and most important, since there one spends the most of the time and Walk in shower ( no steps or "climbing" over a bathub to get a shower) with an oversized showerhead. Location is fantastic, for me the best when you want to be in the center of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Everything!”
Reviews.Author: pontyUsa
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! Finally someone who knows what they're doing! got an upgrade to a garden view, nice and quiet. Beautiful new hotel, great spa, all top notch and excellent service, a truly deserved 5 star hotel. The concierge lacks a little about where to eat, but at least they are nice. Great stay overall. Oh and they have a stereo in the bathroom, nice touch! JUST one wish, wish Westin would throw in free internet! silly

Reviews.Title: “lovely big hotel with a great location and a wonderful conceriege”
Reviews.Author: nyctamara
Reviews.Content: good value, great location, expensive breakfast,the coinceriege was so wonderful he spent so much time with us getting what we wanted the toiletries where first class and very plentiful, the beds were great the the duvet where fluffy and warm. i would reccomend this hotel to the most discerning traveler

Reviews.Title: “Great location, gourmet breakfast, fast service”
Reviews.Author: k9dt
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located in the center of Berlin, near many fine resturants and sights. S-Sahn and U-Bahn, (surface and subway), transportation easy to acccess and use. A great breakfast spread. Not however, the property does not have a small shop with personal ammeties. Room service was very fast with and helpful friendly staff. We had an especially wonderful experience with our 2 year old grandaughter, who lives in Berlin, during breakfast one morning.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: FraKent
Reviews.Content: The position is geat, the reception staff are great, the room is great. Poor Cleaning On arrival I went to have a shower I noticed a black mark on the edge of the bath ,when it got wet it started to run, it was blood my husband had to get wads of tisue and clean it off. We stayed in room 419 for 3 nights from 29th September 2009. Rude Bar Staff On our last night we ordered two large beers the lady delivered two small beers when we point out that it was large beers we had requested her reply was "Maybe later" my husband said he wanted large beers they arrived 30 minutes later and were slapped down onto the table. From then on the two female staff walked passed out table numberous times stopped and stared after this one drink we went to our room. We put the "do not disturb" notice on the door but that morning the clearer ignored it 3 times then a very large aggresive lady barged into the room to check the mini bar we had not used it and eventually she left us in peace. We felt the constant intrusions were deliberate and linked to the bad tempered bar lady the night previously. We stay in hotels about eight times a year and have never felt the need to complain. We have sent two Email directly to the hotel but they did not respond they must be happy wih dirty rooms and rude bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position but not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Davies72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position but isn't a 5 star hotel. The bathrooms are tiny, so much so that you couldn't reuse the towels even if you wanted to because the only towel rail was in the shower, so if you hung them back up they didn't dry! I know that European hotel bathrooms can be small but this bathroom was smaller than any I have experienced in Rome or Paris and had been modernised without much thought to practicalities. There are miles of hallways all brown and gloomy and overall the public areas of the hotel are in need of a renovation. We asked the concierge to book some restaurants for us but never received any confirmation, so we had to continually go back and ask if they had been successful in making the reservation. Ever time we did this we were treated like we were idiots - all they needed to do was leave us a message that the reservation was successful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, pretty average hotel”
Reviews.Author: synaptoneurosome
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand in Berlin is a nice hotel that could be anywhere in the world. Nothing offensive, but nothing particularly charming or unique about it either (except, perhaps, for the endlessly long corridors). Their spa services seem ridiculously overpriced, which was a bit off putting for those of us in town for the Berlin marathon. Also, the fact that you have to pay 8 euro extra to visit the sauna seems a bit cheap on their part too. I don't know, though.... maybe it's an amazing sauna worth 8 extra euro! One really nice touch about the place (besides the amazing location) is the outside bar area - great place for a late afternoon glass of champage. I have to say that the Grand Hyatt in Berlin is a much more interesting, beautiful, and well-appointed luxury chain hotel, and would recommend staying there over the Westin Grand when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, clean - what's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in the heart of Berlin, conveniently situated close to the Brandenburg gate and the Reichstag. Good first impressions, with smiling doormen ready to help with luggage, or call cabs for you. Check-in was fast and smooth. Plenty of lifts to choose from, large enough for luggage. Rooms are arranged around a circular landing, with a glass dome above, making it look very attractive. Good size rooms, furniture in good condition. Extra charge for internet was a bit irritating - I expect this to be free in a hotel of this quality. Bathroom spotless, nice toiletries, plenty of fluffy towels. The bar downstairs was rather nice - the weather was excellent so we were able to sit outside for cocktails, a really nice place to sit and people watch. Overall, a typical hotel of this type, perhaps a bit impersonal, but good facilities and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaRocky
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Everything that woulod be expected from a great hotel was provided. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Service was impeccable and the staff was always friendly. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Anita_Spa
Reviews.Content: Rooms looking on Friederickstrasse have also a glimpse of Unter den Linden Strasse. Easy distance to the metro or station of the bus to the airport. Very friendly staff of the bar in the lobby, definitely recommend having a drink there. Sadly the price didn't include the internet, but the room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Oddepila
Reviews.Content: We got a great bargain for staying at the Westin Grand, and we knew the stay would be memorable after having stayed at other westin hotels previously. The hotel is located in the heart of Berlin's city center at the corner of Unter den Linden and Friedrichstrasse. We had a wonderful stay, enjoying very much the quiet of the spa and fitness area. My wife was pregnant, and on the last day of the trip we were able to keep the room without additional costs untill 5 pm. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a perfect hotel in the middle of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!!”
Reviews.Author: InformedFoodie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel all over the world, and have never had such a negative experience. We are Gold Starwood members and have such excellent service and are treated like royalty with all Starwood Hotels, for the exception of The Westin, Berlin. I would never stay there again, nor recommend it to anyone. The staff on checking in was extremely rude, and wouldn’t upgrade us, as it is customary with Gold Members. When I had to ask if we had an upgraded room the recptionist ignored me. I had to ask again, and he said he was looking. The hotel was not sold out, and could very easily upgrade us! In checking into the room, there was a wrinkled breakfast menu that had been filled out by a prior guest lying on the bed. The room was not very clean, and there was hair in the bathtub. When turning on the shower, the maid left the showerhead pointed toward the center of the bathroom, which soaked the bathroom floor and me on turning it on. There was used toilet paper on the toilet paper roll. The maid service didn’t issue new soap bars, or shampoo, so we had to call and request it. The front desk would not print our boarding pass, and charged us $5 Euros to use their internet to print them, while other hotels had free internet service and printed our passes at no charge. I left a message for the manager upon leaving informing him of the dissatisfied service, and never had a reply. I see that others had a good experience, however ours was very bad, and I would caution anyone thinking of making reservations there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and central location........”
Reviews.Author: tgh60660
Reviews.Content: We chose the Westin Grand based on the fact that we redeemed our Starwood points. This probably would not have been my first choice if I was actually paying to stay here. The hotel is centrally located and Berlin is at your door. The hotel is very clean and comfortable (along with the amazingly comfortable Westin Heavenly bed) The staff and concierge were very helpful with dinner reservations and touring ideas. The only drawback is the expensive breakfast as mentioned by several reviewers. We found an excellent breakfast around the block in a charming french style bistro for 9 Euros. We didn't feel breakfast was worth 29 Euros. Overall you can't go wrong with the Westin Grand.

Reviews.Title: “five star hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: piteryunior
Reviews.Content: Yes it's a five star hotel , friendly concierge , new rooms , best location near public bus stop and U-metro but I do not understand the reason that breakfast is 29 euro for person , the internet connection is also expansive , in the room there is not a coffee maker . In the hall ( splendid ) there are only two seats with no possibility to read a newspaper or a book or your personal things . I reccomend this hotel if you want a high-class hotel in your stay in Berlin .

Reviews.Title: “good except for the internet at 20 Euro per day”
Reviews.Author: acadaSydney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel great room nice staff but why oh why oh why do they rip people off by charging them 20 euro a day to use the internet- nobody in their right mind would pay that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, needs minor improvements”
Reviews.Author: euroboyde
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Berlin and during my stay I stayed at The Westin Grand Hotel Berlin, This large 7 story hotel is located in Berlin Mitte, a really great location to all attractions and along the famous boulevard unter den linden. When we arrived, we arrived into what seems to be a film crew filing the outside lobby of the hotel, our taxi couldn’t pull into the hotel therefore we had to get out on the other side of the street and as concierge was no where in sight we had to lift our own luggage into the hotel, . When I arrive at a 5 star hotel, I expect to have my luggage taken from the car to the room and vice versa and not for me to haul it around myself. The main lobby is really large, very spacious, and very grand the main staircase is the focal point of the lobby rather than the reception desks which is literally off to a corner in it self. Checking in was quick, the touch of hospitality was missing and we just didn’t feel welcome. Yet again concierge was missing to help with our luggage nor were we asked if anyone could help us. We arrived to our room which in disappointment was not what we asked for; we checked into a twin room rather than a king size room with what they called a deluxe city room which in fact was over looking a loading bay. I went down stairs with my partner and so we complained as we were staying there 3 nights and didn’t really want a twin room with a horrible view for our nights there. The receptionist didn’t want to help at first and argued with us and basically said a few harsh uncaring words and when my partner intervened he looked up the booking and found that reservations made a mistake, as an apology he upgraded us to the superior room. To us, I found that really nice. Arriving in the superior room really lived up to its name, it was a large quiet toned room, large king size bed, large flat screen, lounge chair, office desk and chair, large wardrobes, coffee and tea making facilities, safe, side and reading lamps, lovely bathroom with both shower and ceiling rain shower, really nice and what I was really looking for! The cherry on the cake was the view! The view of the room over looked Unter den Linden, on the right your view was the Berlin TV Tower and Berlin Dom and on the left was the view of the Dome on the Reichstag. Even better were the windows with blocked out the noise and traffic. As always in Westin Hotel, the breakfast was delicious; however there were a lot what seemed to be package holiday guests where a herd of cows had more manners, waiting patiently was a word I think they never heard of. The breakfast staff were really great, friendly and attentive and therefore we thought it necessary to tip as many of the staff did a really good job. The lounge in the hotel is really nice, the bar is located at the steps of the grand stair case with the restaurant at the far corner, the seating area is really loungie, laid back and comfortable, also good service in both food and drinks and the staff I found to be really nice. The spa however was very disappointing for a hotel of that size, the swimming pool is round and fairly small, 4 or 5 strokes pending on how long your arms are and you are at one end of the pool, there is a whirl pool and a sauna where you have to pay 8 Euros to use. There is a relaxing / seating area around the pool where it is never clean, there are towels what people have used from early in the day left on the chairs and un removed. There is a bar by the pool but no bar man to serve you, you can find him out in reception flirting with the female receptionists. In all, I will stay in this hotel again and see what service I get again and booking a better room the superior or junior suite rooms over looking unter den linden which was recommended by the check out clerk, I would stay for the location, the rooms, the food and the ambience. I think concierge needs to concentrate on their skills and the spa area needs improvement but in all it is a great hotel, with a great location and grand features in the heart of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a drawback”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_traveller68
Reviews.Content: We came to The Westin this Friday afternoon by car and was greeted by the valet who took our suitcases and offered to park our car in a nearby carpark which was a great start for our stay. At reception we were equally friendly greeted and the porter too us to our room on the 6th floor. A very nice and comfortable room. The next morning we went to the breakfast restaurant and here we were charged € 29 per person for breakfast. I agree it was a great breakfast but it was also a great price which I think should be lowered by about 20%. On Saturday we had decided to have the open air barbecue, but as it was a bit chilly we decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant Relish, but that was a mistake. The waiter told us that we could sit anywhere, but that he did prefer that we took a table in the the lobby which we declined and choose the restaurant as we wanted some privacy. Drinks were then offered and came quickly together with the menu. And then absolutely nothing happened for 18 minutes although more guests had come into the restaurant. Finally the waiter appeared and took our order for the meal and for a bottle of house red wine. According to the menu the wine was supposed to be a 2003 vintage but he brought a 2001 vintage. I told him so, and his remark was that alle the house wines he had served were the same and he never checked the year. Whe he opened the bottle and poured a small amount into the glass there was plenty of residue from the corck but he pretended not to notice. Again after waiting a long time for the lobster starter it arrived, but the bisque was lukewarm. The rest of the meal still took a long time to be served and twice we had to ask the waiter to fill our glasses as he had placed the bottle far away from our table although I told him to place it on our table which apparently was against the rules. I do think that the waiter had far too many tables to look after and not until all the tables in the restaurant were occupied did a second waiter appear. This meal was a serious disappointment to us as we had a special occasion to celebrate. Especially as everything else in the hotel worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: abcd1Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location within easy reach of all the tourist sites, many of which are in walking distance - although the public transport in Berlin is very good and easy to use. The public areas are stunning and my room was clean and very comfortable, especially the bed! The hotel was a pleasure to come back to after a day's sightseeing. Although a large hotel, it was very quiet, I heard no noise at all during my stay. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. I'd definitely go back to Berlin, which is an amazing city, and would stay in the Westin Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “Correct...”
Reviews.Author: gas
Reviews.Content: I must say before starting describing Westin that I loved Berlin and my trip became even better experience due to the incredible location of Westin. In the best location of the city in an upscale and beautifull area just in walking distance from the main attractions of the city (Brrandeburg Gate, Pergamon Museum, Under de Linden street) and with excelent restaurants and shopping nearby (Bocca di Bacco, Lutter & Wegner) Westin Grand Berlin was a correct choice of accomondation for a first timer in German capital. Public areas looks quiet old and outdated, but they were perfectly kept and clean. Room was beautifull with a superb and comfy bed, a perfect way to end your day from the endless walking Berlin city needs and its vibrant nightlife. What I enjoyed most was the indoor pool. A suprisingly beautifull and smart deisgned pool with a perfect hot jacuzzi and a relaxing area in the spa department of the hotel. Was a great start for my day, the little gym by the pool was also a plus. Service was professional and the staff was ready to make the best for you. In Berlin you can find many lux and beautifull hotels compared to Westin. However If I had to find a reason to return in this hotel in a future trip to Berlin this will have to do with 3 words, location, bed, indoor pool. 3 words consist the word ideal for Westin...if you skip them for the standarts of a 5 star hotel it will be your really correct choice but thats all. If property could impress you too it could be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - great value”
Reviews.Author: mcGalway
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. Rate of €90 pps was good value, even if room was smaller then average. Avoided the expensive room service/mini-bar/restaurant. Ate breakfast around the corner. Super location near a huge public park (Tiergarten) and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisying stay”
Reviews.Author: Retep0517
Reviews.Content: Excellent location exactly one block from the very center of Berlin. Service was superb and the room was very well apponted. If you value good air conditioning, heavenly beds, and newly refurbished bathrooms, this is the place for you. The breakfast buffet was huge and of very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Classy Legend that has just been rejuvenated”
Reviews.Author: BLS_65
Reviews.Content: Guten Tag, We spent (5) superb nights in Room #630 facing Behrenstrasse at this “Grand Dame” of a Hotel and loved every moment of it. If we would have known that there are Gust accommodations facing Friedichstrasse, we have preferred that view of a historical landmark street. This is a true 5 Star Hotel that offers you the most significant and perfect essentials to make the best of your Vacation; superb location, hospitable staff and elegant guest accommodations. Typically, we prefer a cutting-edge Design Hotel, but this Hotel has just been renovated exquisitely. The Designer has managed to keep the charm of the past but integrated elegant contemporary features that bring this Hotel into the present era. The Public Spaces provide you with a luxuriously spacious ambience. The graceful Guestrooms are well appointed with the finest amenities. The wood Furniture quality was not that consistent for a 5 star Hotel, but the Bed was heavenly. The only elements missing from the room were an iron, ironing board and espresso machine. The compact well-designed modern washroom has been completely retrofitted with adequate lighting, white marble, back-painted glass panels in the shower and clever plumbing fixtures. A separate toilet compartment would have been preferred, but considering this is a historical Hotel; it would have been extremely costly to include this feature typically found in 5 star Hotels. Breakfast was quite expensive at 30.00 euro, but I guess this price is geared towards business travelers, as opposed to us on Vacation. We highly recommend this hotel since it provides you with a peaceful central base for you to discover one of the best cities in the world. Martini's at Hotel de Rome with dinner at FACIL is highly recommended to celebrate this astonishing capital, Danke

Reviews.Title: “well located, elegant hotel but a bit drab and for older clientele”
Reviews.Author: Kate70
Reviews.Content: I moved from the Marriott to this hotel- and think I made a mistake overall and should have stayed put at the Marriott. (marriott review also posted) altho the hotel in all fairness is good and I was lucky enough to have one of the few rooms with a balcony and with a great coffee machine, good news as I love my coffees so this did delight me (ironically tho- they daily kept forgetting to put in new coffee and tea capsules- I can only assume this is new feature and the staff have not been told to replace the ones used?). The location is also very good, in easy walking distance of most tourist locations, the remains of checkpoint Charlie just up the road from here (I lament the fact I did not visit 20 years ago as there is little left to make this city of real historical interest tho) and the majority of the staff are very good- partic those serving in the (breakfast) restaurant who get full marks for excellent service. Breakfast was fine- but little things missing you would expect from a 5 star- eg fresh fruit juice and decent coffee? There is a pool and a gym- which I did not have time to use- and I had visions of very old fashioned facils as well so was not keen to do so. And a so called garden which is not overly inspiring.. the street terrace cafe/resataurant (on one of the main shopping streets) is good- even if the prices are not- I think 11 euros for a glass of wine is ridiculous... food in the hotel was similarly over-priced. Which seems typical in downtown Berlin- geared up for tourists as I would not think Berliners would pay the prices (partic with 20% local unemployment)? The clientele in this hotel was more diverse than in the Marriott- (which was predom American when I was there)- this hotel had Italians, French, American, Brits and quite a lot of Russians. And dogs. Quite a lot of older couples and families- and anyone liking a more traditional hotel with an older style/profile might like this hotel- although I did regularly hear comments re the rooms being small and very dark so I suspect quite a few shared my view on the rooms and decor? This type of older, (1920s) grander style hotel is not for me tho. On entering: the main lobby/lounge and staircase somehow reminded me of the titanic in an obscure way- but drabber... they have refurbished the hotel I think recently (?)- but why oh why choose dark brown for the carpets and decor? this makes the lobby and long windowless corridors seem even darker and makes it look grim and characterless. Same with the bedrooms- they are brown, very brown, with light wood furniture which I also did not like. The bathroom with a rainforest type walk in shower (no bath- but this was not a problem) also was ok - and I was delighted to see it was not brown but a beige colour! Full marks tho for the (fresh capsule) coffee machine- altho not for the refill service- I ended up hijacking staff in corridors and/or calling the reception on a daily basis. The bed was good- although I think the Marriott bed is even more heavenly than the Sheraton/Westin/Meridien group's heavenly bed- perhaps by a whisker tho as still very good... Wake up calls were good- and I loved the way they told you the day's weather forecast. This was great and very useful. I was actually quite glad to leave this hotel as after a few days the drab brown was beginning to drive me mad... I am perhaps biased- as I hate brown.. not a hotel I personally would go back to- but some may find it ok- (if they get a reasonable price).

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with no soul”
Reviews.Author: KevinCrew
Reviews.Content: The rooms of this hotel have been renovated and have the standard you would expect from a five star hotel, perhaps with the exception of the bathroom being rather small. The rooms do not have an iron or coffee maker. We asked to have both sent up to the room, and the hotel charged us for it. Strange, since you would expect both to be standard in a hotel of this class. All in all we will not come back to this hotel. The staff simply didn't make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing less than PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: nivster1
Reviews.Content: We came to Berlin for the U2 concert (It was amazing), stayed at the Westin Grand for 4 nights during July. This hotel is one of the best hotels I've visited around the world, luxurious and worth every eurocent of the price we paid (100 eur/night - some kind of promo). Upsides - Rooms are clean, new, spacious, with LCD TV and all the amenities you'd expect from a 5* hotel. The hotel itself is clean, elegant with excellent service. The hotel is located IDEALLY, in the heart of Mitte, right next to a U-bahn station, 5 min walk from Friedrichstrasse major train station (Where the airport express train stops) and with all Mitte attractions within a walking distance. But the best thing is the bed - I've NEVER slept on a more comfortable mattress. It was so good to come after a hard day of walking, eating, drinking and sleep for 6 hours and wake up like new. I would buy the bed and ship it home if the price wasn't so high (Around 3000 euro). Seriously, it was the BEST bed ever :) Downsides are very few and most of them concern the high price of the extras: Internet is 9 euro for 1 hour of in-room internet, or 20 euro per day or 120 per week - C'mon, in some countries you pay 9 euro PER MONTH for broadband intenet connection. I'm sure if they reduced the price people would use it more. Minibar and the bar downstairs are also extremly expensive, but it's a 5* hotel, so I'm not surprised. There are more than enough places around to drink a beer or have a small breakfast/lunch, so don't bother using these hotel services. The LCD is somehow blocked and you cannot connect external devices such as your laptop or cellphone in case you want to watch something. TV channels could use some MTV or alike, most English speaking channels are news channels. View from the rooms could be better but there's nothing to do about it - it's in the middle of the historic center and I guess they can't build high there. Berlin itself is one of the best cities in europe, for both young and older people, with lots of sight-seeings, bars, clubs, good restaurants and around town the prices are much more fair and reasonable than other places in western europe. The city has its own unique and amazing vibe and we would certainly return there and to the Westin Grand in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A DREAM COME TRUE”
Reviews.Author: dbrody9976
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the nicest places we have stayed in Europe. Wonderful staff and breakfast. The room was just superb........ David Brody & John Hobbs

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ladyfalkn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable, luxurious and in the heart of town! Beds were a dream to sleep on. Room service was too high compared to what you can get at local restaurants. The breakfast was a champagne brunch, abundant in almost anything you could desire- one of the best I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Grand Berlin is the only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AroundTheWorldNyNy
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand Berlin is a great hotel. Very centrally located to everything you could possibly want to do and see. The rooms are clean and with crisp linens that make feel like royalty. Walking distance fromthe lobby you have World History to a small pizza shop that is like no other. My time was well spent between business and pleasure and by staying at this location I was able to do everything I wanted and more. Staying here after watching "The Bourne Identity" trilogy was neat because you remember the action in the movie as you move around the hotel and through the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! So impressed!”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: Location was near lots of shopping and close (by car) to other tourist sites. The food was very high quality, tasty, and healthy as well. All the staff were so friendly and willing to help with any little thing. The grounds were beautiful; my room overlooked a courtyard in the middle of the buildng and the greens were so pretty to see in the evening sun. I thought the hotel itself was tastefully yet trendily rennovated, too. The central atrium, the front lobby - beautiful, especially when viewed from the top floor. I was sorry the pool was closed during my stay, but I'm sure it would have been just as fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gl0ryb0y
Reviews.Content: this place was a real find. great shopping nearby and the underground right outside the door. the hotel was an excellent specimen of a 5 star chain. the building was impressive, the staff friendly and the service great. the pool/spa etc was of the highest standard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, expensive food and drink”
Reviews.Author: capnbullseye
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here the last weekend of June and had mixed feelings about the hotel. While it's location and staff can't be faulted I felt the cost of some things were over inflated for what was on offer. First the good stuff; I arrived 2 and a half hours before check in to drop my bag off and chanced my arm by asking if our room was available, the reception staff were very friendly and checked me in no problems. I went up to my room and found it had twin beds rather than the queen-sized I had reserved, so I went back down and they moved me, again no problems. The second room was much better as it had the bed I'd asked for and this time overlooked the inner gardens. (So if you're not happy at first just ask and see what they can do). I had checked out the hotel on-line before booking and they claim to have the best beds in the industry, well after two nights on them i definetly agree! huge beds with a very comfy mattress; so comfy we slept in both mornings! Now the gripes; Used the Gym and swimming pool and found both of these a good standard, only slight gripe is the overflow drain in the pool sounded like a Formula 1 car was parked next door. We also paid for the Sauna which was 8Euros each and not really worh it. The Sauna had two smallish mixed saunas (95F & 65F) and a female only sauna; and that was it, no steam room or plunge pool and overall felt pretty cramped. Having stayed in similar-rated hotels and used their saunas I would definetly say this one is slightly below par. We also ordered breakfast in our room the first morning and were very happy with the hotels 'healthy food' menu much cheaper than the other options (which makes me think they're just trialling it?) and very tasty. However we ordered a tea and coffee with our food and I couldn't believe that it cost 8Euros for a (small) pot of coffee and 7.5Euros for a (equally small) pot of Tea! So all in our food was cheaper than our drinks. Maybe I'm being a bit naieve about hotel bills but I still think this is over the top. On our second morning we had the buffet breakfast which again had a good selection and was very tasty but compared with similar hotels was (in my opinion) at least 5Euros overpriced, again not a huge amount but couldn't help feeling that we were paying for some kind of perceived privelige. So to sum up; lovely hotel and friendly staff, nice room and bed but could do with re-thinking their price structure a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service when you could get it.”
Reviews.Author: Chuckus1
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Platinum member, I was upgraded to what they called a junior suite even though I was on an award stay and was told the hotel was 100% full. It was a large living room with large bedroom and bathroom that could be completely closed off. The room was on the second floor and the living room had a small window so there was not too much natural light. The bedroom had no windows. The bathroom was very nice with a seperate rain style shower head. Both living room and bathroom had modern flat screen TVs. There was no doorman available to assist upon arrival or departure. I had to fetch my own taxi on the street. The breakfast was very expensive and though there were a lot of items, the room had all the charm of a college dining hall. It was also difficult to get a server for coffee or tea. In fact, my request was forgotten. The breakfast was EUR 29. The food was quite good though. In room internet was wired and fast but should be at EUR 19.50 per day. The exercise room was a bit small but sufficient but the indoor pool looked nice. Room service soup and salad was prompt and tasty. The location can't be beat. Easy walking distance to Museum Island and the DDR Museum which is kind of interesting. When I did have interaction with the staff, they were all very nice and accomodating but just seemed a bit overwhelmed due to the high occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Deanna9
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Westin Grand in May with our two children and my father. We had two rooms and both were spotless and had lots of room, very comfy beds and ours had a view of the Unter den Linden, Reichtag and Television tower! There is no noise in the room at all. The hotel is centrally located about a 7 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate and 10 minutes to Museum Island or Checkpoint Charlie. Our kids loved the indoor pool and hot tub and we loved the friendly and helpful staff. There is so much to do within walking distance, that we never even took a cab or bus, but walked everywhere. We did not have the breakfast, since there were lovely cafes everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MichaelofMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The belle epoch style is wonderful, and the whole hotel has a quiet elegant atmosphere. Relish Restaurant it excellent and innovative. Lobby bar and lounge ideal at end of day

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ChloeLou_London
Reviews.Content: I don't have a bad word to say about this hotel! We arrived at 11am (after an early morning flight) and they allowed us an early check-in. The staff were all friendly and helpful! The rooms were relatively spacious and had all the comforts you would expect in a good quality hotel. In terms of location, you can't beat the Westin - 5 minutes walk from all the main tourist attractions (Checkpoint Charlie, Reichstag etc) We didn't eat in the hotel, as there were so many restaurants nearby. However, we did have a few cocktails in the bar, which were fabuolous! If we return to Berlin, we will definitely consider returning to the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “A well rounded upscale choice”
Reviews.Author: DanteA
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Westin Grand Berlin over 10 times in the last four years (family and occasionally business brings me there), this place is an easy recommendation. The location is excellent, central to shopping, culture, and transportation. The athletically disposed will find excellent jogging or walking along the nearby river Spree and the leafy Tiergarten, not to mention the full service spa (the last unfortunately is almost entirely devoid of windows, so the pool is strictly indoors in both fact and feel). The staff is invariably helpful, and the rooms are nicely furnished. In nice weather (OK, we are talking Berlin, so this is not every day) there is a sidewalk terrasse for drinks and light fare. I especially value the accomodations on the inner (garden) side for their idyllic quiet, but first time visitors might want to specifically request something with more of a "cityscape" view, especially those that give out onto the Unter den Linden. The fact that Westin participates in Starwood's frequent stay program, as far as I am concerned the best program of its type, is also a major plus, allowing members to earn or use points at this property. Downsides at the WGB are few: guests exceptionally concerned with tranquility (and I put myself in this category) may find that door closures are highly sprung, and unintended jarring slams from adjacent rooms are likely to awaken individuals who wish to retire early or sleep late. All hotels of this caliber ought to have quiet-close doors with pneumatic mechanisms, but only a few choose to implement this technology. Also, the hotel has been renovated, and not all changes are welcome. The new furniture has a rather bland bleached grain, and compared with the previous warm honey colored rooms, the look is sterile. There's a similar loss of color in the still grand lobby, which needs some punch color accents or flowers to return to its full glory.
