Also, the renovation converted almost all of the restaurant space into retail stores, so in-hotel dining is restricted to a small functional extension off the lobby. Fortunately, there is no shortage of more atmospheric restaurants in the neighborhood, and the renovation did not undermine the spectacular breakfast buffet which still takes place in a dedicated sun-filled room overlooking the Friedrichstrasse. For those without will-power, this extensive feast can do major damage to any weight management program.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: NYCHotelManager
Reviews.Content: As a hotel manager in NYC, I use TripAdvisor to not only see what is being said about my property, but to research hotels I want to stay in when traveling and find reviews from fellow travelers very helpful. Having said that, the Westin Grand has both positive and negative aspects, First, the positive.The location is excellent, most attractions and shopping within walking distance. Safe area to walk in at night. Public areas are impressive , room always spotless, housekeeping was top notch. We called for several items during our stay, including a corkscrew, iron/board, and everytime they were delivered promptly. Room Service was delivered quickly and should be commended for adding "healthy alternatives" including fruit smoothies for breakfast, very nice. Wake up calls always used our name. All representative of a true 5 star property. There are some negatives. No one greeted us when we arrived, could not find a doorman or bellman When we left, we had three pieces of luggage, got off the elevator, a bellman saw us, did not acknowledge us and walked away. We checked out and got our own cab to the airport. Three times during our vist, which was 7 days, the water in the shower literally stopped and started making taking a shower difficult. It was not consecutive days nor at the same time daily so it is not a question of everyone using the water at the same time, but appears more inherent. The amenities were lacking for a 5 star property, 1 towel per person, 1 bar of soap that was not changed until it was a tiny sliver, no iron/board in room, no coffee making facilities in room, charge for internet. It seems they are, like many properties, cutting back during hard economic times. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this property and hope they will upgrade back to 5 star service soon.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base from which to visit the sights of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: rubberduck9
Reviews.Content: We returned to Berlin to see the changes that had taken place since the time of the wall. The Westin is located in what was the Eastern Sector and is within walking distance of all of the main sites of interest in this facinating city.Tegel airport is 20 Euros by taxi each way and is located in what was the French sector. We found the hotel to be excellent in all respects and would recommend it to anyone. All of the staff were polite,cheerful and helpful. The Buffet Breakfast was superb and the service was quick and efficient. Without a doubt the best that we have experienced in all our travels. We did find that the restaurant was a little expensive and it was like siting in a goldfish bowl when eating a meal, the restaurant being in full view of passers by. Coffee making facilities were not in the room on arrival but were swiftly provided when requested. There are plenty of pleasant restaurants close by but the coffee and freshly made cakes in the lobby should not be missed! The minor points above aside, we intend to go back to the Westin when we revisit Berlin and commend it to everyone .

Reviews.Title: “The Westin was once ¨Grand¨”
Reviews.Author: y850tdm1
Reviews.Content: Not as fancy and modern as other Westin's. The location is great, rooms comfortable, clean, well insulated etc. but the hotel in general is not latest state-of-the-art in Berlin (and there is a lot of choice!). Not good at all is that the hotel is not having an own parking, the public parking is only 300 metres away but there is no reserved parking lots for the hotel guests. Parking is rather small for bigger cars and often full... What was ridiculous is that the hotels charges you an extra 8 Euros to take a sauna. The Welness area of the Westin is a joke compared to a lot of other hotels in Berlin, the bar as well. For the rest excellent service and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Central, modern, friendly 5* Westin Grand”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard/delux twin ensuite room, #664, fronting Freidrichstrasse, for 6 days, April 12-18. Street noise was minimal or non-existent. The room was of good size with a desk/chair, another comfortable chair, much lighting-one of the best well lit rooms anywhere we have stayed. Our prepaid rate at gtahotels.com of 139E including a generous and very good breakfeast that otherwise cost 25Epp. Hotel has a nice free pool and hot tub-spa is extra.l There are a few cafes within 2 blocks for an inexpensive breakfeast.There is decent storage space, including several drawers, if you have not come equipped with several large suitcases-our style is a carryon a piece and a small backack. Concierge advise is friendly. Elevators are numerous and fast. Location -location is the key here. The hotel is as central as one could ask for the major attractions--all of the state and many other museums and monuments., including Brandenburg Tor, 2 blocks away, and the remaining section of the wall and the topography of terror, about 4-5 blocks distant. There is a U6 metro at the corner that gets you in 2 stops to Oreinianburgstrasse and its many cafes, including cozy Schwarldstuben for traditional food--make a rezervation--and an easy 10-15 minute walk to Hachesher Mark for other cafes-Vivolo for tapas, Basil on a nearby sidestreeet-Dirckenstrasse- for Itailian, and also a nice Thai restaarant and anothe tapas restaurantnat; and Dressler around the corner from the hotel for its prix fixe dinner if to your liking. Best advice-buy a museum card good for 3 consecutive days-after the 2nd-3rd entry, you have paid for the card-special treats-Pergammoon Musuem and the Gemalgalerie for Vermeer, Rembrandt, Titian and other old masters. If shopping is your game, the hotel is next to the main boutique shpping street or take the ubahn or bus to Kudam, an easy 10 mintue ride. An interesting sidetrip is Pottsdam, 40 minute S bahn ride, or Dresden, 2.5 hours best done by tour as the train fare is quite dear.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious rooms - great location”
Reviews.Author: Metzgermeister
Reviews.Content: We spent a great extended weekend during Easter at the Westin Berlin. The rooms - facing "Unter den Linden" - was very spacious, very clean and one of the best beds I have ever slept in. The bathroom was very bright and had a great walk in shower. The location is great, just a few minutes away from Brandenburg Gate, 5 min from central station (taxi). I was extremly surprised by the room service prices - I would have expected much higher rates there. The spa is great - so bring you swimming clothes!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: westvirginia96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a group of friends and it was perfect. The location is great we could walk to shops 5 minutes and the best restaurants were all really close by 5/10 minutes walking. The hotel staff were excellent, we arrived at 11am and we were able to check into our rooms early which was great. Rooms were great, all hotel staff were very nice and so helpful. Lovely to have a drink in the lobby. We ate at Aigner and Bocca di Bacco both were excellent. We found the shopping better over in the west side and the food halls were amazing. When i return i would stay at Westin and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Only front office manager is the one that you should avoid...”
Reviews.Author: josephberlin
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is excellent from front door to restaurant. Breakfast is super great in berlin i think room ok for european standard (nice as westin) service really excellent except the front office manager name Wendy, that seem to be the one that should not be in this properties. Super mean and not nice for many reason. I have been ask several guest that check in at same time as mine. And they all say the same that she have no service mind at all. Try to avoid contact or ask anything from her. Even room or change anything. She know only how to say NO in english i assume

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable luxury with average service and detail issues”
Reviews.Author: MrktMgr
Reviews.Content: Getting out of our taxi from Berlin's Tegel airport at the 5 star (4 star?) Westin Grand I didn't hear the “can I help you with your luggage” that I've heard at countless other hotels in this category around the world. The dearth of “Grand” employees continued inside where nobody was standing ready to relieve of us of our luggage. However, we were welcomed by the familiar view of the stunning lobby slash atrium that rises up six or was it eight stories ( I should have paid attention in the elevator) and that was it – no hotel staff to offer help, everybody was eyes down behind their counters, playing the “firt-one-to-acknowledge-the-guest-loses” game. Even though we arrived at 11:00, and check-in is at 3:00, we were still given a room straight away, probably because of my gold starwood preferred guest card. Up to the room on the second floor – would be the third floor for Americans, but in Germany zero is more than nothing, it's the ground floor. Our room had an unspectacular view of a snow-covered roof garden. The room looks to have been recently renovated, with nearly all the details you would expect; soft muted tones, well appointed bathroom, plenty of hangers and drawers. No alarm clock. Isn't an alarm clock with ipod docking station standard equipment these days? No ironing board and iron, but there was a room safe, and enough room to store an ironing board and iron. There was a flat screen TV, one bathrobe and enough towels for one person. Went to call down to get another bathrobe and more towels delivered, but the phone on the desk didn't work. Went to the bed and used that one: Towels and bathrobe appeared within 5 minutes and, in the meantime, I fixed the phone on the desk myself (phone cable wasn't “clicked” in). The bathroom is fine, typical small european size. The shower was frustrating. It was good to look at, but using it was a pain: Two knobs to turn, but not intuitive to use. One adjusted the strength and direction of water flow, either out of the spigot – turn counter clockwise and keep turning to increase pressure, or out of the shower head, turn clockwise and keep turning to increase pressure. The right hand adjusts water temperature – counter clockwise for cold, clockwise for warm. Keep in mind that once you got the shower going you had to bend down – in the stream of water to adjust the temperature (for some reason the water temperature selected while using spigot mode, didn't correlate with the shower head temperature), all while standing on the very stupidly placed center drain. If you forgot your reading glasses – which most people don't wear in the shower for some reason – you couldn't see the markings on the knobs that were very chic and minimilistic and lacking of color (like red and blue for hot and cold). Both of us struggled with it, cursing at what we felt was an anything but ergonomic design. Otherwise the bathroom was fine. We didn't like the american style bed setup, preferring the standard european dual duvet setup, preventing the tug of war in the middle of the night. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Super variety, along with all the ingredients needed for that important Sunday morning mimosa. My only complaint would be that some hotels seem to think that under-cooked, runny, scrambled eggs are tasty – I don't. Why not offer two types, runny and cooked? Before leaving on Sunday afternoon we had coffee and cake (a true German tradition) in the lobby. While both were very good, the price left me gasping for air: 30 Euros, without tip, for two slices of cake and two coffees! This went beyond the term “premium pricing”. We should have sat at the window where we could see the million Euro Bugatti across the street – maybe then it wouldn't have seemed so outrageous. Sound like a bad review? Well it's not. We both like the Westin Grand and probably will be going back, now that we know how to use the shower. We never need help with our luggage when we arrive at a hotel, so that didn't bother us – it was just noticeable. While we've stayed in several hotels that offer ipod docking stations, that's another feature we never use. I do think an iron and ironing board would be appropriate. The breakfast buffet was great and I'm glad it was included in the price of the room. I shudder to think what it would cost if paid for separately.... The Westin's location is great: Right across the street from a subway station. Just up the road from Brandenburger Gate and not far at all from the museum island. Check out Lafayette Gallery just over and beyond the subway station for some serious shopping and KaDeWe-like food section – complete with spectacular bakery. Right around the corner from the hotel – on the backside of the hotel (out of the lobby go left around the building) directly on “Unter den Linden” street is a great German restaurant offering up traditional German & Berliner fare. The prices were excellent when you consider the quality of food and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beechmi
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a quick trip to Berlin and my second stay at the Westin Grand. This is a strong 4 star hotel...not on the level of a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, but nice enough and a good value for the money. The hotel is rather famous from the movie and stage musical 'Grand Hotel', and was a very popular place to stay back when the city was divided. The lobby and main entrance are very nice, but the rest of the common areas of the hotel look a bit dated. And btw....I booked my room on Yeego.com, and not only did I get a much better rate than the Starwood website, but the breakfast buffet was included, and with Yeego you get a 3% credit towards a future reservation via their website. The hotel is located a block south of the Unter Den Linden in the eastern part of Berlin and next to the Opera House. It is a safe and excellent location if you need to stay in the eastern part of Berlin (personally I prefer west Berlin) close to most of the higher end shopping, American Embassy and the Brandenburg Gate. It is also close to several office buildings and therefore becomes rather quiet and deserted at night (except for the Opera House next door). My room was very clean, recently renovated, with a contemporary modern look, a very comfortable bed, great linens, a desk, and luggage storage area. The bathroom was a decent size with a nice size tub and European style shower. It was located in the back of the hotel and very quiet...I never heard a word from another guest. The hotel is quite large, so if you have trouble walking I suggest you request a room towards the front elevators since it is a hike to the rooms in the back (or west corner) of the hotel. The only change I noticed from when I stayed here before is that the exercise and pool area downstairs have been renovated. I exercise everyday and was very impressed and pleased with this tiny gym. All the equipment looked brand new with one of those multi-use bench press, leg extension, and lateral pulldown machines, as well as dumbbells, and Lifestyle treadmills, stationary bikes and eliptical machines. The pool is nice too, but not large or deep enough to swim laps in. I found the breakfast buffet outstanding with just about everything you can imagine available. All types of prepared eggs (on request omelets, scrambled & fried eggs), bacon, sausage, cold meats, cereals, breads, juices, and even champagne! I did not pay extra for it as it was included in my room. I think the hotel was charging around 18 euro, and in my opinion that is a reasonable price for what it offered. The only things I didn't like were the high charge for use of the wireless internet (7.50 euro per hour, or 19.50 euro for 24 hours) and the 8 euro fee to use the sauna downstairs. And for what its worth, I booked my room on Yeego.com, and not only did I get a much better rate than the Starwood website, but the breakfast buffet was included. And with Yeego you get a 3% credit towards a future reservation via their website (but you do not get Starwood Preffered Guest points for the hotel stay). So overall if you are looking for a comfortable, clean, reasonable priced hotel room in

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: Rosedew78b
Reviews.Content: I organised a conference for approx 35 pers at Westin Berlin and I can highy recommend it. Hotel is perfectly located, staff particularly is very helpful when it comes to organising the meeting and other activities. The concierge was very helpful when I needed to communicate with an italian restaurant because;remember, outside the hotel - very few people speak English in Berlin. The rooms were of high standards, cleanliness was perfect and so was the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: paws2paws
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights in Berlin including New Year's Eve and had a wonderful stay at the Westin. This hotel is superbly located and we walked (yes in the freezing cold!) to the Brandenburg Gate, to the markets, everywhere! Very friendly staff in the hotel, and very busy bar area which was great! Lovely large glasses of wine which were very welcome every evening! Breakfast is super and not to be missed. Kept us going for most of the day. We loved the grand foyer of the hotel, very impressive but welcoming. Lots of restaurants in the area, we ate in Restaurant Aigner on NYE and it was excellent. Our room was a good size and had a large bathroom with a great shower/ very happy with it. Highly recommend The Westin in Berlin , actually highly recommend Berlin full stop!!

Reviews.Title: “very happy customer”
Reviews.Author: WeekendTraveller9
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is a superbly located hotel near all the attractions you are likely to visit on a weekend jaunt. The train from the airport leaves you within a 5 minute walk and takes 25 mins. The hotel was excellent value at €160 per night approaching Christmas. Well sized rooms with all the mod cons you would expect from this hotel. The lobby is simply spectacular. Try a cocktail by the piano as you return from your day sightseeing or shopping. I find that that by paying an extra €50 or so per night you really get a much better hotel experience. I have been let down too often in the mid value range and was delighted to have booked the Westin. The only criticism is the price of the extras such as water and breakfast which by any standard is very expensive. Saying that, there is nothing stopping you from shopping around in Berlin if you find €9 bottles of water too expensive. Strongly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: Slothrop
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Berlin alone for a weekend, just to do some sightseeing, and wanted to stay in the former East. Found an excellent price for this luxury hotel on Expedia -- $125/night. At the reception desk the woman tried to persuade me to "upgrade" for an extra 35 euros a night, saying the room I had was small and had windows overlooking a wall. I said no -- and it turned out the room I got wasn't especially small and had a perfectly fine view of the city. Breakfast was extra at 29 euros a day -- which seems exorbitant, and I didn't do it. The Cafe Einstein is two blocks away, with excellent breakfasts for less than that -- and there are other places cheaper still in the vicinity too. The bottle of water in the room was 9 euros, which seems crazy; internet access was 20 euros a day. Still, the hotel was very pleasant, and the location is terrific. U-bahn is close, also busses, also S-bahn; easy walk to museums, restaurants, Brandenburg gate, etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one of the best hotels in Germany”
Reviews.Author: chango335
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Spa Suite during the Christmas/New Years break. Everything about this hotel is fantastic. The service was very welcoming, efficient and will go the extra mile to please you. The food was fantastic- I've been to Germany 4 times now and I've never taste food this good. The room was absolutely stunning...when we arrived, we were accompanied by a Westin representative who showed us to our room and all the functions of it. The location was perfect- set in the middle of the shopping district and only minutes away from the Brandenburg Gate.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT place in the heart of BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: spot28
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, upscale hotel near main city area of Berlin--can walk to Brandenburg Gate, Unter den Linden...We chose the city view and could literally open up window to the city bustle...LOVED that. Modern room with luxurious linens. Restaurant pricey, but expected. WONDERFUL breakfast to be had...made to order omelettes, meats, very Euro. We loved our stay. Gorgeous lobby. Close to u-Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: CalP0ly
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful and nice to find the "Heavenly Bed" in Germany! Hotel is very close to many historic sites of the old East Berlin and Excellent shopping is right outside the front door. I found the hotel to be quiet and relaxing. the Grand Staircase in the Lobby is beautiful and rooms are decent size. Staff is very accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great blend of classic and modern”
Reviews.Author: brytpa
Reviews.Content: My overall impression of the hotel is no doubt influenced a great deal by the room I had during my stay there. I booked what was essentially a standard room for a recent business trip to Berlin but, upon check-in, was upgraded (thanks to Starwood Preferred Guest status) to a 1-bedroom suite, which was one of their themed suites (themed suites are individually appointed and decorated according to who they are named after, such as Bach or Goethe or other historical and artistic notables). The suite was large, wonderfully appointed, had a great deal of character and charm, and was ideally situated (fourth floor, right at the front of the building with a large balcony). Tons of closet space, wood paneling in certain areas, a huge bathroom (with dual sinks, walk-in shower, seperate bathtub, lots of counterspace, and a separate toilet area also with its own sink and a bidet), work desk, sitting area, yet more and more closet space, flatscreen TVs, minibar, and so on. Like the hotel itself, I found the room a great blend of charming and modern. They didn't sacrifice character for their recent renovations, clearly. Service throughout my stay was also very nice. Everyone spoke excellent English - likely better than my own, really - and requests were handled quickly, competently, and with a smile. The location of the hotel couldn't be better, either. It's just a block off of Unter den Linden, and just a short walk to the Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island, the Tiergarten, the Holocaust memorial, and other sites. There's plenty of shopping and dining nearby, as well as plenty of public transport options right outside the door. Dining in the hotel was quite good, and their breakfast was fantastic. Restaurant on the ground level was very nice also, and the lobby/foyer area at the base of the grand staircase was a nice place to hang out and relax, as well as meet up, with afternoon tea and snacks as well as a full bar. Given the experience we had here and the overall feel and service at the hotel, I found it to be quite well priced, as well. Would highly recommend the Westin Grand Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Still Wonderful After All These Years”
Reviews.Author: Edgemont2
Reviews.Content: In early September we made our second trip to Berlin and based upon our excellent experience there in 2002 we chose to return to the Westin Grand. And again we were extremely pleased with our stay. First, the location is perfect. Located directly on Freidrichstrasse at the corner of Unter Den Linden it is in walking distance of many of the the reasons you come to Berlin for a visit. For those locations which are not in walking distance, a U Bahn station is just a few feet (meters?) away. The hotel itself is both pleasing to the eye and the person. The lobby with its giant staircase makes an impressive statement, and the four efficient elevators will take you to your room with no waiting. The room itself is exceptional with extremely comfortable bedding, attractive furnishings and with one exception a very efficient bathroom. The one exception is the shower which like many European showers is not up to American standards. But that seems to be an European failing, not specifically one of this marvelous hotel. We overlooked Freidrichstrasse from our room which made for an interesting city view. There was no sound from the street which made paying for the upgraded garden view unnecessary. The breakfast buffet was included and with a wide variety of hot and cold foods, breads, and even German bubbly (sekt) it made for an excellent start to the day. If we ever have reason to return to Berlin it will be to the Westin Grand.

Reviews.Title: “would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: racb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin in mid september after having stayed there in 2005. I have always like the location and was very impressed with the recent improvements. The room was great with a modern updated decor. Most importantly, the staff were very helpful and friendly. This had not been the case in 2005 when folks seemed cold...so I really highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Grand, Remodeled Contemporary Rooms, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DMMGTM
Reviews.Content: I read a couple of not so favorable reviews so was a bit concerned. We used points to pay for our rooms, so was concerned with the room we would receive. The hotel has a luxurious old world charm, yet the rooms were remodeled. A flat screen television, a comfortable bed and modern furnishings were more than adequate. Although the room was smaller than US standards, there was ample storage. The location was perfect for major sight seeing attractions. We did not eat there for we were out and about early each day. We would stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with awesome Beds!”
Reviews.Author: AANGELZZZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Grand Hotel in Aug this year for 3 nights. The hotel foyeur is lovely, with a massive grand stair case running through the middle. Check-in was easy and concierge staff were quite helpful. We were asked if we would like to pay to upgrade our room to a room with a garden view, which would be more quiet- we declined and couldn't have been happier with the room we were put in, facing the Street- very quiet and nice modern room with fantastic-very comfortable beds!!! Bathroom was a little tired looking, but still had nice toiletries. In a great location, within comfortable walking distance to many of the main sites, and very close to Unter De Linden, where you could hop on a bus if you didn't want to walk. Also has a nice pool! Overall, very happy with the hotel. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: jrd18
Reviews.Content: We used points to stay at the hotel and found it to be a fabulous hotel. Extremely clean, heavenly bed was wonderful, and bathroom was great. Location was perfect. Super convenient to the S or U stations and plenty of food choices right around the hotel. Food at the hotel is pricey but what hotel restaurant isn't expensive? Service was great too. No complaints and definitely recommend, this was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless”
Reviews.Author: pengemex2
Reviews.Content: Good location not too far from central things. Beautiful building, great service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: PSCAustin
Reviews.Content: There were both positive and negative aspects to our stay at the Westin. When we checked in, the receptionist tried to get us to move to a more expensive room, claiming it would be far quieter than the room to which we were entitled. We decided to refuse the offer. As it turned out, the room could not have been quieter. While the location of the Westin Grand was ideal, we found small amenities missing that should have been available in a hotel of the Westin's calibre. There was no luggage rack whatsoever, no hooks on the back of the bathroom door and most shocking of all, not one reasonable space to place folded clothing. Even though we had gotten an extremely reasonable rate for the room, you would have expected those basic items in any room at a Westin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located, Comfortable but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: ronfaddison
Reviews.Content: We booked through the Starwood web guarantee that if there is a better like for like offer available than on their own web site then they will match it and then deduct 10%. I don't understand the logic or the mechanics of hotel pricing but a non-Starwood site offered an exceptional price and the hotel chain honoured their promise. It was our second visit to the hotel and we were less impressed than first time round. The room was well furnished and a reasonable size although there was only one seat - in a double room! There was a safe, a mini-bar (with no price list), good lighting but mediocre air conditioning. The bathroom was good but at least one set of the bath towels was well past its best. The hotel is very well situated just off Unter Den Linden which may well be the best part of the city for tourists. There is a U-Bahn station just outside the entrance. The breakfast was good but try to get an inclusive B&B rate for it cost 28 Euros a head (we had it once in four mornings but if the hotel had offered it at something like 20 Euros we would probably have had it every day - as I have said I do not understand hotel pricing). That takes me nicely to the overall prices on offer! There was a bottle of water sized 75cl on offer in the room for 8 Euros 50 cents. I have travelled the world but I never ever come across such an extravagent mark up. Does anybody actually buy this? A small beer (30cl) in the foyer was 5.50 Euros and a slightly larger beer was 8.50 Euros. Internet access was 7.50 Euros for an hour or 19.50 Euros for 24 hours. I could pay these prices but I will not out of principle. Fortunately there are alternatives nearby. We had a good stay and The Westin is certainly a high quality hotel by any standards but for some rather indefinable reason it failed to charm us on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Alcopop
Reviews.Content: This is a five star hotel at reasonable prices; really close to everything from a siteseeing point of view; Brandenburg Gate is a few minutes walk, as is Museum insel and Checkpoint Charlie. We stayed for 4 days and didnt need to use public transport once - all the main things to do and see are right on your doorstep. The beds (which they have trademarked as "Heavenly beds" !) are unbeliveably comfortable and the rooms are clean, modern and of a decent size. We only had one drink at the bar (£30 for a bottle of red) and didnt eat there. It did all look very pricey and to be honest, there are plenty of places to eat and drink nearby for better use of your Euros. My one and only complaint is the view (we could see the patched up roof of the building opposite) but that is a tiny price to pay for such a lovely hotel that really is close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Holiday in Westin Grand Berlin”
Reviews.Author: EnginEVSEN
Reviews.Content: i was in Westin Grand Berlin 2006 christmas with my couisen. it was really nice experience for me.Hotel is located in city center. The only problem is there is no sits on the beakfast and somtimes you sould wait to get a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RPKVancouver
Reviews.Content: Top Class hotel in Berlin. Only 20 minutes from the airport, about a 20 euro cab ride. From the moment you enter the hotel, all of the staff are very helpful and friendly. The main entrance is very beautiful with a large open area bar. The room was totally updated clean and modern. This hotel is in a very central location to all attractions in Berlin. The breakfast buffet although very good was a little pricey at 28 euros per person. There is a nice restaurant around the corner on the main street which was very good at 38 euros for a family of four versus, 112 euros. Very beautiful and historical city worth visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Christos M
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this hotel is its location. Perfect located at Friedrichstraße and Unter den Linden is simply close to everything. I had the impression that the building seemed a little old and the carpets a little outdated. On the other hand the rooms had everything you need and especially I really enjoyed a fantastic mattress and pillow something very important for people like me who spend a lot of time in hotels for business purposes, simply because you can have a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Impressing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vallyty
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Walking distance to Brandenburger Tor and in the same street as Checkpoint Charlie. A short walk to excellent shopping and som of the best restaurants in Berlin. My room was fine and quiet, with a view over the hotel garden. Westin Grand is undergoing a successful renovation. The style is impressing. Kind and good service from all employees I met.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zmeczonka
Reviews.Content: I know that the hotel is currently undergoing a significant renovation and guests' opinions depend on a type of room they get. We were lucky, got a fresh and new double room on the 3rd floor. We loved the hotel's location and the area. The room was quite large, had a huge, lovely bed and was nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: sptl
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin July 2006 (for the worldcup final) and I decided to return because I loved the city. For my first stay I stayed at the Steigenberguer hotel, quite nice, but I didn't love the location so for my second visit I decided to go to the Grand Westin, since Westin had never let me down. I browsed their site and I saw amazing pictures, great rooms, very modern... an amazing hotel! When I got there, and my room was asigned I was in shock! My room was in the furthest wing from the lobby and it couldn't have been worse, it literally was more than 50 years old, the beds were very stiff, the bathroom was not very clean and it was very disfunctional. After going through a lot of talking with the managers they changed our room, but it was still quite old (like 30 years) and not much of a 5 stars room. I must say as well that location was incredible, and the service wasn't bad. But if you would tell me about going another time there I would really reconsider it. I must recommend the adlon hotel, right in the brandenburg gate, and an awesome 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Benchmark for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Frankie-the-Hun
Reviews.Content: After staying in a not so "grand" hotel in the German capital as the name might have suggested, the Westin Grand was a pleasant surprise! When I asked for a quiet room I was upgraded to a room with garden view free of charge. The rooms are ideal for business travel. It's possible to work and relax in convenient and comfortable surroundings, no big fuzz about "designer" somethings... And it's soooo QUIET right in the center of Berlin! Unless you step outside. The location is extraordinarily good for sightseeing as well as for doing business. And the champagne breakfast is a real treat...

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: bmwlya
Reviews.Content: Following a disatrous experience at the Westin Turnberry last month the Westin Grand Berlin restored my confidence in the Westin Group We arrived at 1010 am following an early flight form Terminal 5 Heathrow (superb incidentally, with no delays) to find our suite not only ready but containing complimentary flowers champagne and chocolates Fro the moment of exiting the courtesy car at the hotel we were treated like royalty. The Concierge was superb and set the standard of service throughout our stay. All staff we met could not do enough but without being over the top The furnishings and cleanliness throughout was excellent and someone is doing a good job in managing all of this and there was not a complaint thoughout the weekend The food was good ,well presented and whilst expensive you never felt you were being ripped off; the beers and wines tip top The Hotel is situated off the Unter den Linden on Friedrichstrasse and used to be the place to stay for the top communist politicians pre 1989. A thoroughly good hotel offering excellent service and well recommended

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: proodle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in late April 2008 and it was a pleasure. The internal architectural structure is beautiful, friendly staff and room was very pleasant. Be warned that the pool is being renovated at present, so you can't use it. Also, I got a room overlooking some tired concrete roofs - not sure if better views are available upon request...

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: YukonRoadKing
Reviews.Content: The Westin Grand is a bit of a contradiction. Its location is outstanding, right at Freidrichstrasse next to the fabulous Gallerie Lafayette department store in what used to be East Berlin, walking distance to Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag and Checkpoint Charlie, etc. The hotel continues to undergo renovations and expansion. During our 5 day stay, the concierge was only available during the day, which is bizarre for a hotel of this class. There was no one at the concierge desk who knew what they were doing during the early evenings when we came back. I don't know if someone is on vacation or the hotel is just cutting corners. We asked for and got a better room than we were given at first, which was noisy and not impressive. We got a slightly better room than standard which faced the inner courtyard and gardens. Breakfasts were very good. There was just something lacking in terms of service quality and ambience. It really comes down to what you paid for your room which raises (or lowers) your expectations. If you can get this hotel for a good price, you'll be content. If you pay for what you thought was a 5 star hotel, you won't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, recently refurbished”
Reviews.Author: SDParis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March on business. The hotel is situated in the old East German quarter. In the local area you have lots of great shops and it is about 600 metres from the famous Checkpoint Charlie. It’s a great spot. The lobby is lovely and reception is very friendly and efficient. The rooms are all recently renovated with flat screen television and nice décor. I also understand they are finishing the spa in May which will complete the renovations in the hotel. I thoroughly recommend this hotel if you are spending some time in Berlin and especially if you plan to visit the high end shops and department stores. The Buggati dealership is right across the street and they have the Veron supercar on display for the car fans. The only issue I can think of is that it on the other side of town from the airport; it’s about 25 euros in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: shamrock317
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for one night, but I have just got around to writing my reviews. This was our first hotel in our visit to Germany. Although it was the most expensive, it was our least favorite in room quality. The rooms were tired and small. The location (wish there was a side door off Unter den Linden) was great and the breakfast was AWESOME! I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is not going to spend much time in the room and wants a central location with excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpckac
Reviews.Content: Stayed on an SPG deal for $50 and got a brand new room (which was superb, wonderful bed too). The only building work going on now is in the pool area (finishing in May) so all the other public areas are clear. The Westin is a stunning hotel, with a really lively upmarket piano bar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: globedecker
Reviews.Content: Note: The hotel is in the middle of a renovation so all this may change soon. We booked a Starwood Preferred Guest point stay online. The bulk of the hotel is in the middle of a renovation. Most of the lobby was blocked off, only one restaurant was open, and there were hardly any guests at the hotel. That being said though, our room was newly renovated, looked and smelled brand new, was appointed with modern furnishings, had what seemed like new linens, and had virtually no signs of wear. We heard virtually no construction noise during our 3 night stay. Although many of the facilities were reduced, room service was in full operation and arrived quickly, the front desk staff was helpful, and the bell staff eager to please in helping us to rapidly get a power adapter and ethernet cable. The best part of the hotel is the location. It is about 2 blocks from the Brandenberg Gate, right across the street from a series of three luxury malls, 50' from a U-bahn stop, and about a 15 minute walk from museum island. Overall a very pleasant stay, and an absolute bargain at only 7,000 SPG points per night!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, still adhering to Communist service standards”
Reviews.Author: Flitcraft
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for eight nights during a business conference. I did so partly because it was very convenient to my conference and partly because I knew it had been the flagship fancy hotel of East Germany during the GDR. The public spaces--especially the lobby--are beautiful, but the rooms are sadly in dire need of renovation. There's an air of shabbiness about the room fixtures and furnishings. Breakfast was okay but overpriced even by European chain hotel standards, especially with the cafes of Unter den Linden only steps away. That's the main plus of this hotel--great location in the heart of Mitte, with an express bus from the airport stopping only a block away. And almost everything I wanted to see in my off hours was an easy walk from the hotel. Service, however, is appalling for a chain hotel of this calibre and price range. When I arrived at 1 pm, I was told that I couldn't check in till 3. That's not unreasonable. I was told to leave my bag at the front desk and it would be taken to my room when I came back. Well, arriving at three, I checked in, got a key, walked into the room, but surprise! My luggage wasn't there, though somebody else's was. Traipsed back to the front desk, waiting for the front desk staff person to finish a phone call. When I told him about the problem, he asked "Are you sure?" C'mon, the one thing people are likely to be really sure of is what their suitcase looks like. They issued me a new room key and told me to wait for a bit till someone could help locate my bag. Half an hour later, waiting in the glittering lobby, I had to get in line again at the front desk and ask when someone could help me. This time I was told to accompany a non-English speaking guy into the baggage room and he pantomimed to me to see if my luggage was there. Frankly, as a woman traveling alone, I wasn't crazy about being alone n a secluded part of the hotel with a male staffer. But it was equally disturbing that hotel guests' property wasn't better secured. Honestly, I could have taken as many bags as I wanted for all they cared. As it turned out, my bag wasn't there. Back to the front desk, who suggested that I go back to my room and when the bag was found, they'd call me. Two hours went by without a call. I asked to speak to the manager and was told that I could file a lost baggage claim for compensation as long as I had proof of the contents of my bag. I think that's about when I lost it. After a small but well earned public tantrum, the manager said he would look into the situation himself. Twenty minutes later, they found the bag--apparently another guest found it in his or her room and had brought it down to the main desk hours earlier. I don't have to have effusive service to be happy, but this was in the Fawlty Towers category.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal hotel in amaziningly good location”
Reviews.Author: ditsy
Reviews.Content: A bit like an airport terminal hotel with groups arriving and leaving., Excellent breakfast buffet and superb location. They are presently refurbishing so lots of scaffolding and noise. Concierge only just helpful. Its very impersonal. The lobby is overpriced but there are many good bars and cafes outside nearby. Taxi cab rank right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: juninho_d
Reviews.Content: Westin's are normally of a pretty good quality and this hotel seemed fairly typical of the brand.. Most of the expected amenities were present and correct and my stay was comfortable enough.. I had a day to kill in Berlin and booked the Westin as a base.. I chose it because a) it offered a good rate (the Grand Hyatt was twice the price), b) I participate in the Starwood preferred guest programme and c) my previous experience of the brand was +ve. Firstly, I only really used the room as a base, so I didn't use most of the hotel's facilities and cannot comment on food/beverage/service etc.. The room (a renovated one) was nice enough, if a little "gold and brown" (as is the whole hotel, which can feel a little old style).. But comfortable, nonetheless.. the amenities were as expected.. Located in what used to be part of East Belin, the hotel's location was absolutely fantastic for a walking tour of the main parts of the old Berlin centre (Mitte).. certainly, in my opinion, in a better location that the Am Zoo area (in the former West Berlin) if you want to see the sights.. The hotel is close to a U Bahn station, so you can also explore further afield using a day pass for the U-bahn and s-bahn.. Luggage service and valet parking all worked as it should. Bottom line.. nothing particularly worng with my stay,,

Reviews.Title: “Outstadinng Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickyaboutHotels
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this extremely well-located hotel in Oct 2007. I found the staff to be extraordinarily friendly and were incredibly helpful in handling a pickpocketed wallet episode. The lobby atrium was magnificent and the location could not have been better. The room was modern, well-equipped (except as noted below) and had excellent temperature control. However, the mattress on our bed was probably the worst I have slept on since my college days. It must have been 30 years old and sagged in the middle. How a hotel of this caliber could have provided such a mattress is beyond my comprehension. Another negative, was the lack of ice machines.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: REDSOXRULE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Grand this past weekend during my trip to Berlin to run the marathon. As a family member of a Starwood Hotels employee I have stayed at many Westin properties and this one was about in the middle in terms of quality. On the plus side, the location was great. It is close to public transportation, close to many of the city attractions and close to the start of the marathon. It also was great to have access to the spa and pool before and after the race. I also agree with many posters that the breakfast was great. They also did not charge me for my 7 year old son and he eats quite a bit. On the negative side, was the fact they did not change towels on one day and only stocked the bathroom supplies once for a 3 night stay. Additionally, room service for a pot of coffee took 1 hour. I stayed in an unrenovated room with a view out the window onto Fredrichstrasse. This was nice since I could see a portion of the race route and could watch roller bladers and runners go by from my window. Overall the stay was just above neutral.

Reviews.Title: “positives outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: Levoyageur
Reviews.Content: I can agree with some of the previous postings, but we had an excellent stay here last week. The rooms may not be huge, but they are well furnished and decorated, with quiet efficient aircon and amazingly comfortable beds. There was a faint hint of sulphur in the bathroom, but it wasn't a problem, and the room had good fittings with a powerful shower and excellent lighting. We found the staff courteous and helpful. The breakfast was amazing- although expensive at 28 Euro. I have never seen such a wide choice of fruits,meats ,fish ,breads, pastries and hot foods, as well as eggs and omelettes cooked to order. Although the hotel was busy we never had a problem finding a table free. The best thing about the hotel for a tourist is the position- perfect for exploring the eastern city on foot.The Brandenburg Gate was about 400 yds, as was the Museum Island. The beautiful Gendarmesmarkt with its restaurants and bars was even nearer. To get to the western sights the number 100 and 200 buses stop 50 yds away, and they go to all the places a tourist would want. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel. Get a good deal on the net that includes breakfast ( we got one with GTA) and you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet66
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Westin Grand Hotel in Berlin on 4 occasions now and apart from the problems with the credit card payments on departure I only have good things to say. The location of this hotel is brilliant, round the corner from the Unter den Linden and all the sites. The staff are very helpful and pleasant, the rooms are spacious and clean and the beds are so comfy you struggle to get up in the morning. The breakfast is the best I have ever had anywhere, it's the only place I have ever stayed where you can have a bucks fizz in the morning. It is also the only hotel I have stayed in where i can get a Grasshopper cocktail. If I have one critisism to make it is the pool is far too cold, you can only stay in there for a short while. Having said that I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again just for the pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: kleim27
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a very nice location. The service is above average, and the indoor pool is the nicest I have ever seen. The only downside to this hotel is the small rooms with no king-size beds. The rooms are nice and quiet, but not what you would expect after walking in to the stunning lobby.
